name: Alan Scholnick
bio: Alan Scholnick is a certified executive and leadership coach who brings more than three decades of global finance and leadership experience to his coaching practice. He spent over 28 years at IKEA, where he progressed from Controller and Tax Manager to VP of Finance for the U.S. market, and ultimately to Global Competence Development Director for the CFO Community and Global Business Operations Transformation leader based in Sweden and the Netherlands. In these senior roles, Alan led large-scale leadership development initiatives across IKEA's global finance organization, including programs designed to build bench strength, develop conscious and intentional leaders, and strengthen soft skills and leadership capabilities within a complex, multinational context. His career also includes finance leadership roles at George Weston Bakeries and Caterpillar, as well as public accounting experience. A CPA with a Master of Science in Taxation from Philadelphia University and credentials including CGMA and MST, Alan combines deep financial acumen with a passion for developing people and organizations.  Alan holds a Master of Arts in Organizational Leadership with a focus on Servant Leadership from Gonzaga University and is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credentialed by the International Coach Federation and a Certified Professional Coach (CPC) through iPEC, specializing in Core Energy Coaching. He also holds certifications in Leading With Heart and Taking Flight with DISC. Alan's coaching philosophy centers on creating a trustful, nonjudgmental space where leaders can reflect, explore possibilities, and reconnect with their values, motivations, and strengths. He believes in growing people and business together by leading by example and helping clients shift perspective to identify new possibilities in every situation. Alan specializes in leadership coaching, professional development, conscious leadership, team development, and communication, working with everyone from C-suite executives to emerging leaders.  Currently, Alan serves as a leadership coach at UCLA Anderson School of Management, supporting MBA students in developing transformative leadership skills, and as a leadership coach and consultant with AFFEXCO Global, partnering with businesses worldwide on sustainable development and transition. He is also an adjunct professor of accounting at Temple University's Fox School of Business, a volunteer coach for the ICF Ignite Program and The Honor Foundation supporting veterans, and a board member for Integrate for Good and the Greater BucksMont Chamber of Commerce. A former global alumni mentor at both Gonzaga University and Temple University, Alan is a connector and servant leader committed to helping individuals and teams lead with intention, clarity, and impact.
headline: 28+ Years in Global Finance, Former VP at IKEA

name: Alex Rood
special_services: ADHD; Anxiety / Depression; Buddhism; Burnout; Change Management; Conflict Resolution; DE&I / Belonging; Educators; Entertainment Professionals; Executive Coaching; Extroverts; Finance Professionals; Healthcare Professionals; HR Professionals; Introverts; Leader Management; Leadership; Leadership / Professional Development; Marketing Professionals; Nutrition; Performance Management; Storytelling; Technology Professionals; Trauma; Wellness; Work / Life Balance
bio: Alex Rood brings over 13 years of strategic customer success, account management, and coaching leadership across SaaS, FinTech, and digital transformation environments. His career spans high-impact roles at notable organizations including Coinbase, where he earned the 2022 Impact Award for cross-functional leadership and built onboarding workflows that drove over one million wallet activations, and Royal Caribbean Group, where he managed a portfolio of national enterprise accounts generating more than $500 million in annual revenue and delivered a 15 percent revenue uplift through strategic planning and executive business reviews. Alex has also closed and managed multi-six-figure enterprise contracts at LifeLabs Learning, generating over $1 million in rebooking revenue while maintaining 100 percent client retention over 18 months, and at Worksuite, where he successfully onboarded more than 50 enterprise SaaS customers. Additional experience includes roles at SapientRazorfish, MotionPoint, and Mindbloom, where he consistently demonstrated expertise in driving adoption, mitigating risk, and delivering exceptional renewal and expansion outcomes.  Alex holds an MBA in Marketing Management and Finance from Nova Southeastern University and a Bachelor's degree in Business and Sociology from The University of Texas at Austin. He earned his Professional Coaching Certification from the University of Miami and is credentialed as a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) through the International Coaching Federation, as well as a Practitioner of Neuro-Linguistic Programming through The Worldwide Institutes of NLP. Currently serving as Coach, Growth Partner, and Relationship Manager at Deliberate Self, Alex partners with over 50 leaders and small businesses, managing full lifecycle coaching engagements and driving measurable behavior change and operational improvements. Through his Die Fulfilled coaching platform, he helps individuals stop performing and start living by guiding them to their truth, their body, and the courage it takes to live a life of integrity and fulfillment.  Alex's coaching philosophy is grounded in creating and driving trusted partnerships and account relationships, blending his deep operational expertise with a human-centered approach. His proven track record of building high-trust client relationships, leading complex implementations, and delivering results in fast-paced, high-stakes environments makes him a credible and valuable partner for leaders navigating growth, transformation, and personal development. Whether working with executives, founders, or teams, Alex brings a practical, outcomes-oriented mindset that translates insight into action and sustainable impact.
headline: 13+ Years in Customer Success & SaaS

name: Alexis Helfman
special_services: Burnout; Change Management; Conflict Resolution; Jewish People; Mindfulness and Meditation; Stress Management; Wellness
bio: Alexis Helfman is a PCC ICF-certified life and leadership coach who has worked with more than 100 clients, including CEOs and small business owners in fashion, interior design, and food and beverage, as well as managers at Fortune 500 companies such as Tesla, Mastercard, Google, Starbucks, Netflix, and Uber. Before launching her coaching practice, Alexis spent several years focusing on customer experience in New York City startups and hospitality firms. She was part of BaubleBar's early launch team as employee number ten, where she rose to Senior Manager of Customer Experience, overseeing an innovative customer experience strategy and a team of thirteen. Her work included building meaningful customer relationships, implementing scalable processes, and driving impactful initiatives that doubled average order value. Alexis also consulted on brand and customer experience strategy for hospitality clients, including 1 Hotels and Laws of Motion, and gained experience at Booking.com and Brand Bureau.  Alexis holds a Master's degree in Hospitality Management with a concentration in Brand Strategy from New York University and a Bachelor of Arts in English with a business minor from Tulane University. She earned her Certified Professional Coach credential from iPEC Coaching, where she trained in Core Energy Coaching and Energy Leadership, and is an Energy Leadership Index Master Practitioner. Her Professional Certified Coach designation from the International Coaching Federation reflects her commitment to coaching excellence. Currently, Alexis is the Founder of Alexis Brooke Coaching and serves as a Personal and Professional Development Coach with Boon Health, where she supports employees at the intersection of mental wellbeing and professional development.  Alexis takes a holistic, supportive approach to coaching, helping ambitious achievers seeking more balance and wellbeing in their lives. Her clients—whether small business owners, creatives, teachers, doctors, or professionals in the nonprofit space—share a desire to focus on themselves and what really matters most. Drawing on her people-first energy and belief that each client is a bright light, Alexis partners with individuals to achieve personal and professional goals through personalized coaching. Her approachable, warm style and deep experience in customer experience and hospitality bring a unique blend of empathy, strategic insight, and practical support to every coaching engagement.
headline: Coached Leaders at Google, Netflix, Tesla, Uber

special_services: Anxiety / Depression; Change Management; Emerging Leader; Entertainment Professionals; Leader Management; Leadership; Leadership / Professional Development; Manager & New Manager; New Work Environment; Performance Management; Relationship Management; Stress Management; Success Capacity; Succession Planning; Thriving in daily life; Work / Life Balance; Yoga

bio: Alina Costache brings more than 20 years of leadership experience spanning Fortune 100 companies and high-stakes environments. She served as Executive Director and Chief Storyteller at J.P. Morgan, where she shaped executive narratives and strategic communications. Prior to that, Alina spent over two years at Korn Ferry leading culture, change, and communications initiatives and top team performance work for marquee clients including Microsoft, Google, Johnson & Johnson, GSK, Sanofi, and Partners Group. Earlier in her career, she held senior communications roles at Erste Group Bank AG, managing international press relations for the largest banking group in emerging Europe and designing communication strategies to support business turnarounds. Since 2011, Alina has been the founder of OdysseyLabs, where she advises senior executives and leadership teams navigating complexity and change.  Alina holds a Postgraduate Diploma in Global Business from Saïd Business School, University of Oxford, where she was awarded the University of Oxford Saïd Prize for the Best Dissertation. She also studied International and Diplomatic Affairs at Alma Mater Studiorum – Università di Bologna and earned a degree in Political Science with a focus on International Relations from the University of Bucharest. Her professional credentials include an Advanced Practitioner Diploma in Executive Coaching (Merit) from the Academy of Executive Coaching and a Group Coaching Diploma in Systemic Psychodynamic approaches from KDVI. Currently, she is pursuing an MSc as a Psychotherapist in advanced clinical training (Gestalt) at Metanoia Institute, deepening her expertise in psychological therapies.  Alina's coaching philosophy centers on helping leaders expand their capacity for discomfort to stay adaptable under pressure. She integrates neuroscience, psychology, and real-world executive experience to support leaders in shifting from defensiveness to interdependence, from playing small to taking smart risks, and from scarcity thinking to co-creating new possibilities. Her methodology focuses on self-mastery, relational intelligence, and systemic adaptability—enabling clients to manage mindset and emotion, make hard calls together, and act decisively without a playbook. Trusted by senior executives at Microsoft, Google, and J.P. Morgan when the stakes are highest, Alina partners with leaders and teams through one-on-one executive coaching, team effectiveness engagements, and bespoke leadership programs. Her unique blend of Fortune 100 operating experience, strategic clarity, and deep psychological insight makes her a credible and impactful guide for leaders navigating chaos and driving lasting transformation.
headline: Former Executive Director at J.P. Morgan, Korn Ferry

bio: Allegra Baider is an executive and leadership coach and consultant who brings deep experience from mission-driven organizations and public policy leadership. As Deputy Director of Public Policy at Community Change, she led strategic initiatives from 2013 to 2021, shaping advocacy and policy work that advanced economic justice and equity. Earlier in her career, Allegra served as a Senior Policy Analyst at the Center for Law and Social Policy and completed a Presidential Management Fellowship at the U.S. Department of Labor, building a strong foundation in workforce development, social policy, and systems change. Her work has been published widely, including pieces on child care policy, Social Security expansion, and career pathways funding.  Allegra holds a Master of Social Work from the University of Michigan and a Bachelor's degree in Anthropology and Women's Studies from McGill University. She is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credentialed by the International Coaching Federation and is certified in the Leadership Circle Profile, a developmental assessment tool for leaders. Since founding Spark Change Consulting LLC in 2021, Allegra has partnered with mission-driven organizations to maximize the impact of leaders at all levels and cultivate the development of creative, inspired, and connected teams. Her coaching philosophy centers on helping leaders navigate complexity, deepen self-awareness, and build cultures of trust and collaboration.  Allegra's unique blend of policy expertise, organizational leadership, and coaching mastery makes her a credible and valuable partner for leaders seeking to expand their influence, lead with authenticity, and drive meaningful change. She brings a warm, grounded approach that honors both the strategic and human dimensions of leadership, empowering clients to lead with clarity, courage, and connection.
headline: Policy & Nonprofit Leader

bio: Alyson Schwartz brings over 25 years of experience spanning marketing, leadership development, and organizational transformation. She spent six years at the Greater Philadelphia Chamber of Commerce, advancing from Director of the Small Business Department to Vice President of Marketing, where she led large-scale, cross-functional initiatives and built strong relationships with stakeholders ranging from CEOs to emerging professionals. Earlier in her career, Alyson held marketing and special events roles at Macy's East, the Philadelphia Business Journal, and Greater Media Radio. In 2005, she founded Alyson Schwartz Events, leading the firm for over 15 years before launching AlignAbility Coaching & Consulting in 2019, where she now partners with organizations to co-create high-impact employee development programs through one-on-one coaching, leadership development, and team coaching.  Alyson holds a Bachelor of Arts in English Literature and Communications from the University of Delaware. She is a trained and certified coach through the Co-Active Training Institute (CTI), one of the world's leading coaching training providers, and holds her Associate Certified Coach (ACC) credential with the International Coaching Federation (ICF). She is also a Certified Professional Co-Active Coach (CPCC) and a Certified Executive Coach through Quantum Endeavors, Inc. Her coaching focus areas include culture alignment, leadership development, conflict management, executive presence, people management, and work-life integration.  Alyson supports leaders at all levels to accelerate their growth by building capabilities and capacity for greater performance and results. Drawing on her interpersonal savvy and hands-on experience managing large teams in the trenches, she coaches leaders to advance professionally, set and achieve meaningful goals, and add measurable value and impact for their teams and organizations. The result is leaders who are engaged, mission-aligned, and equipped to drive high organizational performance and transformation.
headline: 25+ Years in Marketing & Brand Leadership

name: Alyssa Almond
special_services: Educators; Resilience
specialties: ["Educators","Resilience"]
bio: Alyssa Almond is the Founder and Coach at Rooted Rise, where she specializes in coaching highly sensitive, vegan, and creative women through personal and professional challenges. Since 2019, she has created a safe space for clients to cultivate self-compassion, build emotional fluency, strengthen resilience, and make powerful choices aligned with their values. Alyssa also serves as a Coach with Boon Health, guiding clients on career advancement, work-life balance, mental well-being, personal growth, and relationships. Her career of service began in education, teaching bilingual third grade in Manhattan and middle school ESOL in Delaware, followed by nearly a decade as Program Manager at Literacy Delaware, where she trained volunteer tutors and directed instructional programs for low-income, immigrant, and refugee adults. Her commitment to advocacy deepened through roles at Catskill Animal Sanctuary and as Curriculum Designer for the award-winning documentary The Last Pig, where she developed humane education curriculum to inspire compassion and critical thinking.  Alyssa holds a Bachelor of Arts in Psychology from Smith College and a Master of Arts in TESOL from the Middlebury Institute of International Studies at Monterey. She completed a summer residency at the Institute for Humane Education and is a graduate of the Co-Active Training Institute. She holds both the Certified Professional Co-Active Coach (CPCC) credential and the Associate Certified Coach (ACC) designation from the International Coaching Federation. Her coaching philosophy centers on helping clients dismantle destructive beliefs, process stagnant emotions, and engage the wisdom of their bodies, guiding them to release the constriction of who they "should" be and instead live with joy and a sense of belonging.  With finely-honed listening skills and impeccable training, Alyssa supports clients in creating lives they long for—freedom and fulfillment for themselves and meaningful change for the planet. Her unique blend of educational expertise, advocacy experience, and deep commitment to personal transformation makes her a credible and compassionate partner for women seeking to deepen their confidence, honor themselves, and create positive impact for human and non-human animals alike.
headline: COACH FOR HIGHLY SENSITIVE PROFESSIONALS

name: Amanda Saurin
special_services: Technology Professionals
bio: Amanda Saurin is a results-oriented executive with extensive experience spanning talent management, organizational culture transformation, and leadership development across retail, finance, healthcare, technology, and government sectors. Currently serving as Vice President of Talent & Capability at Centene Corporation, Amanda has held senior roles at marquee organizations including Amazon, where she served as Senior Executive Development Leader and Executive Coach, KPMG US as Manager of Talent Management, The Home Depot as Manager of Organizational Effectiveness, and Gallup as Senior Human Capital Advisory Consultant for nine years. She also led Sloan Group International as Chief Executive Officer, setting strategic direction for company growth and positioning the firm as a leader in executive talent development. Throughout her career, Amanda has partnered with C-suite executives and Fortune 500 clients to align people strategies with business goals, cultivate inclusive cultures, and build high-performing teams.  Amanda holds a Master's degree in Industrial and Organizational Psychology from Florida Institute of Technology and a Bachelor's degree in Psychology from Georgia Southern University. She is an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) with the International Coaching Federation and holds an Internal Coach Certification (ICC) from the Hudson Institute of Coaching. Her coaching philosophy centers on leveraging data-driven insights and a practical, outcomes-oriented approach to help senior leaders navigate change, optimize talent utilization, and drive organizational excellence. At Amazon, Amanda achieved a 25% promotion rate among her executive coachees and earned an average rating of 4.9 out of 5 for coaching effectiveness.  Amanda's credibility as a coach is grounded in her proven track record of designing leadership development programs, strengthening succession pipelines, and implementing transformative talent strategies that deliver measurable results. Her expertise in change management, organizational design, workforce planning, and performance optimization enables her to serve as a trusted advisor to executive leadership. Whether guiding leaders through inflection points, enhancing employee engagement, or fostering innovation across departments, Amanda brings a strategic mindset and collaborative approach that supports long-term business success and sustainable growth.
headline: Former Talent Leader at Amazon, KPMG, Home Depot

bio: Amy Kelly Lauer is a seasoned executive and leadership coach who brings over a decade of P&L leadership and operational expertise from marquee retail organizations including Sephora, Kendo Brands, and Gap Inc. As Senior Vice President and General Manager at Sephora, she led the Sephora @ Kohl's and Sephora inside JCPenney partnerships, overseeing complex multi-channel retail operations. Earlier, she served as Senior Vice President and General Manager of OldNavy.com, managing a team of 130 across five functions and owning a $1 billion P&L, and as Vice President and General Manager of Global BananaRepublic.com, where she doubled the U.S. business and exceeded sales and earnings targets for a $310 million global operation spanning the U.S., Canada, UK, Europe, Japan, and mobile markets. At Kendo Brands, she served as Head of Digital and Vice President, building and leading the team responsible for end-to-end eCommerce across five branded sites, paid digital and social marketing, and product management. Her career spans merchandising, digital transformation, strategic planning, and organizational design across start-ups and Fortune 500 companies.  Amy holds a Master of Business Administration from the University of Michigan's Stephen M. Ross School of Business, with a focus on Marketing, HR, and Strategy, a Master's degree in Human Resources Management and Organizational Design from the University of San Francisco, and a Bachelor's degree in Psychology from Hamilton College. She is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credentialed by the International Coaching Federation and is certified in the Center for Creative Leadership's 360° Benchmarks Assessment Suite. As Founder and Leadership Coach at Catalyst & Co, Amy partners with VPs and C-suite leaders across Finance, Marketing, Operations, Product, Sales, and Store Leadership to get unstuck, amplify their impact, and lead high-performing teams. Her coaching blends executive experience, practical frameworks, and reflective guidance tailored to each leader's goals, challenges, and context. She also designs and facilitates custom workshops and learning experiences that strengthen collaboration, communication, and leadership effectiveness for teams and organizations.  Amy's approach is goal-focused and grounded in deep listening, intuition, insightful challenges, and accountability. She guides clients through complex team dynamics, strategic growth, leadership transitions, and career pivots, drawing on her extensive background in P&L management, cross-functional leadership, and organizational transformation. Her practice areas include executive coaching, leadership development, team effectiveness, collaboration, influence, and career transitions, making her a trusted partner for leaders navigating inflection points and seeking to translate insight into measurable results.
headline: Former SVP/GM at Sephora, Gap, Old Navy

bio: Amy Paro is the founder of VIVANCY, bringing over a decade of experience empowering leaders, teams, and organizations to think deeply, act strategically, and solve problems creatively. Her career spans prominent roles at global pharmaceutical and biotech organizations, including Novartis Institutes for BioMedical Research, where she served as Talent Management, Organizational Development & Inclusion Partner, and Takeda, where she led global talent management, leadership development, and integration culture initiatives. Prior to that, Amy spent nearly seven years at Shire in progressively senior roles, including Global Talent Management & Leadership Development Lead, HR Business Partner for US Neuroscience, and Talent & Organizational Development Business Partner for US Commercial. Her work has encompassed leadership coaching, team effectiveness, change management, talent review processes, and designing enterprise-wide learning programs. Amy also honed her organizational development expertise at Brigham and Women's Hospital, where she consulted on team effectiveness and delivered custom learning experiences for thousands of employees.  Amy holds a degree in Women's Studies from the University of New Hampshire and is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credentialed by the International Coaching Federation. She is also a Certified Group Coach through Group Coaching HQ. With a foundation in organizational learning and development, Amy excels at creating environments where bold ideas and sustainable solutions thrive. Her coaching philosophy is grounded in curiosity, a growth mindset, and a passion for meaningful impact, helping clients navigate complexity and unlock their potential. Driven by an insatiable energy and a commitment to practical, creative problem-solving, Amy partners with leaders and teams to achieve lasting transformation and measurable results.

bio: Anais Babajanian is a Fractional COO and business and leadership coach who brings a distinctive blend of Big 4 experience, entrepreneurial success, and operational expertise to her work with professional service firms. She began her career as a CPA and Assurance Associate at PwC, where she performed financial audits for Fortune 100 and Fortune 500 companies, gaining deep insight into what drives business performance and how to identify operational gaps. Anais later applied this analytical foundation as Agency Principal and Director of Operations at ATAB Insurance Services, where over five years she grew revenues by 100% and profits by 200% before successfully selling the business in 2021 for three times revenue. This hands-on experience running and scaling a family-owned agency taught her how to streamline operations, build reliable processes, and create a team culture that supports sustainable growth.  Anais holds a Master of Science in Accounting and a Bachelor of Business Administration in Accounting from the University of Houston. She is a Newfield Certified Coach and an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) with the International Coaching Federation, having completed her coaching training through Newfield Network USA's Coaching for Personal and Professional Mastery program. Her coaching philosophy centers on helping firm owners get out of the weeds and scale their businesses with clarity, systems, and teams they can rely on. She integrates operational consulting with leadership development, recognizing that business growth requires both operational clarity and strong leadership working in tandem.  Currently, Anais serves as a Resilient Business Technical Advisor with the Los Angeles Area Chamber of Commerce and as a Personal and Professional Growth Coach with Boon, where she supports employees at the intersection of mental wellbeing and professional development. Through her consulting and coaching practice, she partners with owners and managers to strengthen leadership, improve communication, delegate effectively, and build high-performing, accountable teams. Whether delivering fractional COO services, one-on-one coaching, or workshops on leadership and team development, Anais is committed to helping business owners stop firefighting and start building businesses that run smoothly, profitably, and sustainably.
headline: Former PwC, Grew & Sold Insurance Agency 3x

name: Andrea Matteson
bio: Andréa Matteson is a certified mental health and emotional wellness coach who brings a unique blend of human resources leadership, organizational development, and holistic coaching to her work with high-achieving professionals. Since 2020, she has served as a Mental Health Coach at Lyra Health, while also maintaining her private coaching practice, Andrea Matteson Coaching, since 2017. Her earlier career includes serving as Human Resources and Wellness Program Manager at the Oregon Shakespeare Festival, where she oversaw recruitment, training, benefits, and wellness programming for an organization of approximately 650 staff and 700 volunteers. Before that, Andréa honed her leadership and operational skills in roles at Hands On Greater Portland, managing corporate engagement and special events for clients including Nike, Adidas, and Intel, and in store management at Starbucks, where she led teams and drove performance in high-profile, fast-paced environments.  Andréa holds a Master of Science in Adult and Continuing Education and Training from Portland State University and earned her HMBA Transformational Coaching Certification with an ICF Accreditation from Health Coach Institute. Her coaching philosophy blends evidence-based cognitive behavioral tools with holistic practices, including Emotion Code energy healing, to help clients release emotional blocks, rewire unhelpful patterns, and reconnect with what truly matters. She has also completed specialized training in Nonviolent Communication and an introduction to racism and hard conversations, reflecting her commitment to compassionate, inclusive practice.  Andréa works best with smart, heart-centered professionals navigating transitions, seeking deeper alignment, or feeling exhausted from over-functioning and overthinking. Her approach combines psychological flexibility, behavior change strategies, and soulful reflection to support clients in finding clarity, calm, and creative power. With a track record spanning human resources, wellness program design, and transformational coaching, Andréa brings both practical expertise and deep empathy to help clients move forward with courage, ease, and authenticity.
headline: Former HR at Nike, Starbucks

bio: Andy Postell brings a unique blend of pastoral leadership, organizational development, and coaching expertise to his work with leaders and teams. Since 2004, he has served as Pastor and Coach with the Methodist Church in the Atlanta Metropolitan Area, where he has led as a church planter, lead pastor, and both internal and external coach. His work centers on guiding individuals and organizations through growth, transition, and the challenges of leading with purpose and integrity.  Andy holds a Master of Divinity from Candler School of Theology, where he focused on theology and theological studies, and a Bachelor of Science in Biochemistry from The University of Georgia. This diverse educational foundation—spanning the sciences and the humanities—informs his holistic approach to coaching and leadership development. He partners with clients to clarify vision, strengthen relational dynamics, and navigate complex decisions with wisdom and practical insight.  With more than two decades of experience building communities, developing leaders, and fostering meaningful change, Andy is a trusted guide for executives, entrepreneurs, and ministry leaders seeking to lead with authenticity and impact. His coaching is grounded in deep listening, thoughtful inquiry, and a commitment to helping clients align their values with their actions to create sustainable, transformative results.

bio: Angela Deney brings a rich background in leadership development and organizational culture, shaped by her work with mission-driven organizations dedicated to education and social impact. She served as Director of Leadership Development at Teach For America, where she designed and delivered programs to strengthen leaders across the organization. Prior to that role, Angela was a Learning and Development Specialist at City Year, honing her expertise in building capacity and fostering growth within teams. Her career began in the classroom as an English teacher with Teach For America and the Clark County School District, as well as internationally at Colegio Internacional in Venezuela, giving her firsthand insight into the challenges and opportunities leaders face on the ground.  Angela holds a Master of Education in Curriculum and Instruction from the University of Nevada-Las Vegas and a Bachelor of Arts in Philosophy, Politics, Economics, and Law from the University of Arizona. She is a Certified Professional Co-Active Coach (CPCC) through the Co-Active Training Institute and an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) with the International Coaching Federation. Currently a coach at Boon Health and in independent practice since 2021, Angela is passionate about leadership development, organizational culture, and educational equity. Her coaching approach is grounded in enthusiasm, curiosity, and a commitment to helping leaders clarify their vision, deepen their impact, and create environments where people and organizations thrive.

bio: Angela Ferencin is a higher education strategist and executive coach with over 30 years of experience spanning grants management, dual enrollment programs, student affairs, organizational leadership, and community engagement. Her career includes senior leadership roles at institutions such as Lehigh University, where she served as Director of Academic Diversity and Outreach, Temple University as Director of Undergraduate Affairs, and Rowan University as Interim Registrar and Special Assistant to the Dean. Angela has also held executive positions outside academia, including Deputy CEO at Spectrum Community Services, Inc., where she brought her collaborative leadership style and commitment to fostering personal and educational development to the nonprofit sector. Throughout her career, she has managed and overseen numerous Federal, State, and County grant programs, including GEAR UP, TRIO Upward Bound, Gateway to College, and dual enrollment initiatives, demonstrating her ability to inspire teams and drive measurable outcomes for underserved populations.  Angela holds a Master of Science in Higher Education Administration from the University of Pennsylvania and a Bachelor of Arts from Rutgers University. She is currently pursuing a Doctor of Education in Educational Leadership and Administration at Rowan University and a Master of Arts in Communication from Johns Hopkins University Advanced Academic Programs. She has also completed the Management Development Program at Harvard Graduate School of Education. As an International Coaching Federation Associate Certified Coach, Angela brings a practical, outcomes-oriented approach to her coaching practice. She founded Scott Strategies LLC, where she serves as a coach, consultant, and keynote speaker, and currently coaches executives at Boon Health while facilitating leadership development as a former Core Group Guide at Chief, a private network for senior women leaders.  Angela's coaching philosophy centers on empowering leaders to navigate complex challenges, strengthen their leadership presence, and create inclusive, high-performing environments. Her extensive background in educational access, diversity and inclusion, and organizational leadership uniquely positions her to support clients in clarifying priorities, building resilient teams, and translating vision into action. With a proven track record of fostering innovation, collaboration, and excellence across higher education and human services, Angela is a credible and trusted partner for leaders seeking to scale themselves and their impact.

bio: Anna Ladd is an executive and leadership development coach with over two decades of experience building and leading high-performing sales teams at marquee technology companies. Her career includes senior leadership roles at IBM, Adobe, Apple, and Blackboard, where she served as Regional Vice President for K12 North America. Anna also held the position of Global Head of Sales at the Co-Active Training Institute, one of the world's leading coach training organizations. Throughout her corporate tenure, she developed expertise in driving revenue growth, strengthening client relationships, and identifying operational improvements that enhance performance and customer satisfaction across education and enterprise sectors.  Anna holds a BS in English Education from the University of South Carolina and has completed rigorous training in coaching and leadership development. She is a Certified Professional Co-Active Coach (CPCC) and holds the Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credential from the International Coaching Federation, reflecting her commitment to the highest standards of the coaching profession. Anna also completed the Co-Active Training Institute's immersive Leadership Program and is a Registered Yoga Teacher, bringing a holistic perspective to her work. special_services: Change Management; Finance Professionals
bio: Anne Stamer is Vice President, Delivery Lead at Keystone Partners, where she leads a high-performing consulting team while managing a portfolio of executive-level clients navigating career transitions. With over 20 years of experience spanning higher education, venture capital, corporate, and nonprofit sectors, Anne has built a distinguished career driving innovation, operational efficiency, and leadership development. She previously served as Director of the Weiss Tech Accelerator at the University of Pennsylvania for two decades, where she supported undergraduates in creating and commercializing innovative technologies, and as Associate Director of the Wharton Entrepreneur Program, where she transformed a fledgling student event into the renowned Wharton Business Plan Competition and raised over $200,000 annually from corporate sponsors. Anne has also contributed her expertise as a Distinguished Fellow with BetterUp and as Spark Factory Program Manager at The Innovation Space, coaching biotech, pharma, and life science founders through startup accelerator programs.  Anne holds a Master of Science in Organizational Dynamics from the University of Pennsylvania and a Bachelor of Science in Hotel Management from Cornell University. She is a Certified Professional Coach (CPC) through the Institute for Professional Excellence in Coaching (IPEC) and has earned certifications in Applied Positive Psychology from the University of Pennsylvania and the Neuroscience of Change from Coaches Rising. As founder of Stamer Coaching and Consulting, Anne specializes in business strategy and executive leadership coaching, helping senior executives, entrepreneurs, and high-potential leaders align their core values with their organization's mission. Her coaching spans career counseling, job search strategy, LinkedIn optimization, personal branding, retirement planning, and board transitions.  Anne's approach is grounded in creating high-touch coaching experiences that deliver lasting professional impact. She brings deep expertise in executive coaching for leaders at every career stage, strategic program leadership, cross-functional team development, and organizational change management. Whether guiding clients through career inflection points, refining business models for early-stage ventures, or developing investor-ready pitches, Anne combines strategic insight with hands-on execution to help visionary leaders achieve measurable growth and sustained success.
headline: 20 Years at UPenn & Wharton, VP at Keystone Partners

name: Ashley Zaslav
special_services: Athletes
bio: Ashley Zaslav is the founder and coach at Integrative Complexity, bringing a distinguished career spanning elite investment firms and executive search to her coaching practice. She began her professional journey at Bridgewater Associates, where she served on the Principles Training Team and in the Office of the CEO, gaining deep exposure to organizational culture and leadership development at one of the world's most respected hedge funds. Ashley then joined TPG as part of Brooklands Capital Strategies, working within the global alternative asset firm on strategic initiatives. Most recently, she was a member of the CEO Practice at Spencer Stuart, the premier global executive search and leadership advisory firm, where she partnered with boards and senior leaders on critical leadership transitions and organizational effectiveness.  Ashley holds an MBA in Leadership and Strategy from NYU Stern School of Business and earned her undergraduate degree in Political Science and Markets & Management from Duke University, where she was a two-time captain of the Duke Women's Soccer Team and a former member of the U-23 United States National Teams. She completed her Leadership Coaching certification at Georgetown University School of Continuing Studies and holds the Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credential from the International Coaching Federation, as well as certification as an EQi 2.0 and EQ 360 Practitioner. Her coaching focuses on high-performance leaders navigating complex transitions, including entrepreneurs, search fund operators, ETA professionals, and mid-career C-suite executives. Grounded in her experience at the intersection of leadership assessment, organizational principles, and strategic decision-making, Ashley helps clients integrate complexity, elevate their leadership impact, and achieve sustainable performance in demanding environments.
headline: Former Bridgewater, Spencer Stuart

bio: Ayana Coston brings more than two decades of leadership development and human resources experience spanning Fortune 500 companies, government contractors, and healthcare organizations. She has held strategic roles at Lockheed Martin, where she served as Program Services Manager leading internal coaching programs and participated in the company's prestigious two-year HR Leadership Development Program, and at Booz Allen Hamilton as a Senior Consultant. Her career also includes executive coaching and talent development positions at Navy Federal Credit Union, the Mid-Atlantic Permanente Medical Group coaching physicians and healthcare leaders, and TASC, where she advanced from HR Generalist to Talent Management Specialist and Leadership Coach. Earlier in her career, Ayana gained foundational HR experience at Aetna and honed her expertise in compensation, diversity, international HR, and university relations.  Ayana holds a Master of Science in Organizational Development from American University and a Bachelor of Arts in Psychology from Temple University. She is a Certified Professional Co-Active Coach (CPCC) through the Coaches Training Institute and an ICF Professional Certified Coach (PCC). Her extensive certification portfolio includes the Leadership Circle Profile, Hogan Assessments, EQi 2.0, MBTI, Luma Human Design, and proficiency in StrengthsFinder, DISC, and FIRO-B, equipping her to deliver data-driven insights tailored to each leader's development journey. Since founding Ayana Coaches in 2020, she has provided individual and group coaching nationwide, partnering with organizations and leaders seeking greater leadership effectiveness and career satisfaction through keynote speaking, facilitation, and expert organizational development consulting.  Ayana's coaching philosophy centers on helping leaders achieve both success and satisfaction by navigating change, clarifying vision, and building cultures that support sustainable performance. With a proven track record across defense, financial services, healthcare, and consulting sectors, she brings deep cross-functional expertise and a practical, human-centered approach that empowers clients to lead with authenticity, expand their impact, and thrive in complex environments.
headline: Former Booz Allen, Lockheed HR Leader

name: Barron Damon
special_services: Entrepreneurs; Nonprofit Professionals
bio: Barron Damon is a Professional Certified Philanthropic Coach (ACC) and entrepreneur with a distinguished career spanning nonprofit leadership, business development, and community impact. He served for over sixteen years as Vice President of Partnership Development at Big Brothers Big Sisters of the Triangle, where he built organizational capacity by identifying and negotiating more than 100 corporate, community, and university partnerships, helped secure funding to sustain and grow a $1 million operating budget, and created the STEMentor Initiative Smart Saturday Academy to level the playing field for disadvantaged children in STEM and leadership. As Managing Partner of Business of Life Coaching and Consulting since 2015, Barron has guided individuals and businesses through transformative journeys in leadership, personal development, entrepreneurial growth, and strategic giving. He also serves as President of the Rotary Club of Morrisville, overseeing the club's vision, strategy, and execution, and works as a New Business Development Executive with Survivor Friendly, supporting cancer patients and survivors.  Barron holds a Bachelor of Arts in Industrial and Organizational Psychology from the University of South Carolina and a Master of Arts in Management from Webster University, complemented by a Leadership Academy Certificate from American Express Leadership Academy. He is certified in Diversity, Equity and Inclusion in the Workplace and holds credentials as an Insurance Agent in Accident, Health, Life, Variable Life, and Variable Annuities. His coaching philosophy centers on helping clients unlock their philanthropic potential by aligning their actions with their values and translating purpose into meaningful impact. Whether working one-on-one or facilitating tailored workshops, Barron specializes in guiding retired professionals, business owners, and course creators to overcome obstacles, clarify their goals, and leave lasting legacies.  With deep expertise in relationship management, fund development, and strategic partnership building, Barron brings a consultative, outcomes-oriented approach to every engagement. His work empowers individuals and organizations to start living their legacy now, making a real difference in their communities while achieving personal and professional fulfillment. Grounded in decades of nonprofit leadership and entrepreneurial experience, Barron is a trusted partner for those seeking transformation, purpose-driven growth, and measurable results.
headline: Former Philanthropy at American Express

bio: Bobby Sparks brings more than 20 years of corporate experience in the telecommunications industry, where he held diverse roles spanning engineering, operations, marketing, and management. His career includes leadership positions at telecom companies ranging from startups to established firms, including serving as Director of Marketing at NetSapiens, Inc., Manager of Test Engineering at Sansay, Inc., and System Test Engineer at Nuera Communications. This breadth of functional expertise—from technical engineering to strategic marketing—gives Bobby a unique perspective on the challenges leaders face across different organizational contexts and growth stages.  Bobby holds a Bachelor of Arts in Psychology from UC San Diego and is a Certified Professional Coach (CPC) through iPEC Coaching, as well as a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credentialed by the International Coaching Federation. He is also an Energy Leadership Index Master Practitioner and holds certifications as an Insights Discovery Licensed Practitioner and an EQi2.0 and EQ360 Assessment Practitioner. His coaching practice focuses on supporting the formation of strong conscious leadership in business and beyond, helping leaders develop greater self-awareness and effectiveness. Fluent in both English and Spanish, Bobby provides executive leadership coaching to clients in the United States and internationally.  After living and working in Santiago, Chile, and Mexico City, Bobby now coaches from New York City. His journey into coaching was inspired by his own transformative experience working with a coach during a career crossroads, which led him to realize that his greatest impact would come from helping others unlock their potential. Grounded in psychology, enriched by cross-cultural experience, and informed by decades of navigating real-world business challenges, Bobby partners with leaders to expand their leadership range, build high-trust teams, and create meaningful impact in their organizations and lives.
headline: 20+ Years in Telecom Engineering & Operations

bio: Brian Falduto is a mental health coach at Lyra Health, where he provides blended care coaching using evidence-based practices to support clients across a wide spectrum of mental health needs. Since 2018, he has also served GBTQ+ clientele through @THEGAYLIFECOACH, specializing in mental health and wellness, emotional well-being, behavioral health, and mindfulness. His coaching integrates presence-based coaching, laser-focused coaching, cognitive behavioral therapy, mindfulness, and meditation, all grounded in the core competencies outlined by the International Coach Federation. Previously, Brian worked as a Digital Crisis Worker at The Trevor Project, providing crisis intervention for marginalized LGBTQIA+ youth struggling with coming out, identity, depression, and suicide.  Brian holds dual bachelor's degrees from Wagner College—a Bachelor of Arts in Theatre Performance and a Bachelor of Science in Arts Administration. He is a Certified Wellness Coach Specialist through the Center for Coaching Certification and completed the Power of Awareness Mindfulness Training Program at the University of California, Berkeley. His coaching philosophy centers on helping clients expand their awareness and develop the emotional competence and mindful capability to navigate life's inherent challenges. He believes wellness is about flowing freely through cultural and human hardships, and his malleable approach is tailored to what works uniquely for each individual.  As a member of the queer community with a long background as a performer, Brian brings deep empathy and authenticity to his work with artists, creatives, and LGBTQ+ individuals. He creates a supportive, compassionate, and judgment-free space where clients address self-esteem, confidence, self-love, shame, boundaries, stress, anxiety, internalized homophobia, gender identity, and relationships. His passion for LGBTQ+ advocacy and storytelling, combined with his lived experience and professional training, makes him a credible and valuable guide for those seeking to discover and embrace their authentic selves.
headline: Mental Health Coach, LGBTQ+ Specialist

bio: Brian White brings over 30 years of leadership experience spanning military service, business operations, and human resources, with a proven track record guiding more than 1,000 clients across diverse industries. His corporate career includes senior HR leadership roles at PPD, where he served as Senior Director and HR Business Partner supporting global bioanalytical, vaccine, and GMP operations, as well as operational management positions at Infineon Technologies and Cypress Semiconductor. Brian's foundation in leadership was forged during his service as a Non-Commissioned Officer in the United States Marine Corps, where he developed the discipline and people-centered approach that continues to define his coaching practice. Since founding Peak Performance Coaching and Consulting in 2020, he has been recognized by Influence Digest as one of the top 20 coaches in the greater Richmond metropolitan area and currently coaches senior executives from Fortune 100 and 500 companies through platforms including BetterUp, ExecOnline, and GrowthSpace, partnering with leading business schools such as Columbia, Stanford, UC Berkeley Haas, IMD, and Yale School of Management.  Brian holds a BA in English Literature and History from The University of Texas at Austin and completed Applied Leadership Studies at the University of Richmond. He earned his coaching credentials from iPEC Coaching and holds the Professional Certified Coach (PCC) designation from the International Coaching Federation, along with the Certified Professional Coach (CPC), Energy Leadership Index Master Practitioner (ELI-MP), and COR.E Leadership Dynamics Specialist (CLDS) certifications from the Institute for Professional Excellence in Coaching. He is also a SHRM-SCP credential holder, reflecting his deep expertise in human capital strategy. Brian's coaching philosophy centers on empowering leaders to replace anxiety with confidence, indecision with action, and insecurity with rock-solid self-belief, enabling them to unlock their ultimate leadership and earning potential.  Through his executive coaching methodology, Brian helps clients navigate complex career transitions, including M&A scenarios at the C-suite level, land dream roles at the salaries they deserve, and develop the key skills needed to inspire teams and deliver lasting organizational results. His work is grounded in proprietary software and cutting-edge methodologies, and he has earned a GrowthSpace Top Expert Award for maintaining a perfect 5/5 feedback rating in career planning programs. Whether partnering with executives on leadership development, guiding professionals through career pivots, or advising small business owners on profit acceleration, Brian combines strategic insight, therapeutic depth, and practical action planning to drive personal and professional transformation.
headline: 30+ Years in Operations & HR Leadership

name: Brie Knox
bio: Brie Knox brings a distinguished career spanning international trade, corporate finance, and executive leadership across both the public and private sectors. She currently serves as Director of the U.S. Commercial Service Tennessee for the International Trade Administration at the U.S. Department of Commerce, where she manages three offices and leads statewide engagement to expand international business opportunities. Her career includes senior roles at JPMorgan Chase, where she evaluated real estate transactions valued from $10 million to $235 million, and at FedEx, where she led a team of seven corporate account managers consulting with large businesses ranging from $2.5 to $37 billion in annual sales to optimize international supply chains and drive profitability. With experience at PNC Bank and multiple tenures with the U.S. Commercial Service, Brie has built deep expertise in international business, trade, financial analysis, negotiations, and business development.  Brie holds a Bachelor of Arts in International Studies and Spanish from the University of La Verne and is currently pursuing her MBA at the Indiana University Kelley School of Business, where she has been recognized as both a Dean's Scholar and a Forté Fellow. She is certified in Organization & Relationship Systems Coaching (ORSC) through CRR Global and is a Prosci Certified Change Practitioner. As co-founder and lead of the International Trade Administration's Team Coaching Program, Brie played a pivotal role in creating an initiative that received the prestigious PRISM Award from the International Coaching Federation in 2021. She also provides executive coaching services to the Treasury Executive Institute, engaging leaders across more than 30 federal government agencies, and volunteers her coaching expertise with humanitarian organizations worldwide.  Brie's coaching philosophy centers on fostering collaborative cultures that fully engage and leverage individual and collective potential. Drawing on her extensive background in international business, leadership, and organizational development, she partners with leaders at all levels to navigate complexity, strengthen decision-making, and unlock sustainable growth. Her unique blend of operational expertise, cross-sector experience, and commitment to empowering principled leaders makes her a credible and impactful coach for executives, teams, and organizations seeking to lead with purpose and vision.
headline: Former JPMorgan, FedEx, Director at US Commerce Dept

name: Caroline Kowalczyk
special_services: Anxiety / Depression; Confidence; Executive Coaching; Leadership / Professional Development; Sales Professionals; Stress Management; Work / Life Balance

bio: Caroline Kowalczyk is a global leadership and executive coach who brings a rich cross-cultural perspective shaped by living in nine countries and her upbringing as a second-generation Polish-American. She holds a Global M.A. in International Relations from Webster University, awarded with a Rotary International Special Initiatives Grant, and a Bachelor of Arts in Political Science and Government from Southern Connecticut State University. Before launching her coaching practice, Caroline worked in the international non-profit sector and in business development on Wall Street with GDS Group, where she witnessed firsthand the powerful connection between mindset, narrative, and performance. Since founding Partner in Purpose LLC in 2020, she has served as a Leadership & Executive Coach, Group Coach with Medley, and Career Coach with Boon Health, supporting growth-minded professionals and leaders in navigating personal and professional transformation.  Caroline is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credentialed by the International Coaching Federation and a Certified Professional Coach (CPC) through iPEC Coaching, where she completed her training in 2018–2019. Her coaching philosophy centers on helping clients align their lives and work with their authentic selves, guiding them toward meaningful personal and professional goals. Fluent in both English and Polish, Caroline draws on her deep appreciation for diverse perspectives and her curiosity about what drives human behavior to create a warm, human-centric coaching experience. She also hosts The Unpurposeful Podcast, extending her commitment to exploring purpose, identity, and growth. Caroline's unique blend of international experience, sales acumen, and coaching expertise makes her a credible and compassionate partner for leaders seeking clarity, alignment, and sustainable impact.
headline: WALL STREET & NONPROFIT LEADER

bio: Carrie Atkin is a leadership coach and facilitator who brings deep operational expertise from a distinguished career in retail and e-commerce. She spent nearly a decade at Sephora, rising to Vice President of Merchandise Planning for Sephora.com, where she led strategic inventory and planning functions across digital and international markets. Prior to Sephora, Carrie held merchandise planning and allocation leadership roles at Ann Taylor and Gap Inc., building a strong foundation in cross-functional collaboration, data-driven decision-making, and scaling high-performing teams. Her experience navigating complex, fast-paced retail environments gives her a unique perspective on the challenges leaders face when balancing strategic vision with operational execution.  Carrie holds a BA in Applied Mathematics and Economics from Harvard University and has earned both the Certified Professional Co-Active Coach (CPCC) credential from the Co-Active Training Institute and the Professional Certified Coach (PCC) designation from the International Coaching Federation. Her coaching philosophy centers on empowering leaders to build courage and confidence, helping them step into their full potential and lead with clarity and authenticity. Currently, Carrie serves as a leadership coach with Mento and Carrie Atkin Coaching, a Senior Consultant and Lead Facilitator with Hands On L&D, and a Board Member with Meemli, where she continues to champion leadership development and organizational growth.  With a proven track record of driving results in demanding corporate environments and a commitment to fostering brave, resilient leadership, Carrie partners with clients to navigate transitions, strengthen their leadership presence, and create meaningful impact within their organizations. Her blend of strategic acumen, coaching expertise, and genuine warmth makes her a trusted guide for leaders seeking to elevate their effectiveness and lead with greater confidence.
headline: Former VP Merchandise Planning at Sephora, Gap

name: Cassidy Nasello
bio: Cassidy Nasello brings a distinguished career in media sales and leadership to her work as a mental fitness coach, drawing on senior roles at some of the most respected brands in publishing. She served as Advertising Director, East at The Atlantic, where she led a team responsible for 50% of company advertising revenue and achieved 20% revenue growth, and as President of Media at Wanderlust Holdings, where she quarterbacked new media initiatives and developed P&L strategy for the global health and wellness brand. Earlier in her career, Cassidy was recognized as the top seller at Condé Nast's The New Yorker, earning "Salesperson of the Quarter" in a record eight months, and grew her Mid-Atlantic territory by 41% at American Express Publishing's Travel + Leisure. Her media career also includes impactful roles at Outside Magazine and Condé Nast's Gourmet Magazine, where she consistently broke new business and won market share through creative partnerships.  Cassidy holds a Master of Business Administration from Columbia Business School and a Bachelor of Arts in Spanish and Sociology from Franklin & Marshall College. She is a Certified Professional Coach through the International Coach Academy and earned her Certified Positive Intelligence Coach (CPQC) designation in December 2021. Additionally, she completed Marie Kondo's KonMari Method Consultant certification program, blending organizational clarity with mental fitness training. Her coaching philosophy centers on empowering high-achieving executive women—particularly those in sales and leadership—to overcome self-sabotaging thoughts, intercept negative self-talk, and reclaim their confident, authentic nature. Using the Stanford-supported Positive Intelligence framework, she helps clients identify mental blocks, strengthen their mental fitness, and transform challenges into opportunities through tools like breathwork, meditation, and empathy-building.  Cassidy's approach is grounded in performance science, positive psychology, cognitive psychology, and neuroscience, with researched assessments that track progress and provide a clear path to growth. She delivers coaching workshops for senior executives and sales and marketing teams at organizations such as Dyson, Dow Jones, Rutgers University, and Birchbox, focusing on collaboration, creativity, focus, and employee retention. Her unique combination of proven sales leadership, executive coaching expertise, and evidence-based mental fitness training makes her a credible and magnetic partner for leaders ready to elevate their performance, build high-trust teams, and achieve sustainable success.
headline: Former Media Sales at American Express, Mars, Columbia

special_services: Addiction / Substance Abuse; Burnout; Change Management; Christians; Conflict Resolution; Creatives; DE&I / Belonging; Extroverts; Group Therapy; LGBTQIA+; Marketing Professionals; Mindfulness and Meditation; Nonprofit Professionals; Stress Management; Wellness
bio: Cator Sparks is an ICF-certified Professional Certified Co-Active Coach (CPCC) who brings a unique blend of editorial leadership and deep personal insight to his coaching practice. He spent 20 years in New York City as an editor and journalist focused on men's fashion, travel, and design, including serving as Editor in Chief at The Manual from 2012 to 2018. Earlier in his career, he worked as an Account Executive at BPMW Agency, handling PR for notable brands. Since launching Cator Sparks Coaching in 2019, he has built a thriving private practice and serves as a Certified Life Coach with Boon Health and Lead Facilitator with EVRYMAN, a national men's wellness organization.  Cator holds degrees in Fashion Marketing from American InterContinental University in London and French Studies from the College of Charleston. He is trained through the Co-Active Training Institute (CTI) and has completed the EVRYMAN Foundations Training Program. Additionally, he is trained in psychedelic integration through Fluence, offering support for clients processing transformative experiences. His coaching philosophy centers on helping men—both gay and straight, with a specialty in the queer community—retire outdated narratives like "boys don't cry" and "man up" to embrace a more authentic, emotionally connected version of modern manhood.  In 2023, Cator founded GBTQ Retreats, creating intentional, substance-free spaces for queer men to heal, grow, and connect. Drawing on his own journey of coming out in 1995 and navigating shame, self-discovery, and acceptance, he partners with men at all life stages—from queer youth finding their path to adults seeking deeper fulfillment in life and love. Through accountability, genuine connection, and a commitment to helping clients come home to their true selves, Cator offers a grounded, compassionate approach to transformation and healing.
headline: 20+ Years in Editorial Leadership

name: Cheryl Mills
special_services: Change Management; New Work Environment; Stress Management; Work / Life Balance

bio: Cheryl Mills is an executive and leadership coach with deep expertise in financial services and technology product management, built over two decades at leading global institutions. She spent the majority of her career at BNY Mellon and its Pershing division, where she held senior roles including Vice President and Head of Product Operations at Broadridge, Head of Technology Product Management for Client Experience Delivery at BNY Mellon, and Director of Technology Products and Services at Pershing. In these positions, Cheryl led global product management teams, drove digital transformation initiatives across major platforms, and successfully migrated over 120,000 clients to new cloud-based environments while retiring legacy systems and delivering millions in cost savings. Her work spanned front-, middle-, and back-office functions, and she partnered closely with C-suite clients at global banks and wealth management firms to deliver superior client experiences and business results. Earlier in her career, she held product management roles at Chase, establishing a strong foundation in financial technology and client-facing solutions.  Cheryl holds a Master of Business Administration in Finance and a Bachelor of Arts in Government and Anthropology, both from William & Mary, and earned a Securities Industry and Financial Markets Certificate from The Wharton School. She is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credentialed by the International Coaching Federation and is Hogan Assessment certified. As an executive and leadership coach, Cheryl partners with senior and emerging leaders to develop their leadership skills, navigate complex business landscapes, and confidently step into more impactful roles. She designs customized coaching programs with tailored assessments, clear goal setting, actionable roadmaps, and candid dialogue to enhance leadership effectiveness, foster career growth, and ensure accountability for results.  Cheryl's credibility as a coach is grounded in her proven track record leading cross-functional teams, driving enterprise-wide adoption of new technologies, and delivering measurable business outcomes in fast-paced, high-stakes environments. Her blend of strategic vision, operational expertise, and deep understanding of client needs enables her to help leaders clarify priorities, expand their influence, and achieve sustainable impact. She also serves as a Member of the Board of Directors for the Women's Venture Fund, reflecting her commitment to empowering leaders and advancing opportunities for growth and success.
headline: Former VP Product Operations at BNY Mellon

name: Chinazom Nwabueze
special_services: ADHD; Anxiety / Depression; Athletes; Buddhism; Change Management; Christians; Conflict Resolution; Entertainment Professionals; Extroverts; Finance Professionals; HR Professionals; Introverts; Jewish People; Muslims; Neurodivergence; Stress Management; Working Mothers
bio: Chinazom Nwabueze is an ICF Master Certified Coach (MCC) and performance psychologist with over 3,500 coaching hours and more than 20 years of experience spanning Fortune 500 enterprises and fast-scaling organizations. As CEO and Founder of Dreamcatchers Performance Limited since 2016, Chinazom partners with C-suite leaders and founders of eight- to ten-figure businesses to navigate crisis, conflict, and major change, helping executive teams align around strategic priorities, accelerate decision-making, and build sustainable operational systems without burnout. Before founding Dreamcatchers, Chinazom held senior program management and consulting roles at leading global financial institutions including Bank of America Merrill Lynch, Royal Bank of Scotland, Deutsche Bank, Credit Suisse, and HSBC, where he led large-scale change management, regulatory optimization, and risk reporting initiatives. He currently serves as a High Performance Leadership Coach at BetterUp, where he has also contributed as a Senior Organizational Psychology Consultant on the People Insight team.  Chinazom holds a Master of Science in Applied Sports Psychology from the University of Staffordshire, an MBA in Business Economics and Finance from the University of Leicester, and a Bachelor's degree in Business Economics, also from Leicester. In addition to his ICF Master Certified Coach credential, he holds the Professional Certified Coach (PCC) designation and is a Financial Risk Manager (FRM). His coaching philosophy centers on measurable outcomes and high-impact results, blending performance psychology, systems design, and strategic facilitation to support leaders at Google, Capital One, Accenture, Salesforce, BlackRock Financial, LEGO, and other global brands. Chinazom's work addresses leadership bottlenecks, team dynamics, sustainable leadership energy, and scalable systems, turning conflict into collaboration and chaos into purpose during periods of transition, rapid growth, or uncertainty.  A recognized thought leader, Chinazom is the host of the podcast "Real Talk – Conversations on Mental Fitness & Leadership" and the author of the Amazon bestseller "Real Talk: A New Approach to Men's Mental Fitness." He is a sought-after keynote speaker at global conferences on leadership transformation and high-performance strategies, and his insights have been featured in BBC, Forbes, Fast Company, and Medium. Grounded in decades of operating experience and a commitment to embedding repeatable leadership behaviors, Chinazom brings both strategic rigor and empathetic partnership to executives navigating scale, complexity, and misalignment.
headline: Former Bank of America, Deutsche Bank, Credit Suisse

bio: Chris Diller is a leadership coach, fractional consultant, and coach supervisor with a career spanning Fortune 500 companies and diverse industries including retail, healthcare, industrial, commercial, and insurance. He spent over a decade at Ecolab, progressing from Principal Software and Electrical Engineer to RD&E Project Leader and ScrumMaster, before joining Target as Lead Product and Agile Coach and later Senior Manager of Coaching. Most recently, Chris served as Director of Product Transformation at Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Minnesota. Since 2018, he has operated Diller Coaching & Consulting, where he helps teams and leaders better understand their work, each other, and themselves. His technical foundation and leadership experience across engineering, product, and agile transformation give him a unique perspective on the challenges facing modern organizations.  Chris holds a Bachelor of Science in Computer Engineering from the University of Wisconsin-Madison and a Graduate Certificate in Executive Coaching from the University of St. Thomas Opus College of Business. He is an International Coaching Federation Associate Certified Coach and holds a Certified Team Coach credential from Scrum Alliance, along with certifications as an ICAgile Authorized Instructor and in Team Momentum Coaching. His coaching practice focuses on product teams and emerging leaders navigating the transition to full-time management, though he has worked with clients ranging from vice presidents and directors to educators and aspiring entrepreneurs. In 2020, Chris became a Founding Partner of the Center for Coaching in Organizations, a nonprofit dedicated to accredited executive coach training and thought leadership. He joined the Board of Directors as Treasurer in 2021 and has served as Board Chair since 2023, actively contributing to the Coaching in Organizations Summit and joining the faculty as an instructor for the Executive Coaching in Organizations Coach Training Program.  Combining his technical roots with deep coaching expertise, Chris is passionate about helping individuals and teams "unleash their awesome" to increase performance, deliver exceptional results, and build products customers love. His approach is grounded in practical, outcomes-oriented methods that enable clients to clarify priorities, strengthen collaboration, and translate insight into measurable impact. Whether guiding leaders through organizational transformation or coaching teams to higher effectiveness, Chris brings credibility earned through years of hands-on leadership and a commitment to developing the next generation of coaches and leaders.

name: Chrissy Marquardt
special_services: Career; Change Management; Confidence; DE&I / Belonging; Emotional Intelligence; Finance Professionals; Leader Management; Leadership; Leadership / Professional Development; Stress Management
specialties: ["Career","Change Management","Confidence","DE&I / Belonging","Emotional Intelligence","Finance Professionals","Leader Management","Leadership","Leadership / Professional Development","Stress Management"]
bio: Chrissy Marquardt is a mission-driven leader with a proven track record spanning economic development, nonprofit management, and financial services. She currently serves as Development and Communications Manager at the Latino Coalition for Community Leadership, where she designs fundraising strategies and shapes communications to advance equity and opportunity for nonprofits in marginalized communities. Previously, as Director of Operations and Engagement at the Columbia Economic Team, Chrissy managed a budget exceeding $1 million annually and led strategic planning initiatives that shaped the region's three-year economic vision. Her earlier career includes leadership roles at Bank of America, where she managed teams of up to ten employees and consistently ranked in the top five to ten percent of personal bankers, and as Executive Director of the South Columbia County Chamber of Commerce, where she increased membership by twenty percent and created a signature Black Friday campaign generating over $13,000 in annual revenue. Her work has driven measurable impact across organizations, from achieving an $8,596 net profit on major fundraising events to leading digital campaigns that resulted in a 400 percent increase in SEO traffic.  Chrissy holds a Bachelor of Business Administration in Finance from the University of Portland and completed Coaching and Leadership training at The Institute for Equity-Centered Coaching, earning her Equity-Centered Leader certification and ICF Associate Certified Coach (ACC) credential. She also holds a CO.STARTERS Facilitator certification, reflecting her commitment to accessible entrepreneurship education. As a leadership coach with Boon Health since 2023, Chrissy partners with senior leaders using equity-centered coaching techniques to overcome self-limiting beliefs, enhance performance, and achieve career growth. She has taught over 100 entrepreneurs through accessible programming and managed teams of 20 to 30 volunteers, bringing an inclusive, results-oriented approach to every engagement.  Chrissy's coaching philosophy is rooted in the belief that inclusive economic development and equity-centered leadership create prosperity for everyone. Drawing on her extensive experience translating complex financial data and strategic initiatives into actionable insights for diverse stakeholders, she helps clients clarify priorities, build high-trust teams, and lead with authenticity. Whether guiding leaders through career transitions, facilitating conflict resolution, or strengthening organizational culture, Chrissy brings a practical, outcomes-focused approach grounded in real-world leadership and a deep commitment to equity and opportunity.
headline: Nonprofit & Economic Development Leader

name: Christiane Drew
special_services: Marketing Professionals
specialties: ["Marketing Professionals"]
bio: Christiane Drew is a certified life, transition, and mental health coach who brings a rich international background and diverse professional experience to her coaching practice. Since 2020, she has maintained her own coaching practice while serving as a Mental Health Coach at Lyra Health and a Leadership Coach at Boon. Her earlier career includes roles as an Account Executive at Brierley & Partners and positions in marketing and executive support at Abril in Brazil. Having lived in four countries and navigated multiple career transitions herself, Christiane understands firsthand the challenges of change, reinvention, and finding clarity amid life's complexities.  Christiane holds an MBA in Business from Penn State University, a graduate degree in International Marketing from Universidade Paulista, and a bachelor's degree in Graphic Design from Faculdade da Cidade. She earned her Certified Life Coach credential from Life Purpose Institute and completed holistic life, career, and executive coach training through Goal Imagery Coaching Academy. She is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) with the International Coaching Federation and is trained in brain-based coaching, NLP, and mindfulness techniques. Her coaching philosophy centers on helping clients gain self-awareness, quiet their inner critic, and rediscover their authentic selves in a safe, judgment-free space.  Christiane is passionate about empowering women to navigate life with confidence and joy, particularly through transitions, career shifts, and mental health challenges. She combines practical strategy with values-based exploration to help clients close the gap between where they are and where they want to be. With a warm, supportive approach grounded in the belief that everyone is whole and capable, Christiane partners with clients to overcome obstacles, build new skills, and move forward with purpose and clarity.
headline: International Coach, Lived in 4 Countries
