name: Coco Duan
bio: Coco Duan is a Certified Executive Life & Leadership Coach who brings over two decades of Fortune 500 and high-growth e-commerce leadership to her coaching practice. As a former senior executive at Walmart eCommerce and Jet.com, she led high-performing teams and owned full P&L responsibility for multi-million-dollar categories, driving exponential growth through strategic assortment expansion, cross-functional collaboration, and data-driven merchandising. Her career spans director-level roles at Chewy and Coupang—where she scaled a retail fashion category to 10X year-over-year GMV growth—as well as brand management positions at Reckitt Benckiser, where she spearheaded the relaunch of the Cepacol brand and led the FastMax caplets launch that generated $200 million in first-year sales. Earlier in her career, Coco honed her strategic and operational expertise at Nike China and other leading global brands, building a foundation in retail marketing, account management, and business development across diverse markets.  Coco holds a Master of Business Administration in Marketing from Duke University's Fuqua School of Business, complemented by study abroad at The London School of Economics and Political Science, and a Bachelor's degree in Business Administration from Shanghai Jiao Tong University. She is an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) with the International Coaching Federation and a Certified Executive Coach and COR.E Leadership Dynamics Specialist through iPEC Coaching. Fluent in both English and Chinese, Coco specializes in helping high-achieving women executives build calm confidence, lead with ease, and create success that truly fulfills. Through her signature CEO of Your Inner Life Method, she guides clients to regulate their nervous systems, rewire limiting beliefs, and rise into aligned action—transforming burnout and self-doubt into embodied confidence and clarity.  Coco's coaching philosophy is rooted in nervous system mastery, emotional intelligence, and mindset rewiring, drawing on her own journey from high-pressure corporate leadership to inner alignment. She partners with senior leaders navigating career inflection points, empowering them to lead from calm rather than chaos and to make decisions grounded in self-trust. As the host of The Unshakable Confidence Podcast and a trusted advisor to over 1,000 women through her weekly insights, Coco combines her proven track record of driving business results with deep expertise in inner leadership, making her a credible and transformative guide for executives ready to cultivate fulfilling, sustainable success.
headline: Former Executive at Walmart, Nike, Chewy

name: Colette Pellissier
special_services: Anxiety / Depression; Burnout; Change Management; Conflict Resolution; Creatives; DE&I / Belonging; Educators; Entrepreneurs; Executive Coaching; Extroverts; Finance Professionals; Government; Healthcare Professionals; HR Professionals; International Business Relations; Introverts; Marketing Professionals; Mindfulness and Meditation; Neurodivergence; Nonprofit Professionals; Performance Management; Storytelling; Stress Management; Succession Planning; Technology Professionals; Trauma; Wellness; Working Mothers
bio: Colette Pellissier brings over two decades of corporate leadership experience to her executive coaching practice, having spent more than twenty years at Mars, Incorporated in progressively senior roles spanning business process design, organizational effectiveness, and strategic planning. At Mars, she led multimillion-dollar projects and global cross-functional teams, championing integrated business processes, diversity and inclusion initiatives, and cultural transformation programs. Her work included executive and leadership development coaching, high-performance team facilitation, and end-to-end supply chain and innovation portfolio management, giving her deep insight into the challenges senior leaders face in complex, matrixed organizations.  Colette holds an MBA from Vanderbilt University's Owen Graduate School of Management, a Master of Arts in Spiritual Psychology from the University of Santa Monica, and a Bachelor of Science in Restaurant, Hotel & Institutional Management from Purdue University. She is a Certified Professional Co-Active Coach (CPCC) and holds the Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credential from the International Coach Federation. Additionally, she is certified in Conversational Intelligence (C-IQ) and DiSC, equipping her with a robust toolkit for leadership presence advancement and communication mastery.  As Chief Evolution Officer of Illuminated Leadership since 2013, Colette partners with executives and leadership teams navigating transformation and seeking what she calls "Success with Soul." Her coaching philosophy centers on conscious leadership, helping clients break free from outdated patterns, align their work with personal definitions of success, and lead with authenticity and impact. Grounded in both rigorous business acumen and a commitment to human potential, Colette designs transformational one-on-one coaching engagements, leadership development programs, and organizational effectiveness services that create extraordinary leaders and generative workplaces where everyone wins.
headline: 20+ Years at Mars, Incorporated

name: Colin Cosgrove
special_services: Burnout; Change Management
bio: Colin Cosgrove brings over 17 years of global technology experience to his coaching practice, including 11 years at Google where he held senior leadership roles across compliance, strategy, and sales. As Head of Compliance for Shopping Ads across Northern and Southern Europe, Colin led high-performing teams through complex regulatory environments and organizational change, building cross-functional strategies that empowered partners to scale with integrity. Before Google, he held account management and business development roles at Qualcomm and Yahoo, developing deep expertise in digital transformation, revenue growth, and client performance optimization across diverse sectors including CPG, B2B, mobile operators, and technology.  Colin holds a Professional Diploma in Executive Coaching and a Professional Diploma in Strategy and Innovation from the Irish Management Institute, and earned his Senior Coaching Accreditation with the European Mentoring and Coaching Council (EMCC) in 2021. He also holds certifications in Artificial Intelligence from the Law Society of Ireland and Responsible AI from Google. In 2024, Colin founded Movizmo Coaching Solutions to help purpose-led scale-ups and leaders adopt AI responsibly without compromising trust, culture, or purpose. He has coached over 30 leaders and teams through acquisitions, post-pandemic transitions, and complex regulatory changes including the EU AI Act, and has trained more than 300 coaches, learning and development professionals, and subject matter experts on integrating AI into workflows to accelerate performance.  Colin's coaching philosophy centers on keeping people at the heart of innovation and change. He partners with executives and leadership teams to lead with integrity, clarity, and confidence in an AI-driven world, blending practical expertise in AI governance, compliance, and organizational readiness with a human-centered approach to leadership development. As a regularly booked speaker on AI governance, AI in learning and development, and leadership, Colin brings a unique combination of technical depth, regulatory insight, and proven leadership impact that makes him a credible and valuable guide for leaders navigating the intersection of technology, ethics, and high performance.
headline: 11 Years at Google, Head of Compliance

special_services: Burnout; Change Management; Conflict Resolution; Creatives; Educators; Entertainment Professionals; Entrepreneurs; Executive Coaching; Extroverts; Finance Professionals; Healthcare Professionals; Jewish People; Marketing Professionals; Marriage & Family Therapy (MFT); Nonprofit Professionals; Performance Management; Technology Professionals; Working Mothers

bio: Daily Lambert is a personal, professional, and parenting coach who brings a rich foundation of Fortune 500 leadership and strategic marketing expertise to her coaching practice. She spent nearly a decade at BD (Becton, Dickinson and Company), a global medical device manufacturer, advancing through roles of increasing responsibility from US Marketing Manager to Senior Product Marketing Manager. During her tenure, she managed multi-million dollar global product lines—including a $56M portfolio that delivered 14% revenue growth—led cross-business unit customer segmentation initiatives with the Chief Marketing Officer, and taught advanced marketing techniques to global teams. Prior to BD, Daily worked at American Express, where she evaluated business growth opportunities for the company's small business division and earned her Six Sigma Green Belt, and at Ogilvy, where she created global integrated direct marketing campaigns for IBM.  Daily holds a BA in Psychology from Yale University, an MBA in Leadership from Columbia Business School, and an MA in Social Psychology from New York University. She is a Certified Professional Co-Active Coach (CPCC) through the Co-Active Training Institute, holds a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credential from the International Coaching Federation, and is a Certified Positive Discipline Parent Educator. She is also an Accredited Practitioner with Integrative Enneagram Solutions. Daily's coaching philosophy centers on helping clients pause for reflection, reconnect to their values and intuition, and gain deeper self-understanding so they can find more calm, meaning, and joy in their daily lives.  Drawing on her academic credentials and real-world experience leading teams and managing complex initiatives, Daily partners with business leaders, consultants, engineers, and doctors across industries ranging from finance and healthcare to retail and education. She also serves as Faculty at Mentora, where she taught leadership courses to global executives and was a guest facilitator in Columbia Business School's award-winning Personal Leadership & Success course. Whether guiding clients through career transitions, leadership challenges, or the demands of parenting, Daily helps them live more consciously and get closer to their goals and dreams.
headline: Former Marketing at American Express, IBM

bio: Daniel Murphy brings more than three decades of leadership experience spanning human resources, finance, and operations across healthcare and media organizations. He served for over fifteen years at Colorado Public Radio, rising to Vice President of Human Resources, where he focused on hiring and retaining top talent, fostering engagement, and supporting the mission of a growing and evolving public media institution. Earlier in his career, Daniel held Chief Financial Officer roles at Sisters of Providence Health System and Latah Health Center, leading multi-functional long-term care operations and driving efficiency through strategic consolidation and expansion projects.  Daniel holds an MBA from the University of Phoenix and a degree in Accounting from the University of West Florida. Since 2022, he has dedicated himself to professional coaching, serving as an Evolution Coach with Truss Builder Coaching, a Fellow Coach with BetterUp, a coach with Boon, and currently as a Certified Professional Coach with MINES and Associates. His coaching approach draws on neuroscience and positive psychology to help professionals overcome self-doubt, limiting beliefs, and biases by reconnecting with their authentic selves and tapping into the power of emotions and intuition.  Grounded in decades of operational leadership and a deep commitment to human potential, Daniel partners with clients to unleash their unique strengths, create confident action steps, and achieve lasting personal and professional growth. His blend of executive experience and evidence-based coaching methods makes him a trusted guide for individuals seeking to move past internal blocks and unlock their full potential.
headline: 30+ Years in HR, Finance, Operations

name: Daniela Boalt
bio: Daniela Boalt is the Director of People at HelloGov AI, where she has been instrumental in scaling the company from an early-stage startup to a fully operational business with a team of 30 people. She built the organization's hiring processes, defined roles, and established the People Operations systems that support daily operations. Drawing on her MBA from the University of Miami Herbert Business School, Daniela tracks business revenue and key performance metrics, analyzing trends to drive company performance and tying these insights back to People Ops to improve workflows, strengthen accountability, and align the team with business goals. Prior to HelloGov AI, she served as Project Manager at B O A L T and founded Daniela Boalt Coaching in 2021, where she continues to support individuals and leaders in their growth and development.  Daniela holds a Bachelor of Science in Psychology from Nova Southeastern University, an MBA from the University of Miami Herbert Business School, and completed the Certified Professional Coach Program at the University of Miami. She is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credentialed by the International Coaching Federation and holds professional membership with the International Positive Psychology Association. Currently, she also serves as a Behavioral Coach and Provider at Intellect and as a Professional Growth Coach at Boon, bringing her expertise to diverse coaching contexts. Her coaching philosophy centers on developing both organizational and individual potential, helping businesses scale by bringing structure, clarity, and people-focused strategies into fast-moving environments.  With a background in psychology and extensive experience in leadership development, talent management, and organizational development, Daniela supports leaders in navigating growth, improving communication, and measuring performance while keeping teams motivated. She is also a dedicated mentor, accelerating the impact of women leaders through mentoring programs focused on economic empowerment. Fluent in both English and Spanish, Daniela brings a warm, practical approach to coaching that emphasizes accountability, strategic planning, and sustainable growth for individuals and organizations alike.
headline: Director of People, Startup

name: Darcy Roberts
special_services: Change Management; Entrepreneurs; Executive Coaching; Extroverts; Finance Professionals; HR Professionals; Introverts; Marketing Professionals; Nonprofit Professionals; Performance Management; Succession Planning; Technology Professionals

bio: Darcy Roberts is the Managing Director of The Management Coach, where she elevates leaders and teams through targeted development, leadership training, and career transition support. With a background that includes eight years at Spencer Stuart, a leading global executive search firm, Darcy brings deep insight into what organizations seek in their leaders and how professionals can successfully navigate career pivots and leadership transitions. Her work spans executive coaching, career coaching, and innovative facilitation, including her expertise as a trained facilitator of LEGO SERIOUS PLAY method and materials, which helps teams solve real-world business challenges with creativity and depth. Darcy also serves as a Leadership Coach with LeggUP Inc., a Senior Consultant with Felix Global, and a Facilitator, Trainer, and Certified Coach with Best Work Yet, reflecting her commitment to driving measurable behavior change across diverse organizational contexts.  Darcy holds a Bachelor of Arts in English Literature with a minor in Religious Studies from the University of Toronto and completed the Co-Active Coaching Core Curriculum at the Coaches Training Institute. She is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credentialed by the International Coaching Federation and a TQ Certified Coach through Coaching.com. Her coaching philosophy centers on helping clients "do Work. Better"—whether they are new leaders navigating the transition to management, professionals in career transition seeking their next opportunity, or executives looking for ongoing support through uncharted challenges. Darcy's approach is practical, participatory, and grounded in real-world application, moving beyond traditional methods to foster deeper engagement and sustainable results.  With hundreds of clients across industries ranging from manufacturing to professional services to not-for-profits, Darcy brings a proven track record of helping individuals clarify what's next, strengthen their leadership presence, and build high-performing teams. Her expertise in career coaching includes resume and LinkedIn profile development, networking strategies, and transition planning, while her executive coaching supports leaders in sustaining success and navigating complexity. As the leader of a certified Women Business Enterprise, Darcy is dedicated to adding diversity to supply chains and creating inclusive pathways for leadership development.
headline: Former Consultant at Spencer Stuart

name: Darlene Huff
special_services: Change Management; Conflict Resolution; Entrepreneurs; Executive Coaching; Performance Management
bio: Darlene Huff brings more than 25 years of leadership experience spanning iconic retail brands and high-performance team environments. She served as District and Country Manager for Canada at Williams-Sonoma, Inc., where she built teams that exceeded sales and service expectations while ensuring brand experience for both external and internal customers. Earlier in her career, Darlene held the role of District and Country Manager for Canada at The Disney Store for over a decade, and she began her leadership journey as District Manager at Lady Foot Locker. Most recently, she served as Regional Director for Canada at David's Bridal, further deepening her expertise in leading multi-site operations and driving results through people development.  As Head Coach and Managing Director at The Coaching Suite since 2018 and currently a Senior Leadership and Executive Coach at KeenAlignment, Darlene specializes in transforming managers into trusted leaders who navigate from "crazy busy to calm." She completed her Co-Active Coaching certification and Organizational Leadership training at the Coaches Training Institute and holds the CPCC designation, along with a CSP credential from the Canadian Professional Sales Association. Darlene has also pursued advanced study in neuroscience and leadership through BEabove Leadership and is a Conversational Intelligence Enhanced Skills Practitioner. Her coaching philosophy centers on facilitating difficult conversations, building high-trust teams, and liberating the human spirit at work—attributes she honed throughout her extensive retail leadership career.  Darlene partners with emerging and high-potential leaders to develop next-level leadership capabilities, foster accountability and collaboration, and create inspired, cohesive teams. Grounded in curiosity, integrity, and a gift for listening, she helps clients identify their specific talents, engage their teams, and navigate transformation with courage and perseverance. Whether coaching individuals through career inflection points or guiding organizations to solidify culture and values, Darlene's greatest reward is seeing her clients thrive and succeed.
headline: 25+ Years at Williams-Sonoma, Disney

name: Debra Williams
special_services: Healthcare Professionals
specialties: ["Healthcare Professionals"]
bio: Debra Williams is a physician executive with over 25 years of healthcare leadership experience, including 15 years in medical staff leadership roles as Chief of Staff and Chief of Emergency Services. Her clinical career was concentrated in Emergency Medicine, where she served as President of Gulf Emergency Specialists and later as Medical Director and Chairman of Emergency Services at Gulf Coast Medical Center with Sheridan Healthcorp and EmCare. In these senior operating roles, Debra oversaw all aspects of emergency care delivery, operations, metrics, budgets, and staffing, serving as a liaison between hospital administration and corporate executives to ensure quality patient care, provider and patient satisfaction, and contract retention.  Debra earned her Medical Doctor degree from the University of Maryland and completed her Family Medicine residency at York Hospital, a University of Pennsylvania affiliate. She holds a CPCC credential from the Coaches Training Institute, reflecting her commitment to professional coaching excellence. As owner of Dr Deb Leads since 2020, Debra's mission is to assist healthcare professionals in the fast-paced, rapidly changing healthcare climate to perform at their peak potential and achieve their goals in the fastest, healthiest, and most effective manner.  Debra specializes in coaching healthcare professionals in goal development and achievement, addressing generational differences in the workplace, guiding teams through corporate mergers and acquisitions, and addressing professional performance issues. She is passionate about helping colleagues rediscover the joy in their medical careers and thrive in their personal lives, working with individuals and groups to enhance engagement and commitment. With a special interest in women in leadership and expertise in communication skills, Debra brings a unique blend of clinical knowledge, business acumen, and coaching skill to help healthcare professionals navigate the ever-increasing demands of their roles.
headline: 25+ Years As Physician Executive

name: Dhirja Gangopadhyay
bio: Dhirja Gangopadhyay is a Mental Health Coach at Lyra Health and an Associate Coach at BetterUp, bringing a distinctive blend of clinical, entrepreneurial, and cross-functional expertise to her coaching practice. She also serves as a Mental Health Coach at Boon Health and as a Behavioral Coach through her own firm, Dhirja LLC. Her professional journey spans drug safety and pharmacovigilance at GalaxE.Solutions, government relations and policy work with the New Jersey Hospital Association, entrepreneurship as founder and president of Divine Curry restaurant, and real estate with Keller Williams Cornerstone Realty. This diverse background equips her with a unique perspective on the challenges facing professionals navigating career transitions, entrepreneurship, and personal growth.  Dhirja holds a Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery (M.B.B.S.) from the University of Mumbai, a Bachelor of Science in Public Health from Rutgers University Edward J. Bloustein School of Planning and Public Policy, and is currently pursuing a Master of Science in Health Information Management at Rutgers University. She is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credentialed by the International Coaching Federation and holds a Meditation Certification from Chopra. Additionally, she is an NFEC Certified Personal Finance Consultant and a certified LifeMastery consultant and Dreambuilder coach with the Brave Thinking Institute. Dhirja specializes in helping young professionals and entrepreneurs build their dreams, accelerate their results, and create richer, more fulfilling lives that are balanced and connected with their core values. Her coaching philosophy emphasizes harmony, financial wellness, and aligning life choices with deeply held values, making her a credible and compassionate guide for clients seeking holistic transformation and sustainable success.
headline: Mental Health Coach, Behavioral Specialist

name: Diny Chen
special_services: Technology Professionals
specialties: ["Technology Professionals"]
bio: Diny Chen is a Program Manager at YouTube Music and an Internal Coach at Google, bringing a distinctive blend of product leadership and people-first coaching to her work. Her career spans marquee organizations including YouTube, Google, Fjord, and frog, where she has led cross-functional teams and complex initiatives for Fortune 500 clients such as Oracle, Disney, HP, Verizon, GE, Medtronic, and Chase. At YouTube, Diny has coordinated product teams to bring music experiences to users across TVs, smart speakers, smartwatches, and automotive platforms, while previously leading accessibility overhauls and UX operations for YouTube on TV. She also serves as Advocacy Lead for the Asians@YouTube Employee Resource Group and has contributed as a subject matter expert to Google Career Certificates in Project Management and UX Design. Her foundation in user-centered design and program management, honed at premier design firms frog and Fjord, informs her collaborative, process-driven approach to creating meaningful product experiences.  Diny holds a B.A. in Political Economy from the University of California, Berkeley, and has earned an impressive array of coaching credentials, including Certified Professional Co-Active Coach (CPCC) from the Co-Active Training Institute, Associate Certified Coach (ACC) from the International Coaching Federation, Gallup-Certified Strengths Coach, and Accredited Enneagram Practitioner from Integrative Enneagram Solutions. She has completed advanced training in Internal Family Systems for Coaches, Positive Intelligence, Organization and Relationship Systems Coaching (ORSC), and facilitation programs including #IAmRemarkable and Crucial Conversations. As part of Google's internal Googler to Googler coaching program, Diny provides one-on-one coaching as a Noogler Coach, Career Coach, Parent and Caregiver Coach, and Leadership Coach for the Phoenix Program supporting senior Asian women leaders.  Passionate about uplifting representation in tech and making an impact in people's lives, Diny partners with clients to break barriers, find fulfillment, and unlock their potential. Her coaching philosophy centers on a people-first, process-second approach, leveraging her deep experience in product, operations, and cross-functional collaboration to help coachees navigate career transitions, build leadership capacity, and create meaningful change. Whether mentoring new hires, supporting parents and caregivers, or coaching senior leaders, Diny brings curiosity, drive, and a commitment to helping others thrive both professionally and personally.
headline: Program Manager at YouTube, Google

name: Eliza Connor
special_services: Change Management; Conflict Resolution; Executive Coaching
specialties: ["Change Management","Conflict Resolution","Executive Coaching"]
bio: Eliza Connor brings over a decade of leadership development and learning strategy experience from lululemon, where she played a pivotal role during the company's remarkable growth from $450 million to over $7 billion in revenue. Across multiple senior roles—including Senior Learning & Leadership Partner and Senior Training Manager—she designed and implemented learning strategies for major organizational transformations, facilitated leadership experiences for groups ranging from 10 to 10,000, and worked cross-functionally in matrixed environments to drive behavior change at both individual and organizational levels. Her work spanned North American retail operations, new store openings across the US, Europe, and Asia, and company-wide leadership development programming that strengthened culture and accelerated performance.  Eliza holds a Bachelor of Fine Arts in Drama from New York University and has deepened her expertise through a Change Management Certificate from Cornell University and specialized training in Polarities in Transformational Leadership Coaching from Georgetown University. As a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credentialed by the International Coaching Federation and a registered ICF Mentor Coach, she co-founded ICF Coach Mentors, where she mentors professional coaches to embody the ICF Core Competencies through transformational coaching skills. She also holds an Instructional Design credential from the Association for Talent Development.  Through her practice at Seed and Soil Coaching and as an independent leadership coach and consultant, Eliza partners with senior leaders across all industries to deepen self-awareness, develop sustainable habits, and fulfill their whole life potential. Her coaching philosophy centers on helping clients objectively analyze patterns of behavior, unlock new perspectives, and take empowering actions that accelerate fulfillment and success. Passionate about creating values-driven, adaptive cultures, Eliza brings a unique blend of operational leadership experience, transformational coaching expertise, and a commitment to connecting individual purpose with organizational impact, making her a trusted advisor for leaders navigating growth, change, and personal transformation.
headline: Former Senior Learning Partner at Lululemon

name: Eliza Sawyer
special_services: Anxiety / Depression; Career; Change Management; Communication; Confidence; Conflict Resolution; Performance Management; Work / Life Balance

bio: Eliza Sawyer brings extensive experience in talent management and organizational effectiveness, honed through senior leadership roles at Travelers and Eversource Energy. As Assistant Vice President of Enterprise Talent Management at Travelers, she partnered with senior leaders and HR business partners to create state-of-the-art talent strategies, including enterprise-wide career development solutions that achieved 34% participation among individual contributors and addressed key drivers of employee engagement and retention. Earlier, as Director of Enterprise Organization Effectiveness at Travelers, she led the redesign of performance management systems and developed high-potential talent programs that resulted in higher retention and promotion rates. At Eversource Energy, she managed talent and organization development for a newly merged company, originating talent management architecture to mitigate leadership continuity risk and increase leadership effectiveness. Her career also includes organization development roles at Bayer Diagnostics and BorgWarner Automotive, as well as consulting experience across financial services, manufacturing, utilities, technology, and R&D.  Eliza holds a Master of Science in Organization Development from Loyola University Chicago and a Bachelor of Arts in Music and French from Beloit College. She is a Master Certified Professional Coach through the Certified Life Coach Institute. Currently serving as a Career Coach with Randstad RiseSmart and Principal Consultant at Blazeforward Coaching & Talent Development, Eliza provides coaching, development, facilitation, and consulting services to organizations and individuals. Her coaching philosophy centers on empowering talent to unleash their work-life possibilities through customized one-on-one support, helping clients navigate career transitions, onboarding, and ongoing career goals while future-proofing themselves through skills development.  With deep expertise in leadership development, high-potential development, career development, and team effectiveness, Eliza delivers practical, outcomes-oriented solutions grounded in her years of driving talent strategies and change initiatives. Her proven ability to design and implement enterprise-wide practices, coupled with her strong capability in organizational alignment, culture change, and operational excellence, makes her a credible and valuable partner for leaders and organizations seeking measurable impact and sustained growth.
headline: Former AVP Talent Management at Travelers

name: Elizabeth Dolman
special_services: Anxiety / Depression; Change Management; DE&I / Belonging; Leadership / Professional Development; Stress Management; Thriving in daily life
specialties: ["Anxiety / Depression","Change Management","DE&I / Belonging","Leadership / Professional Development","Stress Management","Thriving in daily life"]
bio: Elizabeth Dolman brings more than 15 years of product management and leadership experience from high-growth technology companies including Microsoft, Sonos, and National Instruments. At Microsoft, she served as Senior Program Manager leading strategy and user experience definition for Office collaboration features across desktop and mobile platforms, producing requirements that resulted in a patent for contextual user actions. During her tenure at Sonos, Elizabeth advanced from Senior Product Manager to Category Leader, driving product strategy and execution across hardware partnerships and cloud services, and later transitioned into talent development roles as Talent Cultivation Leader and Leadership Development, where she hired executive leaders, defined career frameworks, and delivered programs to increase engagement and support leaders across the organization. Earlier in her career at National Instruments, she led product management for the data acquisition business, managing more than 500 products and driving over $10 million in first-year revenue for new hardware launches.  Elizabeth holds a Bachelor of Engineering and a Master of Science in Biomedical Engineering from Vanderbilt University and Texas A&M University, respectively, along with executive education from the Texas McCombs School of Business. She earned her Leadership and Performance Coaching Certificate from Brown University and is an ACC-certified coach and member of the International Coaching Federation. She also holds a Facilitation Certification from Voltage Control. Rooted in a values-first coaching philosophy, Elizabeth partners with leaders and aspiring leaders to gain clarity, build resilience, and thrive through change—whether stepping into bigger roles, navigating career transitions, returning from parental leave, or managing burnout in fast-paced business environments.  Elizabeth's coaching blends deep listening with strategic challenge to help clients reconnect with their voice, clarify what truly matters, redefine success on their own terms, and lead with clarity and courage. She creates space for reflection and momentum, empowering leaders to set boundaries, make aligned decisions, and show up as the leaders they want to be for themselves and their teams. Currently serving as Leadership Coach with her own practice, Dolman Leadership Coaching, as well as with Boon, Growthspace, and Women In Product, Elizabeth draws on her extensive tech background to understand the pressures of high expectations, competing priorities, and constant change, offering a supportive environment where leaders can be fully seen and equipped to move forward with intention and confidence.

bio: Elizabeth Ehrhardt is an ICF-certified executive coach and former senior vice president with over two decades of leadership experience in the Consumer Packaged Goods industry. During her tenure at IRI, she served as Principal (SVP) across multiple high-impact roles, including executive owner of $10MM+ client engagements with Fortune 100 and Fortune 500 companies such as PepsiCo, ConAgra, Tyson, and Hormel. As a division leader of client service for marquee and strategic accounts, Elizabeth led teams of more than 70 professionals across data, technology, and analytics functions, successfully turning around and rebuilding multiple teams while driving large-scale technology implementations and change management initiatives. Her deep expertise spans sales, marketing, new product innovation, and P&L management, and she has been a sought-after public speaker at CPG industry, leadership, and academic conferences.  Elizabeth holds a BA in History from Vassar College and earned her Certified Professional Coach credential from iPEC Coaching. She is credentialed as a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) through the International Coach Federation and holds certifications in Hogan Assessments and the Individual Directions Inventory from MRG Assessments. At IRI, Elizabeth created the company's High Performance Coaching program to develop and retain high performers and high potential talent, earning the highest satisfaction ratings from participants and HR business partners. Today, through her practice EJE Coaching, and as an Executive Coach and Leadership Development Consultant with Keystone Partners and Core Guide with Chief, she partners with established and emerging leaders on executive presence, leadership development, career transitions, and navigating critical go/no-go decisions.  Elizabeth's coaching is distinguished by a powerful combination of ICF-certified expertise and years of front-line leadership in demanding, high-stakes business environments. Her focus on high performance, leadership effectiveness, and career management is grounded in real-world experience leading large teams, managing complex client relationships, and driving measurable business impact. Whether working one-on-one with C-suite executives or facilitating mastermind groups for senior women leaders, Elizabeth brings a practical, results-oriented approach that helps clients clarify their vision, strengthen their leadership presence, and achieve sustainable success.

bio: Elliot Goldberg is the founder of Goldberg Coaching and Consulting, bringing more than two decades of experience teaching in and leading independent schools to his coaching and consulting practice. His career includes senior leadership roles as Head of School at Solomon Schechter Day School of Greater Boston and Solomon Schechter Day School of Greater Hartford, as well as Upper School Principal at Golda Och Academy. Earlier in his career, Elliot served as Director of Religious Life at Chicagoland Jewish High School for a decade, and held teaching and faculty positions at Solomon Schechter Day School of Bergen County and Milken Community High School. He also served as a Visiting Scholar at the Jack, Joseph and Morton Mandel Center for Studies in Jewish Education at Brandeis University. Currently, Elliot also coaches with Boon, extending his impact beyond educational institutions.  Elliot holds a Bachelor of Arts in Public Policy from the University of Chicago and earned both a Master of Arts in Education and Rabbinic Ordination from The Jewish Theological Seminary, where he was awarded a Wexner graduate fellowship. He is a graduate of the Senior Educator Program at the Melton Center for Jewish Education at Hebrew University in Jerusalem and the Day School Leadership Training Institute at the Davidson School. Elliot is a Certified Professional Co-Active Coach (CPCC) through the Co-Active Training Institute and holds an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) credential from the International Coaching Federation. His coaching practice focuses on supporting schools, non-profit organizations, and individuals who work in these settings, informed by the mentorship, coaching, and consulting support he has received throughout his own career. With deep expertise in educational leadership and a commitment to helping others navigate the complexities of mission-driven work, Elliot brings both practical insight and a grounded, relational approach to his coaching partnerships.
headline: 20+ Years in Independent Schools

bio: Emily Dunn brings over two decades of operational leadership and transformation expertise from PepsiCo, where she held a series of progressively senior roles spanning quality, health and safety, operations management, and Lean Six Sigma. As a Lean Six Sigma Black Belt, she drove enterprise-wide productivity programs that delivered multi-million-pound annual savings, led cross-functional teams, and scaled continuous improvement capabilities across the organization. Earlier in her tenure, Emily commanded front-line operations, managed multi-site health and safety portfolios, and co-architected proprietary auditing frameworks that were standardized across PepsiCo's European division, elevating the company to world-class industry benchmarks. Her deep experience in high-pressure manufacturing environments, workforce mobilization, and strategic governance provides a powerful foundation for her coaching practice today.  Emily holds a BSc in Biochemistry from Swansea University and a Diploma in Personal Transformational Coaching from the Animas Centre for Coaching. She is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credentialed by the International Coaching Federation and has completed advanced training in organizational design and facilitation. As Director of Empowered Mindset (UK), Emily specializes in working with anxious and ambitious leaders—high-level professionals who have achieved external success but face an unsustainable internal cost. Her coaching operates at the intersection of professional growth, mindset, and nervous system regulation, using the Empowered Mindset Method to help clients move beyond surface-level coping strategies and resolve the ingrained patterns that create self-doubt and over-analysis.  Emily's approach is grounded in neuroscience and designed to produce fundamental, embodied shifts rather than temporary fixes. She partners with leaders to build internal authority, lead with congruence, navigate high-stakes environments with genuine composure, and establish self-worth independent of external validation. Drawing on her extensive operational background and her expertise in human performance, Emily offers a practical, outcomes-oriented coaching philosophy that translates insight into measurable results, enabling her clients to lead with clarity, confidence, and strategic focus.
headline: Former Lean Six Sigma Black Belt at PepsiCo

bio: Emily Roberts is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) with over two decades of corporate experience spanning leadership, team management, strategic planning, customer service, and corporate training. Her career includes nearly a decade as a Corporate Travel Manager at FAC Services and nine years as an Account Manager for Business Travel at Fox World Travel, where she built long-term client relationships and developed customized corporate travel programs. Since transitioning to coaching and well-being work in 2013, Emily has served as Owner and Coach at True Self Coaching & Energetics, and has held coaching roles with Lyra Health and Boon Health, supporting professionals at the intersection of mental well-being and professional development. Currently, she serves as an Organizational Impact Coach at Lakeland Care Plus, where she leads workshops, retreats, and coaching focused on stress management, resilience, and mental and emotional well-being for leaders and teams.  Emily holds a BA in Business Management from Concordia University-Wisconsin and completed the University of Wisconsin-Madison Certified Professional Coach Program. She earned her ICF Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credential in 2021 and is certified in Mental Health First Aid through the National Council for Mental Wellbeing. Her holistic approach is further enriched by certifications in Clinical Acupressure, Reiki Master Practitioner, and training as a Certified Infinite Possibilities Trainer. Emily's coaching philosophy centers on helping over-thinkers, over-achievers, and perfectionists move from stress and burnout into clarity, confidence, and resilience. She creates a warm, non-judgmental space for deeper connection to the heart, body, and inner wisdom, guiding clients to build not just successful careers but fulfilling lives.  Grounded in both evidence-based practice and holistic tools, Emily brings unique insight into the challenges professionals face every day. Her blend of corporate expertise, mission-driven leadership through board service, and whole-person development makes her a credible and compassionate partner for professionals seeking calm, clarity, and purpose in work and life.

bio: Emmanuelle Gounot is a seasoned general manager and C-level executive with 17 years of experience driving revenue and profitability across e-commerce and fast-growing marketplace ecosystems. Her career spans marquee organizations including Uber, Alibaba Group (Lazada), Amazon, and The Boston Consulting Group, where she has held senior leadership roles managing multi-million dollar P&Ls and leading cross-functional teams across the US, EMEA, and APAC. As Chief Executive Officer of Intrepid Vietnam, Emmanuelle led a team of 100 and grew annual net revenue sevenfold to achieve positive EBITDA, ultimately contributing to the company's acquisition by Ascential in a deal valued at up to $250 million. At Uber, she managed external budgets exceeding $100 million and delivered 18 percent in cost savings through process optimization, while at Lazada Malaysia she drove organic revenue growth of 70 percent year-over-year—2,000 basis points above the regional average. Her track record also includes doubling Amazon France's Sports category revenue to $50 million and improving profit margins by 250 basis points, making it the most profitable category in its division.  Emmanuelle holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and a BA in Comparative Literature and Political Science from Swarthmore College. She is a certified coach through the International Coach Academy, holding an ACSTH credential. Her coaching focus centers on helping leaders navigate growth, scale teams, and unlock new opportunities in dynamic, high-stakes environments. Drawing on her extensive experience building enterprise partnerships, executing strategy in matrix organizations, and leading teams through transformation, Emmanuelle brings a decisive, outcomes-oriented approach to leadership development.  Recognized for her ability to set vision, drive execution, and build collaborative partnerships across functions and geographies, Emmanuelle partners with executives and founders to strengthen leadership capabilities, optimize performance, and accelerate results. Her deep expertise in P&L management, strategic planning, business development, and team leadership—combined with her proven success turning around ventures and scaling operations—makes her a credible and impactful coach for leaders seeking to elevate their impact and lead with clarity in complex, fast-moving markets.
headline: Former GM at Amazon, Uber

bio: Erica Jenkins is an executive coach, pastoral counselor, and leadership development professional with a rich background spanning ministry, healthcare chaplaincy, and organizational leadership. As Executive Director of Living More Abundantly Coaching, Counseling and Consulting since 2012, she partners with leaders across nonprofit and for-profit sectors—including educators, working mothers, introverts, and faith-driven professionals—to unlock effectiveness, navigate change, and achieve meaningful goals. Earlier in her career, Erica served for fifteen years with The United Methodist Church, where she became the first minority female Elder appointed as Lead Pastor of a multi-ethnic congregation. In that role, she led strategic initiatives including conflict resolution, team-building, community outreach expansion, and the development of an Employee Assistance Program, earning recognition as a 2013 graduate of the inaugural Leadership Excellence Advancement Program and recipient of the 2007 Town and Country Award for Excellence in Ministry. Her foundation in pastoral care was built during her chaplaincy residency at Emory Healthcare, where she created and managed the Women's Health chaplaincy program and provided interdisciplinary spiritual and emotional support to patients, families, and staff.  Erica holds a Master of Divinity and a Master of Arts from the Interdenominational Theological Center, with specialized study in Pastoral Care and Counseling, and a Bachelor of Science in Business Management with a minor in Computer Science from McNeese State University. She is an ordained Elder in Full Connection with the Louisiana Conference of the United Methodist Church and holds ecclesiastical endorsements for workplace and hospital chaplaincy from the United Methodist Endorsing Agency. Her coaching philosophy centers on helping clients gain clarity, develop innovative strategies, and live more abundantly by identifying limiting beliefs, expanding possibilities, and translating insight into action. Drawing on her dual expertise in ministry and management, Erica brings a warm, conscientious, and results-oriented approach to coaching that emphasizes active listening, resilience, work-life balance, and the integration of personal values with professional success.
headline: Ministry & Healthcare Chaplaincy

bio: Estee Kim is an HR Business Partner at Jazz Pharmaceuticals with a robust background in talent management, organizational development, and leadership coaching. Earlier in her career at Sotheby's, she managed early career talent programs, coordinated global sales training initiatives, and oversaw learning and development with a 1.5 million dollar budget, demonstrating her ability to design and execute impactful talent strategies at scale.  Estee holds a Master's degree in Organizational Behavior, Systems, and Analytics from New York University's Polytechnic School of Engineering and a Bachelor of Arts in Philosophy from Rutgers University. She is an Associate Certified Coach credentialed by the International Coaching Federation and a Certified Professional Co-Active Coach from the Co-Active Training Institute. As a holistic talent strategist and leadership coach, Estee partners with leaders to foster positive workplace cultures, enhance employee experience, and drive performance through tailored development initiatives. Her cross-functional expertise in talent development, performance management, and employee relations, combined with her strategic mindset and proven track record across diverse industries, makes her a credible and valuable partner for leaders navigating growth, transformation, and organizational change.

bio: Fern Wiley, PCC, is an ICF Professional Certified Coach with over 2,000 hours of coaching experience supporting leaders, creatives, career changers, and developing coaches. Her professional journey includes coaching roles at Boon and BetterUp, as well as serving as a Mental Health Coach and Onboarding Support Coach at Lyra Health, where she provided one-on-one coaching and case management for over 40 clients while mentoring 25 newly hired coaches. Before transitioning to coaching, Fern honed her leadership and operational expertise as People Manager and Operations Manager at Heart Coffee Roasters, where she designed recruitment and training processes, coached mid-level management, and led teams of up to 30 personnel.  Fern holds a Bachelor of Fine Arts from the University of Oregon and completed ICF Certified Coach Training through iPEC Coaching, where she also earned credentials as a Certified Professional Coach (CPC) and Energy Leadership Index Master Practitioner (ELI-MP). Her coaching philosophy is deeply human-centered, blending creativity, curiosity, and deep listening to help clients navigate complexity, clarify their values, and step confidently into their next chapter. She partners with individuals ranging from individual contributors to C-suite leaders, as well as artists and professionals navigating career transitions, providing a reflective, practical, and transformative approach.  As a coach and mentor, Fern creates compassionate, playful, and thought-provoking space for growth and insight. She helps clients synthesize insights, design values-driven goals, and take purposeful action—whether leading a team, navigating career change, or pursuing personal growth. Her work is grounded in the International Coaching Federation's Core Competencies and Ethics, and she brings a proven ability to facilitate new perspectives, build clarity and confidence, and support long-term success. Fern's unique blend of creative background, operational leadership, and extensive coaching experience makes her a credible and valuable partner for anyone seeking to cultivate clarity, courage, and compassion on their path to meaningful transformation.

bio: Fran Keogh is the owner of Fran Keogh Coaching, where since 2013 she has guided successful business professionals, entrepreneurs, and consultants through burnout, transition, and reinvention. Drawing on a diverse career that includes five years as Development Director and News Anchor at WVXU Public Radio—where she expanded underwriting sales to unprecedented levels and won a statewide award for an innovative recycling campaign—Fran brings a unique blend of communication expertise, entrepreneurial experience, and creative problem-solving to her coaching practice. Her background also includes owning and operating The Farm at Brushy Fork, where she built a thriving alpaca farm and fiber arts business from the ground up, designing marketing materials for farms nationwide and presenting workshops at national conferences.  Fran holds certifications as a Certified Holistic Health Coach from the Institute for Integrative Nutrition and as a Business Coach through the Consultant's Success Formula, along with training as a Book Yourself Solid Coach and Speaker. Her coaching philosophy centers on building solid foundations in both life and business, helping clients recognize and move past the elements keeping them stuck. She specializes in working with open-minded professionals committed to making a positive difference who feel burned out, trapped, or restless, and are ready to intentionally create more fulfilling and purposeful lives.  What makes Fran a credible and valuable coach is her lived experience navigating major transitions and her holistic approach that integrates health, life, and business well-being. She empowers clients with practical tools to manage time and resources more effectively, reconnect with their strengths, and build sustainable momentum. Whether working locally in Tucson or internationally via phone and Zoom, Fran partners with clients to transform overwhelm and stress into energy, freedom, and meaningful impact.

She is an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) credentialed by the International Coaching Federation. Her coaching practice focuses on helping leaders in midsized manufacturing and service companies tackle challenges like strategy execution, team performance, and communication structure. Through a proven framework grounded in practical tools and actionable strategies, she guides clients in identifying root challenges, clarifying priorities, and crafting tailored solutions that deliver meaningful insights and tangible progress.  On a mission to eradicate self-doubt, worry, anxiety, and fear, Gabby creates a supportive space where leaders can navigate the pressures of their roles with confidence and focus. By refining strategies and ensuring alignment across teams, Gabby enables leaders to improve team dynamics and drive sustainable results. bio: Galia Pennekamp is a certified executive leadership coach and consultant who brings a rich background in organizational development, strategic leadership, and talent management to her coaching practice. Since founding Galia Coaching in 2019, she has specialized in executive leadership coaching, systemic team coaching, senior leadership onboarding, change management, and strategy execution. Galia currently serves as a Group Facilitator for Hampton, a highly vetted membership community for entrepreneurs, founders, and CEOs, where she facilitates monthly core group meetings focused on the most critical aspects of members' personal and professional lives. She also serves as a Guide at Chief, facilitating group learning and peer coaching for women in executive leadership positions, and as an Executive Leadership Coach with Bravely, empowering leaders to inspire, communicate effectively, and drive innovation. Her earlier career includes impactful leadership roles in nonprofit development, including serving as Development Director at The SEED School of Miami, where she created and led an $18.1 million capital campaign, and as Community Relations & Development Director at Breakthrough Miami, where she increased annual donations from $1.7 million to $3.0 million and secured a 98% return on grant requests.  Galia holds a Master of Science in Education in Special Education from the University of Miami and a Bachelor of Arts in Elementary Education from Guilford College. She is credentialed as an ICF Professional Certified Coach (PCC) and has completed the iPEC Coach Training Program. Her recent certifications include Certified Practitioner in Systemic Team Coaching and Navigating Transitions Coach Certification from Modern Elder Academy. Galia's coaching philosophy centers on the connection between strong organizational performance, authentic relationships, effective communication, and individual mindset as the foundation for creating meaningful change. She partners with leaders to foster curiosity, experimentation, and resiliency while empowering them to transform their organizations in ways that are strategic, effective, measurable, and deeply human.  With a multicultural perspective and a commitment to growing great leaders, Galia helps clients accelerate growth, meet today's challenges, and plan for the future. Her approach emphasizes coaching both organizational KPIs and individual mindset, shaping and delivering transformative learning experiences that expand leadership range, strengthen communication, and fuel personal and professional ascension. Grounded in practical, outcomes-oriented methods and enriched by her extensive experience in talent development and strategic execution, Galia brings credibility, warmth, and a proven track record of driving leadership impact across diverse industries and contexts.

As a Leadership Circle Certified Practitioner, George administers and debriefs the LCP 360 review, providing leaders with actionable insights for growth. Currently serving as a mentor with Ready, Vet, Go, MentorVet, and the American Board of Veterinary Practitioners, and as a coach with The Humanitarian Coaching Network and Boon, George is dedicated to guiding individuals on their journey of self-discovery and empowering them to take decisive action toward their aspirations. With deep expertise in leadership development, practice ownership, and consulting, he partners with veterinary professionals and leaders to navigate career transitions, expand their leadership capacity, and achieve both personal and professional success. His unique blend of clinical excellence, operational acumen, and certified coaching expertise makes him a credible and valuable guide for those seeking to grow themselves and their impact.

bio: Gillian Dunn is an executive mindset and leadership coach with deep roots in technology and organizational development. Over the course of her career, she has guided leaders at Cisco, Meta, Salesforce, Google, and Johnson & Johnson through transformative change, drawing on extensive experience at Sun Microsystems, where she spent nearly a decade in roles spanning organizational development, employee communications, and human resources. At Sun, Gillian partnered with C-suite executives including the CEO and CHRO to craft communications strategies for a global workforce of 25,000 employees, led change management initiatives for major corporate transformations, and was recognized as a top-performing employee. She has also consulted on change and communications strategy for clients in partnership with PwC and served as a consultant with Stewards of Change, managing large-scale convenings and projects. Today, Gillian coaches with Leap Academy, Boon, LifeHikes, SkillCycle, and Activate 180, and maintains her own practice, Gillian Dunn Coaching.  Gillian holds a Master of Arts in Human Resources and Industrial Relations from the UMN Carlson School of Management and a Bachelor of Science in Human and Organizational Development from Vanderbilt University. She is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) through the International Coaching Federation and a Certified Executive Coach and COR.E Leadership Dynamics Specialist through iPEC Coaching. Her coaching philosophy centers on helping high-performing leaders find calm, confidence, and clarity so they can lead boldly without burning out. She partners with clients to build executive presence, navigate complex conversations, and communicate with influence, turning self-awareness into action to unlock greater impact at work and balance in life.  Clients describe Gillian as both a strategist and a mirror—someone who sees patterns others miss, asks powerful questions, and helps translate insight into meaningful results. Grounded in her expertise in human resources, organizational development, and corporate communications, and informed by her own commitment to adventurous learning, Gillian brings a coaching approach that is practical, curious, and real. Based in Long Island, New York, she works with forward-thinking leaders who are ready to grow with intention and lead with presence, purpose, and possibility.

bio: Gina Torres-Perryman is a Life Design Coach who has coached over 500 people from around the globe in career growth and life transitions. Currently serving as a Life Design Coach with her own practice, Gina the Life Coach, and as a Certified Life Coach with Boon, she brings a wealth of experience supporting individuals through personal and professional transformation. Her background includes coaching roles at Spring Health and TaskHuman, where she guided clients through career pivots, life transitions, values alignment, and intentional living. Before launching her coaching practice, Gina spent seven years at Durham Technical Community College, first as an Advisor for International Student Services and later as a Success and Career Coach, where she provided academic and career coaching for over 200 diverse learners, helping them set and achieve goals aligned with their future paths.  Gina holds a Bachelor's degree in Latin American Studies from The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill and earned her Life Coach Certification from the Life Purpose Institute. She is credentialed as an ICF-ACC coach through the International Coaching Federation, a designation that requires adherence to a rigorous code of ethics, comprehensive examination, mentor coaching, and hundreds of hours of coaching experience. Additionally, she is a certified Group Coach through Group Coaching HQ and holds a Spanish Community Facilitator Certificate from Durham Technical Community College, reflecting her commitment to cultural sensitivity and serving diverse populations.  Gina's coaching philosophy centers on empowering women to reconnect with themselves and what matters most so they can create lives that feel fulfilling, grounded, and fully theirs. She specializes in working with women in corporate environments across finance, tech, pharma, and healthcare who are questioning their next step and feeling stuck in the grind. In a safe space, Gina asks the honest questions her clients have been too busy or scared to ask themselves, challenging limiting beliefs while honoring each person's unique story. Her approach integrates mindfulness, self-awareness, and values-based decision-making to help clients gain clarity, build confidence, and take aligned action toward a more intentional life. With big energy and a bigger heart, Gina brings belonging, commitment, connection, growth, trust, and well-being to every coaching relationship, reminding her clients that they can trust themselves to make the change they want and that they deserve to live a life they love.

bio: Heidi Hackney is a Certified Professional Coach with a diverse background spanning corporate leadership, nonprofit consulting, and specialized coaching for autistic adults. She served as Associate Director at PPD, a global clinical research organization, where she contributed to pharmaceutical development initiatives for nearly nine years. Since founding Dreamreach, LLC in 2016, Heidi has partnered with clients across the nonprofit sector, small business, and corporate middle and upper management, bringing energy, keen insight, and enthusiasm to help leaders operate with integrity, passion, and excellence in both professional and personal domains. Currently, she serves as Co-Founder of Autistic Voice Over Artists (AVA), a nonprofit dedicated to empowering autistic adults in the commercial voiceover industry by breaking down barriers and fostering inclusivity.  Heidi holds a Master of Science in Family and Consumer Sciences from Louisiana State University and a Bachelor's degree in Psychology from Stetson University. She earned her Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credential from the International Coaching Federation and completed certifications in Co-Active Coaching fundamentals and as a Certified Youth Transition Coach through the Youth Coaching Institute. Her coaching practice focuses on supporting autistic adults to reach their life goals, including obtaining and maintaining meaningful employment, nurturing healthy family relationships, and developing lasting friendships and intimate partnerships. Heidi has also contributed as a mentor coach, performance evaluator, and adjunct instructor at Louisiana State University, and has served on multiple nonprofit boards providing leadership development, governance, and community outreach.  With her blend of corporate experience, advanced training in human sciences, and ICF credentialing, Heidi brings a structured yet compassionate approach to coaching. She understands that flourishing requires just the right amount of support tailored to each individual's strengths and aspirations. Whether working with leaders navigating organizational challenges or autistic adults pursuing personal and professional milestones, Heidi's commitment to empowerment, neurodiversity advocacy, and practical, results-oriented coaching makes her a credible and valuable partner for clients seeking meaningful growth and lasting change.
headline: Coach for Autistic Adults & Nonprofit

bio: Hillary Wasserman is a certified health and wellness coach who brings a rich foundation in counseling and mental health to her coaching practice. Currently serving as a Health Coach at Omada Health and as a Certified Health and Fitness Coach with Embrace Wellness, Hillary has spent years supporting individuals through meaningful personal and health transformations. Her professional journey includes roles as a psychotherapist at Jewish Family & Children's Services of Northern NJ, an associate counselor at Donna Corbett, LCSW & Associates, and a coach at Boon Health, where she honed her ability to guide clients through challenges with empathy and evidence-based strategies. Earlier in her career, Hillary worked as a medical case manager at Jersey City Medical Center, counseling HIV-positive mothers and coordinating comprehensive care plans, and completed clinical counseling internships that deepened her expertise in individual, family, and group therapy.  Hillary holds a Master's Degree in School Counseling from Hunter College and an Advanced Certificate in Counseling from Montclair State University, providing her with a strong academic grounding in human development and therapeutic practice. She earned her Certified Health Coach credential from Health Coach Institute, integrating her counseling background with a holistic approach to health and wellness. With experience spanning mental health, chronic disease management, and wellness coaching, Hillary partners with clients to navigate life transitions, build sustainable habits, and achieve lasting well-being. Her blend of clinical insight, compassionate presence, and commitment to whole-person care makes her a trusted guide for individuals seeking to improve their health and quality of life.
headline: Health & Wellness Coach

bio: Işılay Çabuk, PCC, brings a distinctive blend of analytical rigor and human-centered leadership to her executive coaching practice. She spent over fifteen years at Standard & Poor's, where she advanced from intern to Director of Emerging Equity Markets, managing global equity indices with more than $50 billion benchmarked or invested, leading teams across New York, Beijing, and London, and earning multiple ACE Awards for excellence. As a Lean Six Sigma Green Belt, she led process improvement initiatives that achieved a 50% reduction in error rates, demonstrating her commitment to operational excellence and continuous improvement. Her career also includes leadership roles in healthcare and hospitality, grounding her coaching in diverse industry perspectives and real-world operational experience.  Işılay holds a BBA in Finance from Baruch College and is a Registered Nurse, having graduated from Admiral Bristol School of Nursing. She is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) and serves as a Teaching Assistant at Erickson Coaching International, where she helps develop the next generation of coaches. Her coaching philosophy centers on aligning power with strategic wisdom and inner freedom, integrating structure with freedom and purpose with results. She is passionate about creating human-centered workplaces where leaders feel engaged, valued, and empowered to grow, and she partners with business leaders to strengthen their leadership presence, emotional intelligence, and ability to navigate complexity with clarity and authenticity.  Currently an Executive Coach with Growthspace, GloCoach, and her own practice, Işılay supports leaders in combining analytical thinking with emotional intelligence to lead with purpose and inspire trust and transformation across their organizations. Her commitment to mentorship extends beyond coaching engagements—she mentors veterans transitioning to civilian careers and students exploring their professional paths. With her proven track record in finance, operations, and leadership development, Işılay helps clients clarify priorities, expand their leadership range, and step confidently into their next-level roles.
headline: 15 Years at Standard & Poors

bio: Jamie Fuentes is a strategic, systems-minded leader with over 15 years of experience driving equity-centered initiatives, organizational transformation, and behavior change across the nonprofit, health, and coaching sectors. Currently serving as Senior Director at Boon, Jamie leads People Programs and workforce strategy for a global network of 200+ professionals, owning the end-to-end coach lifecycle—from recruitment and onboarding to development, retention, and performance management. In this role, Jamie has scaled Boon's coaching network from national to international reach, directly contributing to a 10% improvement in coach retention and championing the successful adoption of Salesforce Scheduler across the entire coaching network. Previously, Jamie held senior leadership roles at BakerRipley, including Interim Regional Director of Child Care Services and Director of Innovation and Improvement, where Jamie managed multi-million-dollar budgets, led cross-functional teams, and integrated strengths-based, equity-centered approaches across all agency departments. Jamie also served as a Career Coach at Korn Ferry and has maintained a private executive coaching practice through Fountain of Clover, supporting executives and senior leaders in sustainable health, stress reduction, and psychological safety.  Jamie holds a Master of Science in Kinesiology and Exercise Science with a focus on Applied Behavioral Statistics from Miami University, as well as a Bachelor of Arts in Psychology, Social Work, and Mathematics from the same institution. Jamie is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) with the International Coaching Federation and completed Core Energy Coaching training through iPEC Coaching, where Jamie also served as a Mentor Coach. Additionally, Jamie is a Certified Health Education Specialist (CHES) and holds a NASM Personal Fitness Trainer certification. Jamie's coaching philosophy is grounded in Appreciative Inquiry and data-driven strategies, emphasizing the intersection of people, data, and culture to create sustainable well-being and strategic impact.  With a passion for designing systems that improve staff and learner experiences, Jamie thrives in cross-functional environments, partnering with executives and team leads to translate organizational priorities into clear objectives, feedback loops, and accountability structures. Whether advising on equity-informed change, building capacity in managers, or co-creating strategic programming, Jamie brings curiosity, compassion, and executional rigor to every initiative. Jamie's proven leadership in scaling operations, embedding continuous learning mechanisms, and fostering inclusive development programs makes Jamie a credible and valuable coach for leaders seeking to navigate transformation, strengthen culture, and drive measurable results.

bio: Jaron Vesely is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) with over a decade of experience designing leadership development programs and organizational change initiatives at some of the world's most innovative companies. His career includes senior learning and development roles at Gong, where he served as Senior Manager of Learning & Development, and Lyft, where he led both Learning & Development and Customer Education teams. At Facebook, Jaron served as Education Innovation Lead, spearheading content strategy and production for Business Education programs. He also held the position of Head of Learning Design + Development at Co-Active Training Institute, where he led the creation of impactful coach training and leadership programs. Earlier in his career, Jaron built strategic partnerships and educational initiatives at Adobe, Coursera, Nickelodeon, and Time Inc., bringing a unique blend of creativity, systems thinking, and instructional design to every role.  Jaron holds a Bachelor's degree in Theater Directing and Gender Studies from New York University and is currently completing dual graduate degrees—a Master of Social Work from the University of Michigan and a Master of Science in Psychology from Arizona State University. As a credentialed Professional Certified Coach through the International Coaching Federation, he creates spaces for growth, healing, and transformation with executives, artists, and change-makers across sectors. His coaching and facilitation work is deeply informed by trauma-informed practice, equity, and a commitment to helping people navigate uncertainty with clarity and integrity.  Jaron's approach is rooted in research, humanity, and a belief that leadership development must center on the whole person. Whether coaching individuals through life transitions, facilitating team conflict resolution, or consulting on organizational development, he brings insight, care, and a focus on helping people and organizations become more just, honest, and free. His diverse background spanning education, the performing arts, and psychology uniquely positions him to support leaders who are building toward something more human.
headline: Former Education Lead at Facebook, Adobe

name: Jattu Senesie
special_services: Burnout; Change Management; DE&I / Belonging; Stress Management; Wellness; Women
bio: Jattu Senesie is a board-certified obstetrician-gynecologist and Professional Certified Coach (PCC) with the International Coaching Federation who brings a unique blend of clinical expertise and lived experience to her coaching practice. After earning her Doctor of Medicine from Emory University School of Medicine and completing her residency in Obstetrics and Gynecology at Emory, Jattu spent six years in private practice at Simmonds and Simmonds Chartered, where she provided comprehensive women's healthcare, managed high-risk pregnancies, and performed complex surgical procedures. Her firsthand experience with burnout during her first decade of practice has profoundly shaped her understanding of the challenges high-achieving professionals face when success comes at the cost of well-being. Since founding Essence of Strength in 2013, Jattu has dedicated her career to helping healers be well, serving as Principal Owner and Coach while also working as a Peer Coach at VITAL WorkLife and Lead Faculty for the American Medical Women's Association's ELEVATE Leadership Certification Program.  Jattu holds a Bachelor of Science in Biological Sciences from the University of Maryland Baltimore County and her medical degree and residency training from Emory University School of Medicine. She earned her Associate Certified Coach credential from the International Coaching Federation in 2022 and advanced to Professional Certified Coach in 2025, reflecting her commitment to coaching excellence. Her philosophy centers on the principle of starting with well-being to achieve sustainable success, and she works primarily with early career physicians transitioning into their first post-training roles and seasoned professionals designing their next leadership chapter. Through her Five Essential Strengths to Simplify Self Care framework, Jattu helps clients move past pathological altruism and implement practical strategies that align priorities with intentional well-being.  What makes Jattu a credible and valuable coach is her rare combination of medical expertise, personal transformation from burnout, and professional coaching credentials. She understands the unique pressures facing women in healing professions who feel overeducated yet under-satisfied, and she brings both empathy and evidence-based tools to help clients prioritize self-care without sacrificing their commitment to serving others. As a coach, speaker, and workshop facilitator, Jattu partners with individuals and organizations to support sustained success, satisfaction, and high-quality outcomes grounded in well-being.
headline: OB-GYN Physician & Coach
