bio: JaWand Edwards Morris is a dedicated professional with over 17 years of experience in coaching, leadership development, and organizational effectiveness. She currently serves as a Personal & Professional Growth Coach at Boon and a Life and Wellness Coach at Spring Health, and has worked as a Care Coach with BetterUp, where she earned commendations for her resourceful and creative approaches to helping clients develop realistic goals, overcome limiting beliefs, and build productive habits. Since 2016, JaWand has also operated her own practice, JaWand Morris Coaching, LLC, where she collaborates with clients to cultivate positive mindsets and achieve success across personal and professional domains. Her earlier career includes serving as Director of Leadership Development at MidSouth Bank, where she designed and facilitated exceptional learning initiatives for leadership teams and high-potential future leaders, and as an Internship Specialist at South Louisiana Community College, where she developed and managed student internships across 12 degree programs. She also brings experience as an Adjunct Instructor at the University of Louisiana at Lafayette.  JaWand holds a Master of Arts in Organizational Leadership from Gonzaga University and a Bachelor of Arts in Communication from the University of New Orleans. She is an ICF Professional Certified Coach (PCC) and a Certified Professional Coach through iPEC Coaching, reflecting her commitment to industry-leading standards and continuous professional development. Her coaching philosophy centers on motivational leadership, out-of-the-box thinking, and fostering lasting relationships to ensure complete client satisfaction. She specializes in life coaching, mindset coaching, team leadership, communication, and process improvement, helping individuals navigate change, set realistic goals, and translate insight into meaningful action.  With a proven track record of delivering superior coaching across diverse client populations and fast-paced environments, JaWand brings exemplary educational qualifications, deep expertise in organizational leadership, and a warm, client-centered approach to every engagement. Her ability to align teams, champion creative solutions, and serve as a trusted resource for complex challenges makes her a credible and valuable partner for clients seeking personal growth, professional development, and enhanced well-being.

bio: Jenn Christie is a seasoned revenue and operations leader with decades of experience driving growth and operational excellence across high-growth startups and established enterprises. Her career spans marquee roles at realtor.com, where she served as Director of Digital Sales, and Workiva, where she led Mid Market Sales as Director through the company's pre- and post-IPO phases. Earlier, she spent seven years at Jobing.com (Recruiting.com), rising to General Manager and Vice President of Cloud Software Sales, building teams, managing P&L, and delivering scalable SaaS solutions. Known for translating vision into execution and chaos into clarity, Jenn has consistently elevated performance through coach-style leadership, strategic systems, and cross-functional alignment. Since founding Ignite & Rise Consulting in 2019, she has served as a fractional operations executive and growth strategist for SMBs and scaling companies, and currently chairs CEO peer advisory groups for Vistage Worldwide, guiding growth-stage leaders through the complexities of scaling with intention and confidence.  Jenn holds a Bachelor of Science in Chemistry from the University of Illinois Springfield and has deepened her leadership expertise through executive education at Emory University's Goizueta Business School in Managerial Leadership and advanced negotiation certification from The University of Chicago Booth School of Business, alongside over 100 hours of leadership development with Rapport Leadership International. She is a certified Integrator Crystalizer through Rocket Fuel and has trained extensively in EOS (Entrepreneurs Operating System) and Scaling Up frameworks. As a Vistage Chair and executive coach, Jenn partners with CEOs and founders navigating team complexity, scaling systems, and the messy middle of growth, helping them make better decisions, build aligned executive teams, and create the space to focus on what only they can do. Her coaching philosophy is grounded in operational clarity, strategic execution, and a commitment to helping leaders stay grounded in what matters most—combining the scrappiness of startup thinking with the discipline of Fortune 500 systems to drive sustainable, meaningful growth.
headline: Former C-Suite Sales & Revenue Leader

bio: Jenn Turvey is a workplace and leadership coach with a strong foundation in organizational development and process improvement. She founded Map Is In You in 2020, where she provides consulting and private-session workplace coaching. Currently, Jenn serves as a Leadership and Workplace Coach at the University of Denver's Graduate School of Social Work, supporting capacity building initiatives in human services agencies and organizations across the United States, and at Boon Health, where she coaches emerging leaders from individual contributors through upper-level management. Earlier in her career, Jenn honed her expertise as an Organizational Development Practitioner at the Colorado Department of Health Care Policy & Financing, facilitating Lean process improvement workshops and designing instructor-led coursework. She also held roles at CoreLogic as a Process Writer and Instructional Designer and at Columbia University Medical Center as a Communications Project Manager in the Department of Surgery.  Jenn holds a Master of Arts in Religion and Religious Studies from the University of Chicago and a Bachelor of Arts in Religion from Barnard College. She is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credentialed by the International Coaching Federation and an Integrative Enneagram (IEQ9) Certified Practitioner. Her coaching philosophy centers on helping motivated professionals discover and follow their path of effectiveness in work and in life. With a track record of delivering results in employee wellbeing, effectiveness, career path development, and leadership role identification, Jenn brings a practical, human-centered approach to her work. Her blend of organizational development expertise, formal coaching credentials, and deep commitment to individual growth makes her a trusted partner for leaders and organizations seeking to build engaged, motivated teams and navigate meaningful career transitions.

bio: Jenna Gonzalez is Vice President of Operations at Triformation Health, a Federally Qualified Health Center consulting firm, where she leads strategic planning and execution of operational initiatives that optimize healthcare services, enhance patient care, and ensure regulatory compliance. With a background spanning healthcare operations, coaching, and project management, Jenna has delivered large-scale coaching programs at Modern Health, Lyra Health, Boon, and Elevated Worldwide, working across industries including tech, healthcare, retail, financial services, and consumer goods. Earlier in her career, she served as Project Manager in the Program Management Office at Facts 'n Figures, Inc., leading market research projects and managing cross-functional teams, and as Administrator at Ponaman Healthcare Consulting, where she supported 340B Drug Pricing Program compliance and client relationships. A former World Champion figure skater and actress, Jenna brings grace, authenticity, and a unique perspective to her work, empowering clients to play full out and express who they really are.  Jenna holds a Bachelor of Arts in Sociology and Political Science from California State University, Northridge, and is a Certified Professional Coach (CPC) and Energy Leadership Index Master Practitioner (ELI-MP) through iPEC Coaching. She is an ICF Professional Certified Coach (PCC), credentialed by the International Coach Federation. Her coaching blends evidence-based Cognitive Behavioral Coaching and Core Energy Leadership methodologies to support leadership development, stress management, work-life balance, and relationship challenges. Jenna's philosophy is rooted in empathy, empowerment, and accountability—she sees her clients as capable exactly as they are and partners with them to develop self-awareness, ignite confidence, and navigate career and life transitions with clarity and resilience.  As founder of Jenna Ponaman Coaching and a mentor coach at Elevated Worldwide, Jenna has built a reputation for helping individuals build self-love, strengthen leadership effectiveness, and create thriving personal and professional lives. Her work has been featured in Business Insider, Bustle, and multiple podcasts, and she is available for group trainings, workshops, and speaking engagements. With deep expertise in healthcare operations, talent development, and emotionally intelligent leadership, Jenna brings a practical, outcomes-oriented approach that translates insight into measurable results and empowers clients to open fully to the life that awaits.

name: Jenna Rykiel
special_services: Marriage & Family Therapy (MFT); Working Mothers
bio: Jenna Rykiel is a business and mindset coach dedicated to empowering moms to build thriving businesses without burning out. Before launching CBJ Coaching in 2017, Jenna spent over a decade in corporate sales leadership at 2U, where she advanced from Senior Sales Consultant to Sales Director II and ultimately Manager II. Her experience leading teams and driving results in a fast-paced, high-growth environment gave her firsthand insight into the demands of balancing professional ambition with personal fulfillment. After leaving her leadership role, Jenna discovered the challenges of entrepreneurship and created a roadmap to help other moms navigate the unique pressures of building a business while raising a family. Today, she also serves as a Leadership Coach with Boon Health, where she supports employees in increasing resilience, productivity, and engagement through holistic and personalized coaching.  Jenna holds a Master of Business Administration from The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, a Master of Arts in Counseling Psychology from Loyola University Maryland, and a Bachelor of Science in Psychology from Clemson University. She earned her Life Coach Certification from the International Coach Academy and has completed training in communicating about culturally sensitive issues and unconscious bias. Her coaching philosophy centers on helping moms reclaim their time, energy, and confidence so they can wake up feeling energized and go to bed feeling proud and fulfilled. She believes that being a mom and business owner are two of the highest privileges, and she is passionate about helping her clients create space for what truly matters—whether that's being present during playtime, nurturing their partnerships, or finally taking time for self-care.  Grounded in her dual expertise in psychology and business strategy, Jenna brings a practical, outcomes-oriented approach to her work. She understands the stress, overwhelm, and exhaustion that come with doing it all, and she partners with her clients to shift from survival mode to a life of intention, growth, and joy. Her credibility is built on lived experience, advanced education, and a deep commitment to supporting moms in building businesses and lives they never thought possible.
headline: 10+ Years in Corporate Sales Leadership

name: Jennifer Milnes
special_services: Anxiety / Depression; Athletes; Burnout; Change Management; Conflict Resolution; Educators; Entrepreneurs; Executive Coaching; Finance Professionals; HR Professionals; Marketing Professionals; Nonprofit Professionals; Performance Management; Storytelling; Stress Management; Succession Planning; Technology Professionals; Working Mothers
bio: Jennifer Milnes is a retail operations and inventory leader with more than 20 years of experience building and leading high-performing teams across global supply chain, inventory management, and operations. She has held senior leadership roles at Gap Inc., including Director of Store Productivity, where she leads a team dedicated to simplifying operations, optimizing labor, and empowering store teams to deliver exceptional customer experiences. Previously, as Head of Store Planning, Global, Jennifer built a New York City–based team from the ground up responsible for both Specialty and Outlet channels across over 1,100 stores and $62 billion in sales, embedding consistent best practices across North America, Europe, and Japan. Her career also includes leadership positions at Banana Republic and Sephora, where she drove inventory strategy, labor planning, and operational excellence in fast-paced, high-growth retail environments.  In 2019, Jennifer made a bold pivot, stepping out of corporate to train as a professional coach and launch Champion of Change, a leadership coaching practice focused on navigating transitions, strengthening mental fitness, and helping leaders lead with greater clarity and purpose. She holds a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credential from the International Coaching Federation, a Certified Professional Co-Active Coach (CPCC) designation from the Co-Active Training Institute, and is a Certified Positive Intelligence Coach (CPQC). Jennifer earned her Bachelor of Science in Learning and Organizational Change from Northwestern University and holds certificates in Human Resources Management and Services from Cornell University and Interior Architecture and Design from the University of California, Berkeley. Her coaching work spans one-on-one engagements, small group and team coaching, and large group facilitation, with a focus on increasing mental fitness, creating balance, and supporting leadership teams through organizational change.  Now back in a senior leadership role in operations while continuing her coaching practice, Jennifer brings both operational rigor and human-centered insight to her work. She believes the most effective leaders create alignment—in themselves, on their teams, and in the systems they build. Whether optimizing supply chain strategy, mentoring emerging leaders, or shaping culture in moments of change, Jennifer shows up with curiosity, accountability, and a focus on sustainable growth for both the business and the people behind it. Her dual expertise in driving business performance and developing authentic, resilient leaders makes her a trusted partner for professionals navigating complexity and seeking to lead with greater impact.
headline: Former Head of Store Planning at Gap, Sephora

bio: Jennifer Spainhour is the founder of Position For Success Coaching & Consulting, bringing over 25 years of experience in marketing, consulting, and coaching to her work empowering women and teams to achieve their career goals and thrive at work. Before transitioning to professional coaching, Jennifer built a distinguished corporate career at Fortune 500 companies including PepsiCo, where she served as Senior Brand Manager for the Life Cereal brand and led innovation strategy across a $300 million portfolio as Brand Manager of Innovation for Golden Grains. She also held senior roles at Nabisco, supporting the $500 million Planters brand, and at H.J. Heinz Company, where she managed the Kibbles 'n Bits brand. Jennifer later served as Vice President of Consulting at GfK Market Opportunities & Innovation, providing strategic oversight of consulting engagements and moderating qualitative research for key CPG and B2B clients.  Jennifer holds an MBA from the SMU Cox School of Business and a Bachelor of Business Administration in Marketing from Miami University. She is an International Coaching Federation Associate Certified Coach (ACC) and a Certified Professional Coach (CPC) through iPEC Coaching, as well as a certified Energy Leadership Index practitioner. Her coaching philosophy centers on helping clients leverage their true talents to find greater fulfillment in their work, grounded in the belief that the significant time spent working deserves intentional investment in finding work that aligns with natural strengths and passions.  Jennifer offers personalized one-on-one executive coaching, group coaching programs including her signature "90-Days to What's Next" program, personal and corporate retreats, strategy sessions, and workshop facilitation. She also serves as a coach with Boon, a platform focused on the intersection of mental wellbeing and professional development, and manages the American Marketing Association Chicago's inaugural Professional Mentorship Program. As a frequent speaker, podcast host of "Spark Your Power," and volunteer career coach dedicated to empowering women toward economic independence, Jennifer brings a unique combination of proven marketing expertise, consulting acumen, and coaching skills to help leaders at all levels get unstuck, clarify their path forward, and create meaningful roadmaps for success.

bio: Joanna Davis, MCC, is a Master Certified Coach and visionary life strategist who brings deep expertise in executive development and leadership coaching. She served as Corporate Leadership Coach for a Fortune 500 company with approximately 20,000 employees from 2016 to 2023, where she partnered with vice presidents, senior directors, and high-potential leaders to drive leadership effectiveness, navigate organizational change, and maximize professional potential. In that role, Joanna led leadership development initiatives, designed and facilitated group and team coaching, and delivered feedback using tools such as Korn Ferry 360 assessments with a focus on compassion and growth. Since 2008, she has maintained her own executive development coaching practice, working with executives and high-performers worldwide to help them find balance, clarity, and congruence with their core values. Currently, Joanna serves as Lineage Holder and Director of Education at Coach For Life Education, carrying forward the legacy of the original spiritually-based, ICF-accredited coach training organization founded in 1996.  Joanna holds a Master Certified Life and Leadership Coach credential from Coach for Life, a Spiritually Based Life Coach certification, and is a Certified Hypnotherapist. Her coaching philosophy centers on creating criticism-free, psychologically safe environments where leaders can explore their unique paths forward through thought-provoking questions and the transformative power of discovery. Rather than offering prescriptive advice, Joanna partners with clients to uncover their own best answers, helping them align emerging trends with timeless self-reflection and translate insight into actionable frameworks. She is known for her ability to discern meaningful patterns in complex situations and guide clients toward breakthroughs that harmonize practical steps with a profound sense of meaning.  With a refreshing blend of straightforward feedback and compassionate support, Joanna empowers top executives—including those who don't yet know why they need a coach—to navigate inflection points, strengthen interpersonal relationships, and lead with authenticity. Her work is grounded in the belief that true executive excellence emerges when leaders live in congruence with their essential truth and core values. As co-founder of Compassion in Coaching and a lifelong learner dedicated to human potential, Joanna brings introspection, innovation, and enthusiasm to every engagement, leaving a lasting impact on leaders and organizations ready to envision and embrace the best version of themselves.
headline: Former Corporate Leadership Coach at Fortune 500

bio: Joel Dietz is a learning and organizational development executive with more than 20 years of experience transforming how leaders grow, teams function, and businesses adapt. Currently serving as Senior Director of Learning & Leadership Development at DNOW, the largest global distributor of pipe, valves, and fittings to the energy industry, Joel leads enterprise learning, leadership development, and executive coaching strategy while guiding change management for major transformation initiatives, including an Oracle ERP implementation supporting over 1,700 users. Previously, he built and scaled tiered leadership development strategies as Director of Global Organizational Development & Learning at MRC Global, where he designed a groundbreaking inside sales onboarding program that hired and trained 75-plus non-traditional candidates with a 95 percent two-year retention rate. Earlier in his career, Joel advanced through progressive HR and organizational development roles at InteLogix and GC Services Limited Partnership, ultimately serving as Assistant Vice President of HR and Organizational Development, where he directed learning across a 13,000-employee footprint spanning call centers in the U.S., Canada, Barbados, and the Philippines.  Joel holds a Master of Science in Human Resource Development from The University of Texas at Tyler, a Graduate Academic Certificate in Executive & Professional Coaching from The University of Texas at Dallas, and an Advanced Certification in Team Coaching from the University of California, Davis. He is an ICF-certified Professional Certified Coach (PCC) and holds the Advanced Certified Team Coach (ACTC) credential, as well as SPHR and EQ-i 2.0/EQ360 certifications. Through his private practice, Orange Door, founded in 2020, Joel coaches leaders, professionals, and teams on evenings and weekends, supporting clients navigating leadership confidence and effectiveness, major career pivots, and complex team dynamics.  Joel's coaching is outcome-driven and anchored in deep listening, observational insight, and field experimentation. He partners with leaders from managers to vice presidents to clarify what they want, uncover hidden assumptions, and generate the future that inspires them. He especially enjoys coaching highly motivated people-leaders who want to better influence up and out and align their teams with broader organizational goals. With a proven track record embedding coaching into enterprise transformation, executive leadership development, and change enablement for digital and ERP initiatives, Joel brings a rare blend of strategic organizational insight, hands-on coaching expertise, and a practical, results-oriented philosophy that helps clients translate insight into measurable impact.
headline: 20+ Years in L&D Leadership

bio: Dr. Joel Edman brings over 30 years of clinical practice, education, and research experience in health coaching, clinical nutrition, and integrative medicine. He founded Edman Wellness Services in 1999, where he has built a proven track record of effective client health outcomes, peer-reviewed publications, and corporate wellness presentations. His career includes nearly a decade as Director of Nutrition and Research Coordinator at the Atkins Center for Complementary Medicine, more than 11 years as Integrative Nutrition Lead and Associate Research Director at Jefferson-Myrna Brind Center of Integrative Medicine, and roles as a Health and Wellness Coach at Vida Health and Care Coach at BetterUp. Currently, Dr. Edman serves as a Resilience Coach at Boon Health and as Adjunct Faculty at Metropolitan State University of Denver, where he continues to share his expertise with the next generation of health professionals.  Dr. Edman holds a Doctor of Science in Nutritional Sciences from Boston University, a Master of Science in Clinical Nutrition from Drexel University, and a Bachelor of Science in Industrial Engineering from Penn State University. He is an ICF-credentialed coach (PCC) with deep specialization in health coaching, chronic care coaching, mental health, and corporate wellness programs. His mission is to support optimal physical and emotional health and well-being through the design, implementation, and research of innovative, client-centered healthcare programs for individuals, groups, and companies. Dr. Edman partners with clients using health coaching and an integrative, holistic model of care, focusing on individualized nutritional guidelines, physical fitness, and stress management to construct and empower programs that produce lasting well-being.  With expertise spanning chronic disease management, gastrointestinal and neuropsychological disorders, cardiovascular disease, metabolic syndrome, and cancer care, Dr. Edman brings a comprehensive and evidence-based approach to his coaching practice. His background in behavioral change, integrative nutrition, and resilience coaching enables him to help clients overcome challenges, build resilience, and reach their professional and personal goals. Whether working with corporate wellness programs or individuals in private practice, Dr. Edman's decades of clinical experience, academic contributions, and commitment to empowering clients make him a credible and valuable partner for anyone seeking to enhance their health, leadership, and overall well-being.
headline: 30+ Years in Clinical Nutrition & Health Coaching

bio: Johanna Andrews Adlam is the Founder and CEO of Premexcellence, where she empowers professionals, students, and organizations in public health to achieve their vision of excellence with meaning and purpose. With over 12 years of experience conducting interdisciplinary research and leading diverse research teams, Johanna has held key roles at the University of Nevada-Las Vegas, including Postdoctoral Scholar and Graduate Research Assistant at the Center for Health Disparities Research, where she collaborated with researchers across the United States on national studies examining stress and coping with COVID-19 for persons of color. She also served as Senior Research Coordinator at Northwell Health, managing multiple federal and foundation research grants, supervising project staff and clinicians, and overseeing research procedures and budgets. Her academic contributions include adjunct faculty positions at both the University of Nevada-Las Vegas Honors College and Hofstra University School of Health Professions and Human Services, where she designed courses on health disparities and supported accreditation efforts.  Johanna holds a Doctor of Philosophy in Public Health from the University of Nevada-Las Vegas, where she received the Outstanding Dissertation Award, a Master of Public Health from Hofstra University, and a Bachelor of Science in Biology from Hofstra University. She is a Certified Professional Co-Active Coach (CPCC) and holds an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) credential. Her coaching philosophy centers on helping clients gain clarity to design meaningful and rewarding paths aligned with their purpose and values, empowering them to take creative action toward happiness and fulfillment in their careers and lives. As a woman of color who has navigated academic and professional spaces, Johanna brings a unique perspective and purposeful strategies to overcome barriers.  Johanna's credibility as a coach is grounded in her extensive research expertise in racial and ethnic health disparities, food insecurity, healthy food access for communities of color, and stress and coping processes for persons of color in the United States. Her dual expertise as a social and behavioral health researcher and certified coach enables her to offer transformative career and life coaching services alongside academic and public health consulting. Whether guiding professionals through career transitions, supporting students through thesis and dissertation processes, or consulting on public health research and program initiatives, Johanna combines evidence-based insight with a warm, individualized approach that helps clients achieve excellence aligned with their deepest values.
headline: 12+ Years in Public Health Leadership

bio: Judy Sandweiss brings over two decades of human resources and organizational leadership experience from marquee companies including Qualcomm, where she spent more than a decade as Senior HR Manager leading organizational effectiveness and employee wellness for global teams of over 2,000 employees. Her career also includes strategic roles at U.S. Bank as Vice President and Coaching Program Architect, ResMed as Senior People Business Partner, and earlier positions at McKesson Corporation, Genentech, and Sun Microsystems. At Qualcomm, she partnered with senior leadership to design and implement management development programs, drove strength-based development using tools like StrengthsFinder, and championed emotional intelligence as essential to leadership success. Her work at U.S. Bank applied behavioral science to shift customer engagement models, achieving measurable human and financial impact. She also served as a People and Strategy Consultant for early-stage startup Aware, where she established foundational culture, mission, and talent acquisition strategy.  Judy holds a Master of Health Administration and a Master of Industrial and Labor Relations from Cornell University, as well as a BA in Psychology and Biology from UC San Diego. She is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credentialed by the International Coaching Federation and a certified Communication Impact Coach through the Center for Executive Coaching. She is also a certified Mental Fitness Coach with Positive Intelligence. Currently, Judy coaches business leaders through bluSPARC, Boon, and Positive Intelligence, focusing on the intersection of mental wellbeing and professional development. Her coaching philosophy centers on the belief that while technical expertise opens doors, it is emotional intelligence and human connection that drive lasting success. She partners with individuals, leaders, and teams to develop the EQ needed to navigate uncertainty, build trust, and thrive in an AI-driven world.  Judy's approach is grounded in real-world insight from conducting hundreds of exit interviews and observing the patterns that distinguish effective leaders: those who listen, value others, and lead with both competence and heart. She designs dynamic leadership development programs, offers executive coaching for complex challenges, facilitates team experiences that unlock collective wisdom, and delivers EQ training for all levels. Her work helps leaders turn soft skills into competitive advantage, fostering resilience, adaptability, and cultures where people feel heard and motivated to deliver results.
headline: 10+ Years HR at Genentech, Qualcomm

bio: Karen Bodin is a Senior Career Coach at Right Management, a global leader in career and talent development within ManpowerGroup, where she designs and delivers strategic workforce solutions for clients navigating career transitions and professional growth. She also serves as a Certified Life Coach with Boon and operates her own practice, Karen Bodin Coaching LLC, where she has supported clients since 2020 in building mental fitness to fulfill their potential for both happiness and contribution. Earlier in her coaching career, Karen founded Karen Bodin Coaching and Consulting, helping entrepreneurs start and grow businesses by leveraging their strengths to maximize personal and professional success. Her coaching is enhanced by her background as a business consultant and sales expert, along with her deep commitment to continuous learning and evidence-based techniques.  Karen holds a Bachelor of Science from the University of Minnesota's Carlson School of Management with a focus in Marketing and earned a Master's Certificate in Project Management from Auburn University. She is a graduate of the Coaches Training Institute, where she completed the Personal Coactive Coach certification and a nine-month Leadership Intensive, and has trained with Positive Intelligence in mental fitness methodologies. Karen holds the PCC (Professional Certified Coach) credential from the International Coaching Federation, as well as the CPCC (Certified Professional Co-Active Coach) and CPQC (Certified Positive Intelligence Coach) designations, reflecting her commitment to the highest standards of coaching excellence.  Karen's coaching philosophy centers on the belief that each person has the resources within themselves to create a satisfying and meaningful life and career. She integrates mental fitness to help clients manage their thoughts and actions, supporting rapid shifts from negative to positive responses to challenges. By asking powerful questions and challenging limiting beliefs, Karen inspires thought transformation that leads to deep and meaningful behavior change, guiding clients to move from fear to freedom and live authentically on purpose. Drawing on more than 35 years of personal growth work, Karen brings both professional expertise and lived experience to her practice, creating a warm, supportive environment where clients discover emotional wellness, confidence, and joy.
headline: 35+ Years in Career Development

bio: Karen Levy brings a rich foundation in human resources leadership and organizational development, having served in senior HR business partner roles at prestigious institutions including Cornell University, the University of Southern California, and Cedars-Sinai. Over the course of her career, she has partnered with senior leaders to navigate complex employee relations, organizational change, and performance improvement initiatives. Her deep expertise in conflict resolution, strategic HR consulting, and talent development has equipped her with a nuanced understanding of the challenges leaders face in high-stakes environments.  Karen holds a Bachelor's of Arts in Organizational Leadership from Chapman University and has earned her Professional Human Resources (PHR) credential alongside a Human Resources Management Certificate from the University of California, Irvine. As a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credentialed by the International Coaching Federation, she integrates evidence-based coaching with her training as a Reiki Master and Meditation Facilitator. Her coaching philosophy centers on slowing down to unpack limiting beliefs, fostering clarity from the inside out, and empowering clients to embody their vision for success. Currently serving as a Mental Health Coach at Lyra Health and an Executive & Professional Growth Coach at Boon Health, Karen specializes in helping leaders address anxiety, depression, and stress while revealing blind spots that unlock dynamic results.  What makes Karen a credible and valuable coach is her ability to listen deeply and create measurable outcomes by addressing root causes rather than surface symptoms. Her holistic approach—blending organizational insight, mental health expertise, and embodiment practices—enables her to shift the energy of individuals and teams alike, ensuring alignment between intention and impact. Whether guiding executives through leadership transitions or supporting professionals in achieving work-life clarity, Karen's work is grounded in fostering high-impact decision making and sustainable transformation.
headline: HR Leader, Cornell & Cedars-Sinai

bio: Karen Patricelli is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) and founder of STEADY Leadership, bringing over 15 years of senior leadership experience in product development, innovation, and operations. As former Vice President of Products at Simulab Corporation, a medical simulation company, she led product development and R&D initiatives that drove 150% revenue growth over six years, pioneered market-first product launches generating over $1 million in first-year revenue, and served as a board member shaping business strategy and long-term operational goals. Earlier in her career, Karen held director-level roles in product management, marketing, and business development at Simulab and Q-Media Services Corporation, where she managed teams and multimillion-dollar budgets while representing major accounts including Microsoft, NEC, and Gateway. Her operating experience spans MedTech, healthcare, technology, manufacturing, SaaS, nonprofits, and education.  Karen holds coach training credentials from iPEC Coaching in Life and Leadership Potentials and is a Certified Master Practitioner of NLP and Mental and Emotional Release from The Empowerment Partnership and the Association of Integrative Psychology. As a Professional Certified Coach credentialed by the International Coaching Federation, she partners with executives and teams in high-pressure industries to improve decision-making, emotional regulation, influence, and team alignment. Karen's coaching philosophy centers on helping leaders find clarity and confidence without burning out, blending executive coaching, leadership development, and organizational strategy to create measurable impact. She leverages AI tools to reimagine leadership development while keeping coaching human-centered, and she designs programs that unlock potential, build resilience, and develop executive presence.  Consistently rated 9.9 out of 10 in client satisfaction across more than 75 feedback surveys, Karen's clients report measurable improvements within 90 days in leadership effectiveness, team engagement, and conflict resolution. She brings a unique combination of deep operating expertise, proven frameworks for influence and decision quality, and a warm, accountability-driven coaching style. Whether guiding leaders through change, facilitating high-stakes conversations, or aligning cross-functional teams on strategy and execution, Karen listens deeply, asks the right questions, and helps clients see the potential they sometimes can't yet see in themselves.
headline: Former VP of Products at Microsoft Partner

name: Karen Souter
special_services: Educators; Healthcare Professionals
bio: Karen Souter is a practicing physician anesthesiologist at the University of Washington Medical Center, where she has served on the faculty since 2002. Her clinical expertise spans neuroanesthesiology and out-of-operating room anesthesia, built on a foundation that includes a fellowship in neuroanesthesiology from Western University and a fellowship with the Royal College of Anesthesiologists in London. As a medical educator, Karen held the role of residency program director from 2005 to 2016 and earned national recognition in 2011 with the ACGME Parker J. Palmer Courage to Teach Award, which honors innovative teaching and a commitment to quality care in academic health centers. She has maintained an active leadership presence in national professional societies related to anesthesia and education, and her scholarly work includes numerous peer-reviewed publications on topics ranging from resident training and faculty development to patient safety and disclosure practices.  Karen holds a Master of Education in Academic Medicine from the Keck School of Medicine of the University of Southern California and completed professional coaching training at SeattleCoach. She is credentialed as a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) with the International Coaching Federation and is a Fellow of the Institute of CPD. Since founding Karen Souter Coaching LLC in 2018, she has specialized in leadership and career development coaching for physicians. She also serves as a leadership and professional development coach with Academic Impressions, VITAL WorkLife, Footlamp Consulting, Boon Health, and The SeattleCoach Training & Development Company, where she facilitates programs for leaders in healthcare.  Karen partners with physicians who are navigating career transitions, stepping into leadership roles, and seeking deeper clarity about their life and work. Her coaching philosophy centers on curiosity, self-understanding, and meaningful change, grounded in her dual expertise as a clinician and educator. She creates and leads workshops on coaching and mentoring in academic environments, bringing a practical, evidence-informed approach to helping committed professionals expand their leadership capacity and align their careers with their values.
headline: Physician & Leadership Coach

bio: Karla Quinn is a seasoned executive coach and leader with over 15 years of experience in data, business intelligence, and information management, complemented by more than seven years in accounting. Her corporate career includes significant leadership roles at Fortune 500 companies such as Cargill, where she served as North America Master Data Manager overseeing virtual teams across North America, Europe, and India, and at C.H. Robinson, where she currently serves as Data Engineering Manager, building empowered teams and fostering high-performing, collaborative work environments. Earlier in her career, Karla held senior positions at Allianz Life and Voya Financial, where she led financial systems, reporting, and compliance initiatives. Her hands-on management experience spans project management, software development, application support, and cross-functional leadership in global organizations.  Karla holds a Bachelor of Arts in Accounting and a graduate degree in Systems from the University of St. Thomas, and she earned an Executive Coaching Masters Certificate from the University of St. Thomas Opus College of Business. She is an International Coaching Federation (ICF) Associate Certified Coach (ACC) and is Shift Positive 360 Certified. As a passionate coach and mentor, Karla invests deeply in the development of individuals, drawing on her extensive leadership background to help clients navigate career transitions, build leadership capacity, and achieve meaningful results. She is a Founding Partner, Board Member, and Summit Chair at the Center for Coaching in Organizations, where she built a global virtual coaching conference from the ground up and recruited international thought leaders in executive coaching.  Karla's coaching philosophy centers on empowering leaders to unlock their potential through practical, results-oriented strategies. Her credibility as a coach is grounded in her proven track record as a team builder, her commitment to fostering healthy organizational cultures, and her ability to translate technical and operational expertise into actionable leadership insights. Whether working with emerging leaders or seasoned executives, Karla brings warmth, clarity, and a deep belief in the transformative power of investing in people.
headline: 15+ Years in Finance & Data

name: Karma Hill
bio: Karma Hill is a certified leadership and positive psychology coach with more than 20 years of experience in psychology, leadership development, and organizational consulting. As the founder of Konversations with Karma since 2017, she has dedicated her practice to helping executives and mission-driven organizations prevent burnout, strengthen emotional intelligence, and build thriving workplace cultures through her signature REST Framework. Karma has served clients across government, healthcare, education, nonprofit, and corporate sectors, and previously coached with Boon Health, where she focused on mental health and well-being. She currently serves as a Board Member of the ICF Georgia Charter Chapter, contributing her expertise to the professional coaching community.  Karma holds a PhD in Business Psychology from The Chicago School and a master's degree in Positive Psychology and Coaching Psychology from Life University, along with a bachelor's degree in Criminal Justice from Georgia State University. She is an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) credentialed by the International Coaching Federation and grounds her work in trauma-informed and equity-conscious practices. Her coaching philosophy centers on helping high-achieving leaders reset, realign, and restore—without sacrificing purpose or performance. As the creator of the REST model and President of ICF Georgia, Karma has been featured in Yahoo Finance, VoyageATL, and Women's Herald for her innovative approach to burnout prevention and workplace well-being.  Karma's unique blend of academic rigor, ICF accreditation, and two decades of hands-on experience make her a trusted partner for leaders navigating the complexities of modern organizational life. Her commitment to fostering resilience, emotional intelligence, and sustainable high performance positions her as a credible and impactful coach for executives seeking to lead with both excellence and humanity.
headline: 20+ Years in Psychology & Leadership

bio: Kathleen Fariss is a seasoned executive and leadership coach with a distinguished career spanning higher education, municipal government, consulting, and nonprofit leadership. Currently serving as CEO of the Claremont Chamber of Commerce, she leads efforts to strengthen the business community through advocacy, strategic partnerships, and economic development. Before this role, Kathleen co-founded Fariss Coaching & Consulting, where she partnered with leaders and organizations navigating growth, change, and transformation. Her executive experience includes multiple Chief Operating Officer and senior leadership positions at Claremont Graduate University, where she served as Associate Provost for Academic Administration, Associate Dean for Administration and Student Affairs at the Drucker School of Management, and Founding Director of the Drucker School Global Family Business Institute. In these roles, she led cross-functional teams, launched innovative programs, and drove strategic initiatives that improved organizational capacity and stakeholder engagement. Earlier in her career, Kathleen held director-level positions with the City of Fontana, where she spearheaded a capital campaign that raised over fifteen million dollars to build and equip the Lewis Library and Technology Center, and launched a city-wide grant team that generated over eleven million dollars in funding.  Kathleen holds a Master of Science in Leadership and Management with a focus on Organizational Development from the University of La Verne, as well as a Bachelor of Science in Organizational Management from the same institution. She is a Professional Certified Coach credentialed by the International Coaching Federation and a WiLD Executive Fellow. Currently, she serves as a Leadership Coach with WiLD Leaders, Inc., where she provides personalized coaching through the WiLD Trust Platform, and as a Personal and Professional Growth Coach with Boon Health. Her coaching philosophy centers on courage, connection, and clarity, and she is deeply passionate about partnering with next-generation leaders and leaders in transition to help them gain clarity, elevate their careers, and advance their teams and organizations.  Grounded in a people-centered approach and inspired by Peter Drucker's belief that "the best way to predict the future is to create it," Kathleen brings a unique blend of strategic vision, operational expertise, and coaching acumen to her work. Her method emphasizes vision casting, business building, and investing in leaders to maximize potential. With a proven track record leading large-scale initiatives, building partnerships, and fostering collaboration across sectors, Kathleen equips leaders and organizations to thrive in times of change and shape their futures with confidence.
headline: Former C-Suite Executive & Coach

name: Kathryn Freund
bio: Kathryn Freund is a creative professional and coach whose career has spanned design, talent management, learning design, and coaching across advertising, marketing, and organizational development. She spent over nine years in talent management at Kay & Black, where she recruited and placed more than 500 full-time and freelance professionals from junior to C-suite level at agencies and brands across the United States. At We Are Social, she served as Senior Designer and Talent Manager, where she recruited and managed a team of six full-time creatives, retained all hires for two to five years, and successfully transitioned design interns into full-time and senior roles. Her early career included design roles at Standard & Poor's, McGraw-Hill Education, and Professional Sports Publications, as well as co-founding Amateur Person Apparel, an online clothing brand featured on Mindy Kaling's Instagram. Kathryn has also worked with clients including University of Denver, Haymarket Opera Company, and a range of small businesses, coaches, and consultants, providing brand messaging, website design, copywriting, and operations strategy.  Kathryn holds a Bachelor of Arts in Visual Arts (Graphic Design) and English from Fordham University and studied Graphic Design at the Fashion Institute of Technology. She completed her coaching training at The Coaches Training Institute (CTI), earning her CPCC credential, and holds a Co-Active Leadership Experience Certificate from the Co-Active Training Institute. Her coaching philosophy is holistic and Co-Active, drawing on her deep industry insights and talent management experience to help creative professionals, small business owners, and individuals navigate career transitions, professional development, and leadership growth. As Lead Instructor and Learning Designer at Career Happy, she developed coursework, workshops, and learning materials, facilitated group classes and one-on-one coaching sessions, and spoke at educational programs to share recruitment and career development best practices. She has also served as a Mental Health & Wellness Coach at Boon Health, supporting employees with workplace burnout, stress, and resilience using evidence-based cognitive behavioral coaching.  Kathryn brings a rare combination of creative expertise, talent development experience, and coaching skill to her work. Her ability to see what connects people and organizations—honed through years of recruiting, coaching, and representing top talent—enables her to speak directly and authentically to clients' unique value propositions. Whether designing learning experiences, coaching professionals through career inflection points, or helping brands optimize their marketing and operations, Kathryn is known for making complex processes easy and approachable, so her clients can focus on what they love to do most.
headline: 10+ Years in Talent Management & Recruiting

bio: Katie Leimkuehler is an executive coach and leadership development leader with a distinguished track record spanning financial services, retail, and fast-growth startups. She spent nearly six years at Charles Schwab as Senior Manager of Social Media and Leadership Coach, where she trained, mentored, and coached more than 3,500 financial consultants, VPs, and C-suite executives on leadership best practices, thought leadership, and personal branding. Katie went on to found the learning and development department at Cresset, a finance startup, where she built eight employee programs in eight months and directed the firm's people development strategy. She later served in leadership development at EXPRESS, designing scalable performance management frameworks, succession planning strategies, and enterprise-wide learning programs. Since 2020, Katie has served as Executive Coach and Head of Leadership Development at the Executive Leadership Center, conducting one-on-one coaching sessions and advising clients on career transitions, organizational change, and leadership growth.  Katie holds a Bachelor of Arts in Journalism and Creative Writing with a business concentration from Miami University, an MFA in Creative Writing from Roosevelt University, and an Organizational Leadership Certificate from Northwestern University. She is an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) with the International Coaching Federation and a Certified Organizational Development Coach through Symbiosis Coaching. Her coaching philosophy centers on elevating undiscovered potential in others through integrity, passionate curiosity, and creative strategies that empower leaders to deliver optimal results. Katie has been recognized as one of the Top 15 Coaches in Cleveland in 2024 and received the Northeast Ohio Movers & Shakers Top 25 Under 35 Award. She has also contributed thought leadership as a writer for Social Media Examiner, Built In, and other publications, and served as a communications professor at the University of Denver and adjunct faculty at the College of DuPage.  With expertise spanning leadership training, management development, career coaching, and organizational effectiveness, Katie brings a dynamic, results-oriented approach grounded in real-world experience across diverse industries. Her commitment to developing leaders, building high-performing teams, and driving measurable outcomes makes her a trusted partner for executives navigating career inflection points, organizational transformation, and professional growth.
headline: Former Leadership Coach at Charles Schwab

bio: Katie Wong is a People and Culture professional and coach with a diverse career spanning human resources, organizational development, and coaching across public, private, and nonprofit sectors. Her experience includes roles at the BC Centre for Excellence in HIV/AIDS, where she spent five years in human resources, and positions as Senior HR Generalist at Enbala and HR Advisor at Protec Dental Laboratories. Katie has also contributed to public sector organizations including the City of Burnaby and the City of Surrey, building a well-rounded foundation in employee relations, talent management, compliance, and organizational effectiveness. Since 2022, she has focused on coaching and consulting through her own practice, Katie Wong Coaching and Consulting, and serves as a coach with Fuse Coaching Cooperative and Boon, a platform dedicated to personalized coaching at the intersection of mental wellbeing and professional development.  Katie holds a Bachelor of Commerce in Marketing and Human Resources Management from The University of British Columbia and completed the UBC Organizational Coaching Program through UBC Sauder School of Business. She is an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) with the International Coaching Federation and holds the SHRM Senior Certified Professional (SHRM-SCP) credential, as well as the Chartered Professional in Human Resources (CPHR) designation. Currently, Katie serves as a Module Facilitator for the Organizational Coaching Certificate Program at UBC Extended Learning, sharing her expertise with emerging coaches. Her coaching practice centers on personal and professional growth, helping individuals increase resilience, productivity, and engagement while navigating career transitions and leadership challenges.  Grounded in her deep HR and organizational development background, Katie brings a practical, people-centered approach to coaching that blends strategic insight with genuine care for client wellbeing. Her cross-functional expertise and commitment to fostering healthy, high-performing workplaces make her a trusted partner for professionals seeking clarity, confidence, and sustainable growth in their careers and leadership journeys.

bio: Keith Cocking brings over thirteen years of progressive leadership experience at The Home Depot, where he advanced from Instructional Designer to Senior Manager of Learning Strategy and currently serves as Leadership Training Manager. In this role, he facilitates a robust, servant-based leadership curriculum to leaders at all levels, delivering classes online and in-person to audiences ranging from five to five hundred participants. Throughout his tenure at The Home Depot, Keith led enterprise-wide training initiatives, managed high-performing teams, and designed award-winning learning programs that engaged thousands of associates and drove measurable performance improvements. Earlier in his career, he founded and managed Designed Future Consulting, an instructional design and personal coaching firm serving Fortune 500 clients including UPS, Delta Technology, and Bank of America. Since 2020, Keith has operated his own executive and personal coaching practice, and in 2024 he joined Boon as an Executive and Leadership Coach, providing coaching to leaders and entrepreneurs.  Keith holds a Master's degree in Human Resource Development from Georgia State University and a Bachelor of Arts in Psychology from The University of Georgia. He is a Certified Professional Co-Active Coach (CPCC) through the Co-Active Training Institute and an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) with the International Coaching Federation. Drawing on ICF and Co-Active coaching principles, Keith partners with leaders to develop their leadership vision, execution, talent development, wellness, and productivity. He excels at helping leaders define and operationalize their leadership identity and vision, guiding them to strengthen skill and performance levels while navigating complex organizational challenges.  Keith's coaching is grounded in a forward-looking, results-driven approach shaped by decades of designing and delivering transformational learning experiences. His ability to build strong cross-functional relationships and engage leaders at all levels—from hourly staff to top executives—makes him a credible and valuable partner for leaders seeking to scale themselves and their teams. With a proven track record steering high-impact initiatives and a commitment to servant leadership, Keith brings both strategic insight and practical tools to help clients achieve sustainable growth and leadership effectiveness.
headline: 13 Years at Home Depot, Learning Leader

bio: Kelly Engle is a Certified Professional Coach (CPC) and CPA who brings a unique blend of financial acumen and people-centered expertise to her coaching practice. She began her career as a Senior Auditor at EisnerAmper LLP, where she coordinated year-end audits for SEC engagements, commercial entities, employee benefit plans, and hedge funds. Kelly later transitioned into human resources, serving as an HR Associate at EisnerAmper and then as a Human Resources Generalist at Marcum LLP, where she honed her skills in talent development and organizational dynamics. She also held roles as a Global Dental Financial Analyst at Henry Schein and Customer Service Manager at Virgin Active, building cross-functional expertise in operations, client relations, and process improvement.  Kelly holds a Bachelor's degree in Accounting from Marist University and earned her Certified Professional Coach (CPC) credential from iPEC Coaching, where she trained in the Energy Leadership Index and transformational coaching methodologies. Since founding Kelly Engle Coaching in 2022, she has dedicated herself to supporting clients in their personal and professional growth journeys. Currently, Kelly also serves as a Personal & Professional Growth Coach at Boon, where she partners with individuals to unlock potential, navigate transitions, and achieve meaningful results. Grounded in a practical, client-centered approach, Kelly combines her deep understanding of business environments with coaching tools that empower clients to lead with clarity, confidence, and purpose.
headline: CPA Turned HR & Leadership Coach

bio: Kevin Jones is a retired Ernst & Young executive with nearly two decades of experience at one of the Big Four professional services firms. Over the course of his career at EY, Kevin progressed from staff to senior manager in Tax, where he managed cross-functional teams, budgets, and executive-level relationships with global mobility clients, providing strategic advice on program competitiveness, risk, and cost structure. He later served as Chief of Staff and Executive Coach, fostering a culture of talent development and leading the firm's Coaching Lab, where he delivered one-on-one executive and career coaching and spearheaded the Leader as Coach program for mid-level managers. Most recently, Kevin held the role of Americas Workforce Advisory lead for EY's Leadership competency, managing the rollout of Transformative Leadership across the Americas, developing executive coaching programs, and advising clients on embracing leadership behaviors that deepened their capabilities. His work gave him the opportunity to cultivate cross-cultural business relationships with global clients and generate additional revenue streams based on deep knowledge of client needs.  Kevin holds a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science and Accounting from Baylor University's Hankamer School of Business and a Master's degree in Economics from Université Robert Schuman in Strasbourg, France. He is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credentialed by the International Coaching Federation and a certified coach through the Hudson Institute of Coaching. In 2020, Kevin pursued ICF certification to take business relationships to the next level, and today, as the founder of Consilium Coaching LLC, he specializes in coaching senior leaders during critical career moments. His evidence-based coaching style draws on natural curiosity, organization, and consistency of approach to help clients clarify goals and realize their inspired future. With integrity, structure, and a commitment to fostering leadership growth and resilience, Kevin brings a unique blend of Big Four operational expertise, cross-cultural fluency, and transformative coaching to guide executives through pivotal transitions and deepen their leadership impact.
headline: Former Senior Manager at EY

name: Kim Dasdemir
bio: Kim Dasdemir is a strategic communications professional with more than 17 years of experience spanning corporate communications, change management, marketing, coaching, and engineering. Her career includes senior roles at leading global organizations such as Carrier, VMware, Toyota Research Institute, Synopsys, and Texas Instruments, where she partnered with C-level and senior executives to translate complex concepts into clear, compelling narratives that drive engagement, lead change, and align teams with organizational goals. At Carrier, Kim led global communications and change management initiatives, streamlining operations with a global intake process and SharePoint redesign while building playbooks and executive content that accelerated adoption across global teams. Earlier at Synopsys, she developed external and internal communications for senior leadership, strengthening the company's global brand and thought leadership position. At Texas Instruments, Kim grew a legacy portfolio from $50 million to $70 million within six months through a data-driven optimization program, demonstrating her ability to deliver measurable business results.  Kim holds a Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering from San José State University and earned her Certified Professional Coach credential from iPEC Coaching, specializing in Life and Leadership Coaching. She has provided one-on-one coaching to clients ranging from senior managers to C-level executives, guiding them in raising their overall impact through strategic communications and leadership development. Her coaching work has included career transition support with RiseSmart, a Randstad Company, and pro-bono service through the ICF Coaches for Good initiative, supporting healthcare workers, HR professionals, nonprofit leaders, and small business owners during times of crisis.  Known for her ability to create clarity and alignment through impactful storytelling, Kim is a trusted partner to executives and cross-functional teams. She enhances culture, productivity, and connection by building frameworks that align with organizational goals and drive engagement. Her unique blend of technical expertise, strategic communications acumen, and coaching credentials makes her a credible and valuable guide for leaders navigating change, seeking to expand their influence, and striving to lead with greater impact.
headline: 17+ Years in Corporate Communications

bio: Kim Pflieger brings a unique blend of creative leadership and transformational coaching to her work with individuals and organizations. Over more than a decade, she served as Executive Producer and Co-Executive Producer at Pie Town Productions, where she led the creation of popular HGTV renovation series including House Hunters Renovation and House Hunters on Vacation. Her extensive television career, which also includes senior production roles at Gay Rosenthal Productions, Weller Grossman Productions, and Cahners Publishing, honed her ability to guide people through high-stakes transformations and deliver compelling, results-driven outcomes. Today, Kim channels that expertise into coaching, serving as a Mental Health Coach at Lyra Health, a Coach at Activate 180, and a Personal and Professional Growth Coach at Boon, where she helps employees enhance resilience, productivity, and engagement.  Kim holds a Master's of Arts in Spiritual Psychology from the University of Santa Monica and a BA in Film and Television from New York University. She is an Associated Certified Coach with the International Coaching Federation and an ELI Master Practitioner trained through iPEC Coaching. Additionally, she is a Third Degree Reiki Master. Drawing on her background in creating powerful "before and after" moments on screen, Kim now facilitates profound personal and professional transformations through Core Energy Coaching. Her approach is holistic and individualized, addressing career, relationships, health, wellness, and finances to help clients break through limiting beliefs, build better habits, and discover their full potential.  Grounded in a philosophy she describes as helping people experience "The Intoxication of Joy," Kim partners with clients to create soulful strategies, elevate performance, and navigate change with confidence and clarity. Her work improves mindsets, team dynamics, emotional intelligence, and overall life satisfaction. Whether supporting employees through workplace challenges or guiding individuals toward greater fulfillment, Kim brings warmth, accountability, and a proven track record of helping people step into more magnificent versions of themselves.
headline: Executive Producer & Coach

name: Kim Treviño
bio: Kim Treviño is the Director of Leadership and Staff Development at the Texas Department of Family and Protective Services, where she leads strategic initiatives to strengthen leadership capacity and workforce development across the agency. Her career with the department spans more than a decade, beginning as an Investigator and advancing through roles as Supervisor, Coach and Program Specialist, and Division Administrator of Leadership and Staff Development. This progression reflects her deep commitment to public service and her ability to drive meaningful change within complex, mission-driven organizations dedicated to protecting vulnerable populations.  Kim holds a Bachelor of Arts in Psychology from Baylor University and a Master of Public Administration from The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley. She is a Certified Professional Co-Active Coach (CPCC) through the Co-Active Training Institute, bringing a structured, evidence-based approach to her coaching practice. Her bilingual proficiency in English and Spanish further enhances her ability to connect with diverse leaders and teams across Texas.  With her unique blend of frontline experience, operational leadership, and professional coaching credentials, Kim partners with leaders navigating the challenges of public sector work. She understands the pressures of high-stakes environments and helps clients build resilience, clarify their leadership vision, and create sustainable impact. Her coaching is grounded in empathy, practical insight, and a genuine dedication to developing leaders who can inspire and support their teams through complexity and change.
headline: Director of L&D, State Government

bio: Kimberli Cumming is an executive leadership coach and psychotherapist who brings a unique blend of business acumen and clinical expertise to her coaching practice. She served as Managing Director of the Executive MBA program at the University of Michigan's Ross School of Business from 2015 to 2024, where she led strategy, program development, and delivery of transformational business education across campuses in Ann Arbor and Los Angeles. Earlier in her career, Kimberli spent more than eight years as Executive Director of The Women's Center of Southeastern Michigan, where she championed organizational mission, more than doubled contributed income, and shepherded the young organization through its first executive leadership transition and multiple stages of growth. She also directed consulting and transition services for the Nonprofit Association of Oregon, leading a team of thirty consultants and providing strategic guidance to boards and executive leaders across the state.  Kimberli holds an MBA and a Master of Social Work from the University of Michigan, as well as a Bachelor of Arts in Psychology from Michigan State University. She is a Licensed Master Social Worker and holds an Executive Coach certification from Michigan Medicine. Currently, she maintains a private practice as an executive leadership coach and psychotherapist, serves as an executive coach for Michigan Medicine, and coaches with Boon, a platform offering personalized coaching at the intersection of mental wellbeing and professional development. Her work focuses on helping employees increase resilience, productivity, and engagement.  Describing herself as an empathy enthusiast, leadership nerd, culture builder, and DEIJ advocate, Kimberli integrates her deep understanding of human behavior with her executive leadership experience to support leaders navigating complex organizational challenges. Her dual expertise in psychotherapy and business strategy enables her to partner with clients on both personal and professional growth, fostering leadership effectiveness grounded in self-awareness, authenticity, and meaningful impact.
headline: Psychotherapist & Executive Coach

bio: Kristen Ell is a Certified Executive Coach and strategic HR leader with a rich background spanning talent strategy, people operations, and leadership development. Her career includes roles as a Founding Partner at the Center for Coaching in Organizations, Executive Coach at Boon Health, and Internal Coach at Sensiba LLP, alongside senior HR positions such as People Operations Director at Market Performance Group and Global HR Manager at MOCON. Kristen has also served as a Talent Optimization Consultant and Executive Coach at Cole Harder, where she designed and facilitated leadership development training on communication, accountability, and building engaged teams, and led 360° feedback processes using positive psychology methods. Earlier in her career, she honed her HR expertise at organizations including The Scoular Company and Korn Ferry, building a strong foundation in talent management, employee relations, and organizational effectiveness.  Kristen holds a BA in Anthropology and Psychology from the University of Minnesota Duluth, an Executive Coaching credential from St. Thomas University, and an HR Generalist Certificate from the University of Minnesota. She is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) through the International Coaching Federation and holds a Certificate in Applied Positive Psychology from The Flourishing Center, along with PHR, SHRM-CP, and CAPP designations. Her coaching philosophy is rooted in neuroscience and positive psychology, inspired by Viktor Frankl's belief that "between stimulus and response there is a space, and in that space is our power to choose." Kristen partners with leaders to cultivate self-awareness, resilience, and the capacity to navigate change with intention. She describes her approach as sitting beside clients in whatever brave looks like for them, exploring and challenging perspectives to expand what is possible and awaken leaders to achieve their full potential—both individually and in connection with others. With her blend of HR acumen, coaching expertise, and commitment to fostering joy and growth, Kristen is a trusted catalyst for leaders seeking to lead with clarity, courage, and impact.
headline: Former Executive Coach at Korn Ferry

name: Laëtitia Kutta
bio: Laëtitia Dasini Kutta is the founder of Optimal Growth, LLC, where she serves as an executive coach and speaker helping professional women and leaders strengthen their communication, team dynamics, and work relationships. Her career spans notable organizations including National Instruments, where she spent over four years as a Staff Technical Communications & Localization Professional leading cross-functional projects and process improvements, and Audi of America, where she contributed to organizational development and learning initiatives. Laëtitia has also held strategic roles at Whitestone REIT as a Corporate Strategy Analyst and at Kelly as a Business & Communications Strategist, bringing a well-rounded perspective on talent strategy, business analytics, and organizational effectiveness.  Laëtitia holds a Global Master of Business Administration (MBA) from The George Washington University School of Business, with a focus on Human Capital, Business Analytics, and Project Management, as well as a Master of Arts in Translation & Interpreting from the University of Westminster and a Bachelor of Arts in Business & Linguistics from Université Paris-Sorbonne. She is an ICF Associate Certified Coach (ACC) and a Certified Professional Coach (CPC) through iPEC Coaching. Her coaching philosophy centers on moving beyond outdated corporate communication methods by integrating coaching, teaching, mediation, and psychology to help clients develop their communication skills and perform optimally.  With solid business experience across industries and a passion for fostering lasting impact and connection, Laëtitia brings a unique blend of strategic insight, cross-cultural fluency, and people-centered expertise to her coaching practice. She partners with clients to address the high cost of miscommunication in the workplace, guiding them to improve performance, strengthen relationships, and achieve sustainable growth. Her proven track record in leadership, public speaking, and organizational behavior makes her a credible and valuable resource for professionals seeking to elevate their communication and leadership effectiveness.
headline: Executive Coach & Speaker

name: Laila Al-Marashi
special_services: ADHD; Anxiety / Depression; Career; Confidence; Leadership; Mindfulness and Meditation; Stress Management; Work / Life Balance
bio: Laila Al-Marashi brings over 18 years of corporate experience in engineering, project management, and leadership roles at marquee organizations including Genentech, Johnson & Johnson, Covidien (Medtronic), and Boston Scientific. At Genentech, she advanced from Project Management Consultant to Principal Project Manager in Device and Packaging Development, serving as Chief of Staff to the leadership team and as an Internal Coach and People Manager. Her technical foundation began with roles as an R&D and Manufacturing Engineer at Boston Scientific and evolved through program management positions at Johnson & Johnson's Cordis division and Covidien, where she led cross-functional initiatives in medical device development.  Laila holds a Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering from the University of California, Berkeley, and is a Certified New Ventures West Integral Coach with extensive training in coaching methodologies including Internal Family Systems, Embodied Leadership from the Strozzi Institute, Positive Intelligence, and Inner Team Dialogue (Level 2 Advanced Practitioner). She holds the Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credential from the International Coaching Federation and a Project Management Professional (PMP) designation. Her coaching philosophy centers on helping clients feel truly seen and heard, partnering with empathy and curiosity to challenge limiting beliefs, reclaim values, and unlock the courage and confidence needed to thrive.  Since 2017, Laila has dedicated herself fully to coaching, specializing in supporting corporate female leaders in STEM to overcome imposter syndrome and unlock their leadership potential. She currently serves as a Leadership Coach with Growthspace, a Mental Health Coach with Lyra Health, and a Professional Development Coach with Boon, and has coached executives at the National Institute of Biomedical Imaging and Bioengineering. Drawing on her deep technical expertise, leadership experience, and commitment to cultivating resilience and connection, Laila helps clients create harmony, develop confidence, and build the careers and lives they truly want and deserve.
headline: 18 Years in Engineering at Genentech, J&J

bio: LaKrisha Newbill is a seasoned human resources and operations leader with a diverse career spanning healthcare, higher education, nonprofit, and technology sectors. She has held senior HR roles at organizations including Stitch Fix, where she served as People & Culture Business Partner Manager, the University of Notre Dame, where she worked as a Human Resources Consultant, and YWCA North Central Indiana, where she established the HR department from the ground up as Director of Human Resources. Currently, LaKrisha serves as Director of Human Resources at the International School of Indiana and is the Founder and Primary Coach of NspireU Coaching, LLC, a practice she launched in 2020. Her professional experience includes strategic partnership with leadership teams, designing employee development programs, facilitating organizational change, and driving measurable improvements in engagement and performance across varied environments.  LaKrisha holds a Master of Business Administration from Bethel University and a Bachelor of Science in Business from Indiana University South Bend. She is a certified IIN Professional Health Coach and holds a Mental Health First Aid Certification from the National Council for Mental Wellbeing. Through NspireU Coaching, LaKrisha focuses on empowering introverted women by developing personalized coaching programs centered on confidence building, career development, and personal growth. She guides clients in overcoming fears and challenges, utilizing a range of coaching methodologies to help them identify and achieve their goals. Her approach includes creating workshops, webinars, and group coaching sessions that enhance self-awareness and communication skills, fostering long-term self-improvement and measurable results.  With a proven track record in leadership, process improvement, and employee engagement, LaKrisha brings a practical, people-centered philosophy to her coaching. Her background in human resources consulting, training facilitation, and organizational development—combined with her commitment to continuous improvement and empowerment—positions her as a credible and impactful partner for women seeking to expand their leadership range, navigate career transitions, and achieve personal and professional growth.
