name: Laura Aziz
bio: Dr. Laura Aziz brings more than two decades of healthcare leadership and transformation experience to her executive coaching practice. Her career spans marquee organizations including IBM, Cleveland Clinic, Mayo Clinic, and CSC (now DXC Technology), where she held senior program and project management roles driving large-scale clinical IT implementations, electronic health record integrations, and organizational change initiatives. As Director of the Project Management Office at Cleveland Clinic and Project Director at Mayo Clinic, Laura led global teams through complex system conversions, workflow redesign, and clinical transformation. Her deep expertise in healthcare informatics, population health management, and digital transformation has enabled her to partner with leading organizations such as Blue Cross Blue Shield, Chevron, BP, Nordstrom, American Express, Bayer, Moderna, and Capital One.  Laura holds a PhD in Public Health, Health Policy, and Administration from the University of Illinois Chicago, along with a Master of Health Professions Education from the same institution. She completed executive education in Digital Business Strategy at Columbia Business School and earned her Certified Executive Coach credential from the Center for Executive Coaching. Her professional certifications include ICF Professional Certified Coach (PCC), Certified Team Coach, Breakthrough Coach Master, Prosci ADKAR Change Management Professional, and Project Management Professional (PMP), among others. Laura also serves as MBA Faculty at Southern New Hampshire University, teaching organizational strategy and healthcare informatics.  As founder of Meva Solutions, Laura specializes in executive and leadership coaching with a focus on helping ambitious leaders enhance executive presence, build influence, and navigate career transitions without burnout. Drawing on her extensive background in change management, emotional intelligence, and strategic leadership, she partners with clients to increase self-awareness, build psychological safety, manage stress, and create sustainable work-life integration. Laura's coaching philosophy centers on leveraging personal strengths, fostering resilience, and translating insight into measurable results. Her unique blend of clinical expertise, Fortune 500 consulting experience, and advanced coaching credentials positions her as a trusted advisor for leaders seeking to elevate their impact and accelerate their careers.
headline: Former American Express, Cleveland Clinic

name: Laura Fallon
bio: Laura Fallon brings a distinctive blend of Fortune 500 operating experience and deep coaching expertise to her work with leaders navigating growth and transformation. She began her career at Merck, where she spent three years in roles spanning vaccine manufacturing, supply chain management, and Lean Six Sigma, driving a transformational cost-reduction initiative and earning her Green Belt certification. Laura then joined Eli Lilly and Company as a Global Marketing Fellow through Stanford's Charles P. Bonini Fellowship program, leading competitive analysis workshops that informed global brand strategy for a major biomedicines portfolio. She continued her healthcare leadership journey at Tenet Healthcare as a Leadership Development Program Associate, rotating through hospital CEO reporting lines in Detroit and Philadelphia, where she facilitated cross-departmental initiatives ranging from cardiac surgery program restarts to population health frameworks. Laura later brought her strategic and people-centered skills to Burning Man Project, serving in roles from Philanthropic Engagement Coordinator to Business Culture Operations Manager, where she spearheaded an organization-wide cultural change management strategy and led over 25 weeks of Listening Circles to support teams through unprecedented transition.  Laura holds a Master of Business Administration from Stanford University Graduate School of Business and a Bachelor of Science in Chemical Engineering from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. She is a Certified Professional Co-Active Coach through the Coaches Training Institute, accredited by the International Coaching Federation, and holds the ICF Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credential. Since 2017, Laura has operated her own coaching practice, Intrapersonal Insights, LLC, where she partners with clients to find self-compassion, reconnect with their inner authority, and rediscover freedom and joy. More recently, as a Professional Development Coach at ZS, she has guided Directors through large-scale team restructurings and supported global Inclusion and Diversity leaders.  Laura's coaching philosophy centers on helping people set down the habit of struggle and stand in their full radiance. Drawing on her years leading complex initiatives across healthcare, non-profit, and consulting environments, she brings a grounded, transformational approach that blends strategic insight with deep emotional intelligence. Whether facilitating cultural change, navigating interpersonal dynamics, or supporting leaders at inflection points, Laura offers clients a rare combination of operational credibility, formal coaching training, and a warm, human-centered presence.
headline: Former Marketing at Merck, Stanford GSB

bio: Lauren Zulli is a systems-thinking executive coach and consultant with a unique foundation spanning a decade in environmental sustainability and nine years in leadership development. As the owner of HOLOS Coaching & Consulting since 2016, she partners with leaders and organizations to drive culture transformation, build high-performing teams, and optimize human potential through a holistic, four-dimensional approach. Lauren has served as a Guide and Executive Coach at Chief since 2022, where she has coached more than 30 VP, SVP, and C-suite women across Fortune 50 enterprises to startups, fostering heightened self-awareness and accelerated leadership growth. She also holds coaching and consulting roles with FlashPoint Leadership Consulting and The Centre for Organization Effectiveness. Earlier in her career, Lauren spent nearly a decade at Herman Miller (now MillerKnoll), progressing from Sustainability Engineer to Senior Sustainability Engineer and ultimately to Internal Coach and Senior Talent Strategist, where she co-designed and managed a global internal peer coaching program, trained 65 internal coaches toward ICF credentialing, and led culture integration efforts following the Herman Miller and Knoll merger.  Lauren holds a Master of Business Administration in Sustainability from Duquesne University and dual Bachelor of Science degrees in Physics & Astronomy and Applied Mathematics from the University of Pittsburgh. She is a PCC-certified coach credentialed by iPEC Coaching and holds a Certified Psychological S.A.F.E.T.Y. 1:1 Coach credential from the Academy of Brain-based Leadership. Her coaching is rooted in neuroscience, systems ecology, and integral theory, and she has trained as a Mindfulness-based Stress Reduction teacher and taught yoga, meditation, and breathwork. Lauren's philosophy centers on sustainable transformation through addressing four interconnected dimensions: leaders' inner worlds, how they show up, team culture, and organizational systems. She believes that inner work is leadership work, that culture is shaped by what is tolerated rather than celebrated, and that systems thinking beats symptom-fixing.  Grounded in real human experience and evidence-based methodologies including Cognitive Behavioral Coaching, Lauren brings a practical, outcomes-oriented approach to every engagement. Her cross-functional expertise—from environmental sustainability and strategic talent development to executive coaching and culture consulting—enables her to help leaders and organizations navigate complexity, build psychological safety, and create the conditions for people to do their best work. Whether coaching individuals, facilitating transformational leadership programs, or consulting on systemic change, Lauren is committed to transforming the whole system, not just the loudest symptom.
headline: Former VP-Level HR Leader

bio: Leah Potkin is a talent leader and executive coach with deep expertise in scaling organizational culture and developing leaders at high-growth technology companies. She has held senior leadership roles at prominent organizations including Wayfair, where she served as Global Head of Leadership Development, and Toast, where she led Coaching and Leadership Development. Most recently, Leah served as Principal of Leadership Development at ZoomInfo and currently holds the role of Principal, Leadership Development Partner at HubSpot. Earlier in her career, she navigated rapid growth as Director of People at Chicago-based startup SpotHero, building people systems and culture during a critical expansion phase. Her career reflects a consistent focus on aligning people strategy with business outcomes in dynamic, fast-paced environments.  Leah holds a Master of Business Administration from Northwestern University's Kellogg School of Management and a degree in English from the University of Michigan. She is a Certified Professional Co-Active Coach (CPCC) credentialed by the Co-Active Training Institute and holds an ACC credential from the International Coach Federation. Through her independent practice, LP Coaching & Training, Leah partners with leaders to gain clarity on their leadership priorities, lead effectively through ambiguity, and support the evolving needs of their teams and businesses. Her coaching philosophy combines a people-first approach with business acumen, enabling her to tackle complex challenges and deliver outcomes that serve both individuals and organizations.  Leah's credibility as a coach is grounded in her hands-on experience building leadership development programs at scale, advising executives through periods of transformation, and fostering cultures that support sustainable growth. Her ability to blend strategic insight with empathy makes her a trusted partner for leaders navigating the demands of modern, high-velocity organizations.
headline: Global Head of Leadership Development at Wayfair, Toast

name: Leah Ward
special_services: Athletes; Finance Professionals
bio: Leah Ward is an executive coach with over 20 years of corporate experience spanning financial management, strategic operations, and leadership development. Her career includes senior financial roles at National Geographic, where she managed over $50 million in strategic planning, analysis, and reporting for the Office of the CFO, and at Allscripts, where she conducted comprehensive financial analyses with revenue and cost of goods sold exceeding $100 million. Leah has also served as a financial manager at Davisbase Consulting, where she implemented review and reporting techniques that increased captured revenue by 38 percent, and held financial analyst and planning roles at International Farming Corporation. Her deep expertise in financial strategy, budget management, process optimization, and cross-functional leadership provides a unique foundation for her coaching practice.  Leah holds a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration with a concentration in Finance from West Virginia University and completed Certified Authentic Leadership Coaching training through Authentic Leadership Advisors. She is an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) through the International Coaching Federation and holds certifications as a Positive Intelligence Coach and in DISC+ Values Assessments. As the founder of Authentically Connected Coaching and an executive business coach with The Association of Professional Builders, Leah partners with executives, high-potential leaders, entrepreneurs, and business owners to foster leadership excellence, drive business growth, and cultivate positive mindset shifts. Her coaching philosophy is rooted in the belief that unlocking potential leads to lasting transformation, blending her extensive financial and operational acumen with personalized, outcomes-oriented strategies.  Leah's approach integrates advanced coaching techniques with a holistic understanding of individual and organizational needs. She specializes in helping leaders navigate complex decisions, enhance profitability and operational effectiveness, build high-trust teams, and achieve both professional and personal well-being. Whether guiding residential builders through strategic growth, supporting professionals at BetterUp with a 95 percent client retention rate, or delivering tailored one-on-one coaching and workshops, Leah brings clarity, authenticity, and measurable impact to every engagement. Her commitment to continuous growth, combined with her proven track record in driving organizational success and empowering individuals, makes her a trusted partner for leaders seeking meaningful and sustainable transformation.
headline: 20+ Years in Finance, National Geographic

name: Leann Ferry

bio: Leann Ferry is a seasoned HR professional and executive leadership coach with over 20 years of experience in cross-cultural communications, program management, and leadership development. Currently serving as Director of HR & Administration at California Indian Legal Services, she leads all HR and administration functions for a nonprofit legal aid law firm supporting Native Americans and Tribes across five California offices, while also providing internal executive leadership coaching to director-level staff. Since 2015, Leann has owned and operated Courageous Mindset, where she partners with leaders in U.S. government departments and agencies, technology companies, nonprofits, legal services, and small businesses. Her past clients have included leaders from California state government, universities, energy, telecommunications, healthcare, banking, and biopharmaceuticals. She is also the author of Speak Up Stand Strong, a book empowering women to develop courageous voices and communicate with confidence and resilience.  Leann holds a Bachelor's degree in Biological and Physical Sciences from the University of California, Davis, and a Master's degree in Public Administration from the University of Alaska Anchorage. She is credentialed as a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) through the International Coach Federation and holds the SHRM Certified Professional (SHRM-CP) designation. Her coaching expertise centers on collaborative leadership, work-life balance, boundary setting, and courageous communication. Drawing on a strengths-based and positive psychology approach, Leann helps leaders increase self-awareness, shift self-limiting beliefs, and elevate communication skills to thrive, influence, and empower others.  What makes Leann a credible and valuable coach is her unique blend of hands-on HR leadership, international experience living and working as an expat in China, and deep commitment to helping clients grow their personal courage. She has designed and delivered training on effective communication, personal development, and public speaking for organizations including Beijing Foreign Studies University, the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs, and PositivePsychology.com, where she created science-based tools on resilient communication. Leann's coaching philosophy is grounded in creating a confidential, judgment-free space where clients can explore their own best path forward, receive actionable feedback, and develop the clarity, planning, and courage necessary to step out of their comfort zones and achieve their most important goals.
headline: 20+ Years in HR & Legal

bio: Leroysha Carmichael is a professional and personal growth coach who brings a thoughtful, client-centered approach to helping individuals navigate change and unlock their potential. Since 2020, Leroysha has served as Founder and Coach of Adaptive Focus, LLC, building a practice dedicated to supporting clients through transitions and development. Currently, Leroysha also coaches with Boon, a role held since 2023, where she continues to expand her impact by guiding clients toward greater clarity, resilience, and fulfillment in both their professional and personal lives.  Leroysha holds a Master of Science in Positive Psychology Coaching from Life University, grounding her work in evidence-based practices that emphasize strengths, well-being, and sustainable growth. She also earned a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration and Management from Southern Polytechnic State University, providing a solid foundation in organizational dynamics and leadership. As an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) credentialed by the International Coaching Federation, Leroysha adheres to the highest standards of coaching excellence and ethics. Her blend of academic rigor, professional training, and genuine commitment to client success makes her a trusted partner for those seeking meaningful transformation and a more adaptive, focused approach to the challenges and opportunities they face.
headline: Professional Growth Coach

name: Lia Bartsocas
special_services: Change Management; Christians; Emerging Leader; Executive Coaching; Finance Professionals; Financial well being; Leader Management; Leadership; Leadership / Professional Development; Manager & New Manager; Marketing Professionals; Performance Management; Relationship Management; Sales Professionals; Success Capacity; Succession Planning; Work / Life Balance
bio: Lia Bartsocas is a certified executive, leadership, life, and mental health coach who brings a unique foundation as a former corporate lawyer to her transformative coaching practice. Her legal career spanned prominent organizations including KYRIAKIDES GEORGOPOULOS Law Firm, a leading European Legal 500 firm where she advised Fortune 500 clients such as Coca-Cola and Bayer, as well as roles at EFG Private Bank and ATTICA BANK. Rising from summer intern to Legal Advisor and later serving as In-House Legal Counsel and Legal Compliance Officer, Lia developed deep expertise in navigating complex corporate environments, building cross-functional relationships, and achieving measurable results under pressure. Since transitioning to coaching in 2020, she has partnered with professionals at all levels to overcome fear, break through limiting beliefs, and achieve career and personal breakthroughs including promotions, career pivots, and renewed purpose.  Lia holds a Bachelor of Laws (LL.B.) Honours from Coventry University and an MA/LPC with Business from BPP Law School, complemented by studies at Syracuse University. Her coaching credentials include Professional Certified Coach (PCC) designation, Executive Leadership Coach certification from Inflexion, and LINC Personality Profiler Trainer & Coach certification. She is also a Facilitator and Trainer in Neurolinguistic Programming with the iNLP Center. Drawing on accredited mastery in NLP, CBT, and Parts Work, Lia integrates frameworks from thought leaders like Tony Robbins, Byron Katie, and Joe Dispenza to help clients increase self-awareness and move from their current state to their desired outcomes.  Lia's coaching philosophy centers on the belief that everyone is whole and capable, and that transformation begins by quieting the inner critic and using fear as a springboard for action. She specializes in helping professionals—from pharmaceutical executives to legal partners—navigate uncertainty, build resilience, and develop healthier habits in all areas of life including career, relationships, health, and finances. Currently serving as an A180 Coach with Activate 180 and having coached first-year engineering students at Cornell University, Lia creates a safe, non-judgmental space where clients explore their challenges, clarify their values and goals, and collaboratively devise strategies to bridge the gap between where they are and where they aspire to be. Her empathetic, results-oriented approach empowers leaders to tap into their inner power, elevate their performance, and thrive with confidence.
headline: Advised Coca-Cola, Bayer As Corporate Lawyer

name: Liliane de Vries
special_services: Addiction / Substance Abuse; Anxiety / Depression; Burnout; Cancer Patients; Conflict Resolution; DE&I / Belonging; Eating Disorders; Entrepreneurs; Executive Coaching; Extroverts; Government; Healthcare Professionals; Hospice Professionals; HR Professionals; Marriage & Family Therapy (MFT); Mindfulness and Meditation; Nutrition; Performance Management; Stress Management; Terminally Ill Patients; Wellness; Working Mothers
bio: Liliane de Vries is the founder of ALIVE with Liliane and ALIVE in Healthcare, bringing together more than 20 years of experience as a Registered Practical Nurse with nearly two decades of coaching and leadership development in healthcare organizations. A non-practicing RPN, Liliane has worked extensively with healthcare systems including Unity Health Toronto, SCO Healthcare, and TBRHSC, delivering workshops and leadership coaching across Canada, the United States, and South Africa. She has also served as a Personal and Professional Growth Coach with Boon and LifeRamp, and as a Relationship Systems Coach with CRR Global since 2010, working with teams ranging from two to fifty people. Her unique approach centers on Relationship-Centred Care, grounded in the belief that healthy relationships among healthcare professionals are foundational to stellar patient-centered care.  Liliane holds a Certified Professional Co-Active Coach (CPCC) credential from the Coaches Training Institute, earned between 2001 and 2003, and is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) with the International Coaching Federation. She is also a graduate of the Co-Active Leadership Program and has completed training at CRR Global in systems thinking and relationship systems coaching. Additionally, she holds a certificate in Workplace Wellness and Health Promotions from Centennial College. Bilingual in English and French, Liliane has created innovative programs such as Leadership Circles and Nursing Leadership Circles, aligned with the LEADS framework of Leading Self, Engaging Others, and Systems Thinking. She recently launched "Join the Movement – Nurses Reclaim Life," a global community where nurses gather weekly to share experiences, learn from one another, and reclaim their passion for the profession.  Liliane's coaching philosophy emphasizes mental fitness, experiential learning, and real-life application, drawing on her training as a Positive Intelligence (PQ) Coach. Her work supports leaders and frontline staff in navigating the fast-paced, ever-changing demands of healthcare, building high-trust relationships, and sustaining personal and professional growth. With a deep commitment to empowering nurses and healthcare leaders, Liliane brings authenticity, systems-level insight, and a proven track record of creating sustainable change in complex organizational environments.
headline: 20+ Years As Registered Nurse & Coach

name: Lisa Barella
special_services: ADHD; Burnout; Resilience; Stress Management; Therapy; Wellness
bio: Lisa Barella brings a unique blend of corporate strategy, behavioral health leadership, and coaching expertise to her practice. Early in her career, she held roles at Unisys as a Strategic Marketing Analyst and at the Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia, where she designed and implemented marketing campaigns and managed key vendor relationships. She also spent time at Stanford University Graduate School of Business as a Program Manager in the Center for Entrepreneurial Studies, developing marketing collateral and managing resource databases. Later, as Manager of the Nutrition Specialist Coach Program at Ontrak, Inc., an AI and technology-enabled behavioral health company, Lisa built and led a multi-disciplinary team of over 25 professionals, providing operational and strategic program development in a fast-paced, virtual environment. She also served as an Assistant Professor of Exercise and Sport Science at Coastal Carolina University, where she taught, conducted research on the impact of exercise on cognitive function, and advised students. Additionally, Lisa directed fitness operations at Saint Mary's Center for Health and Fitness, overseeing a team of 22 staff members and developing medically integrated fitness programs for diverse patient populations.  Lisa holds a PhD in Exercise and Sport Science with an emphasis in Sport and Exercise Psychology from the University of North Carolina at Greensboro, where she researched the impact of physical activity on health-related quality of life and executive function. She also earned a Master's degree in Clinical Mental Health Counseling from UNCG, an MBA from Villanova University, and a BS in Business Administration from Susquehanna University. As a Licensed Clinical Mental Health Counselor Associate (LCMHCA) in North Carolina and founder of True Self Counseling of North Carolina, PLLC, she provides clinical mental health counseling using evidence-based approaches. Lisa is credentialed as a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) through the International Coach Federation and as a National Board Certified Health & Wellness Coach (NBC-HWC). She is also certified in leadership development tools and assessments, including the EQ-i 2.0 and EQ 360, Hogan Assessment, Leadership Circle Profile, and Myers-Briggs Type Indicator.  Through Barella Coaching & Consulting, LLC, Lisa has delivered over 2,300 hours of one-on-one coaching on platforms including BetterUp, Spring Health, Maven Clinic, Boon Health, and National EAP/Athru. She partners with individuals to move from languishing to flourishing, providing health, career, performance, and resilience coaching grounded in strengths, positive psychology, motivational interviewing, cognitive behavioral therapy, empathy, and self-efficacy. Her coaching philosophy centers on empowerment, autonomy, and well-being, helping clients create boundaries, navigate career paths, regulate emotions, and prioritize personal and professional goals. With deep expertise spanning behavioral health, organizational leadership, and human performance, Lisa offers a neurodivergent and LGBTQIA+ affirming approach that supports clients in accessing their best selves and thriving through meaningful accomplishment.
headline: Stanford GSB, Federal Reserve

bio: Lisa Heiblum is a Mental Wellness Coach at Boon Health, where she supports clients in cultivating greater mental well-being and resilience. With a focus on mental wellness, Lisa brings a compassionate and client-centered approach to her coaching practice, helping individuals navigate challenges, build healthier habits, and enhance their overall quality of life.  Grounded in a commitment to holistic well-being, Lisa partners with clients to create sustainable strategies for managing stress, improving emotional health, and fostering personal growth. Her warm and approachable style makes her a trusted guide for those seeking to prioritize their mental wellness and unlock their full potential.
headline: Mental Wellness Coach

name: Lisa Madaschi
special_services: Burnout; DE&I / Belonging; Entrepreneurs; Marketing Professionals; Stress Management
bio: Lisa Madaschi is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) and EMCC Senior Practitioner with over a decade of global corporate marketing experience and more than 1,000 hours of coaching practice. Her corporate career includes significant roles at Whirlpool EMEA, where she served as Brand Marketing Manager for the Middle East and Africa, leading strategic development and execution of marketing campaigns across the entire brand portfolio, and as PR, Events & Media Relations Manager for Whirlpool Italia, managing product launches and sales support. She also worked at Ketchum, a leading global communications consultancy, where she planned integrated communication campaigns and managed client relations. Her background spans Europe, the Middle East, Africa, and Latin America, giving her deep insight into how leadership, influence, and culture operate in complex, matrixed business environments.  Lisa holds a Master's degree in Economics and Management of Art, Culture and Entertainment from Università Cattolica del Sacro Cuore and a Bachelor's degree in Public Relations and Corporate Communication from IULM University. She completed the Management Acceleration Program at UCLA Anderson School of Management and earned her coaching credentials through Coach Training Alliance, BetterUp, and Coaches Rising. She is also a Master Practitioner of Neuro-Linguistic Programming (NLP) and holds Hogan Assessments Certification. As Founder of MaCa Coaching & Mentoring, Lisa leads a collective of experienced coaches supporting organizations with coaching solutions at individual contributor, leadership, and enterprise levels. She currently serves as a Lead Coach at BetterUp and Professional Coach at EZRA Coaching, and is a Member of the Board of Directors for the International Coaching Federation Michigan Chapter.  Lisa partners with organizations to support leaders and high-potential talent through growth, transition, and complexity. She helps professionals strengthen leadership presence and influence, navigate career and organizational transitions, build confidence and decision clarity, and address imposter syndrome, burnout, and growth friction. Through coaching engagements with BetterUp and EZRA, she has supported leaders inside global organizations ranging from high-growth environments to Fortune 500 enterprises, including McDonald's, GE, Eli Lilly, Gilead Sciences, AstraZeneca, Warner Bros. Discovery, Delta Air Lines, Hilton, Pernod Ricard, Colgate, Stanley Black & Decker, and National Grid. Her approach blends reflective depth with practical execution, grounded in trust, accountability, and momentum, and she coaches in English, Italian, and Portuguese. With dual accreditation from ICF and EMCC and a coaching-plus-mentoring hybrid model, Lisa brings corporate credibility, cross-cultural fluency, and a structured, human, results-focused methodology that supports sustainable performance and translates insight into consistent, aligned action.
headline: Former Brand Marketing Manager at Whirlpool

name: Lisa Yarbough
special_services: Christians; Conflict Resolution; Entrepreneurs; Executive Coaching; Healthcare Professionals; Introverts; Marketing Professionals; Stress Management; Technology Professionals; Wellness; Women; Working Mothers
bio: Lisa Yarbough is a leadership development coach with over 10 years of coaching experience and more than 20 years of corporate expertise. She founded Epiphany Coaching, LLC in 2013, where she serves as a leadership coach and consultant, and currently holds coaching roles with BetterUp as a Premier Fellow Coach, Impact Group as a Leadership Development Coach, and CMP as a Senior Coach. Her corporate background includes nearly a decade at Avaya, where she held strategic marketing and brand management roles, leading product launches, developing marketing strategies, and driving measurable improvements in digital engagement and conversion rates. She has also served in coaching capacities with Jody Michael Associates and Kelley Johnson Enterprises, and as a Senior Career Consultant with IMPACT Group.  Lisa holds a Master of Science in Management Science with a focus on Organizational Behavior and Executive Coaching from The University of Texas at Dallas, a Graduate Certificate in Executive and Professional Coaching from the Naveen Jindal School of Management at UT Dallas, and a Bachelor of Business Administration in Marketing from Loyola University of Chicago. She is an International Coaching Federation Professional Certified Coach (PCC). Her coaching philosophy centers on leveraging diversity of thought, fostering authentic leadership, and addressing the whole person—mind, body, and spirit. She is passionate about supporting leaders through organizational change and empowering women in leadership to achieve professional and personal success as they define it.  With her blend of empathy, intuition, and insight, Lisa partners with management to senior-level professionals across multiple industries to navigate transformation, overcome obstacles, and reach new levels of effectiveness. Her dedication to total wellness, effective communication, and authentic leadership makes her a credible and valuable guide for leaders seeking to strengthen relationships, manage conflict, and lead with impact during times of change.
headline: 20+ Years in Corporate Marketing

specialties: ["Buddhism","Burnout","Christians","Creatives","Entrepreneurs","Executive Coaching","Hindu People","HR Professionals","Jewish People","LGBTQIA+"]
bio: Liz Garrett is a well-being and leadership coach with a diverse background spanning science, psychology, and organizational development. She has served as a Leadership Development Coach at CACI International Inc, where she supported senior civilian leaders in high-pressure, VUCA military and industrial environments, building individual and organizational resilience while applying principles of learning organizations to improve team performance. Liz has also worked as a Career Management Consultant and Coach with Right Management Great Lakes, successfully managing a high-volume caseload of career-transitioning professionals, and currently coaches with Boon Health, using a holistic approach to enhance resilience, productivity, and engagement. Since founding Essential Wellness Coaching, Inc. in 2008, she has delivered creative coaching, training, and speaking programs to a wide range of clients, including schools, insurance companies, banks, state and municipal agencies, nonprofits, and private enterprises. Earlier in her career, Liz co-owned and served as Executive Director of Association Builders, a full-service association management company providing leadership development and strategic planning to nonprofit associations.  Liz holds a Bachelor of Science in Biology from Christopher Newport University and a Master of Arts in Transpersonal Psychology from Atlantic University. She is an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) with the International Coaching Federation and a Certified Emotional Intelligence Practitioner through Genos International, as well as a Certified Health and Wellness Coach (CHWC). Drawing on her unique blend of scientific rigor and transpersonal insight, Liz translates evidence-based and metaphysical principles into practical application, helping leaders address burnout, cultivate emotional intelligence, and develop resilience. She is the author of "The Opposite of Burnout: 5 Career Strategies to Feel Valued, Be Heard, and Make a Difference" and "Intentionology: 365 Days of Living on Purpose," both reflecting her action-oriented, outcomes-focused philosophy.  Liz's coaching emphasizes practical tools to improve well-being, boost creativity, increase engagement, strengthen productivity, and inspire innovation. Her approach is particularly effective with professionals in science and engineering, leveraging strong communication and organizational skills to deliver programs that are both practical and inspirational. Whether working one-on-one, facilitating group coaching, or leading workshops on topics such as communication skills, managing conflict, and developing emotional intelligence, Liz partners with clients to create meaningful, sustainable change that enhances leadership effectiveness and promotes long-term career fulfillment.
headline: Well-Being & Leadership Coach, CACI

name: Lori Cavallero
special_services: Finance Professionals; HR Professionals
specialties: ["Finance Professionals","HR Professionals"]
bio: Lori Cavallero is an ICF-Certified Leadership Coach with more than 30 years of Human Resources experience spanning Fortune 500 companies in the pharmaceutical, life sciences, consumer products, and specialty chemicals industries. Her career includes senior HR leadership roles at Novartis, Boehringer Ingelheim, Thermo Fisher Scientific, and MacDermid Performance Solutions, where she drove global talent management, leadership development, succession planning, and organizational effectiveness. At Boehringer Ingelheim, Lori served as Associate Director of Human Resources and was recognized as a President's Award winner, while at Thermo Fisher Scientific she partnered with commercial leadership to attract and retain top talent in support of business growth strategies. Throughout her corporate career, she successfully coached and consulted senior managers through executive-level leaders on professional development and team effectiveness, leveraging tools such as 360 feedback, employee engagement surveys, and personality assessments.  Lori holds a Bachelor's degree in Finance from Sacred Heart University, a Master's degree in Counseling and Human Resource Development from the University of Bridgeport, and earned her Certified Professional Coach credential from iPEC Coaching. She is an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) with the International Coaching Federation and is certified in Hogan Assessments. Her coaching philosophy centers on uncovering what holds leaders back from being the best, most productive versions of themselves by increasing deep self-awareness, building confidence and clarity of direction, and transforming perceptions and behaviors to improve leadership effectiveness and career fulfillment. Lori focuses on emotional intelligence, effective communication, relationship building, performance management, executive onboarding, and removing barriers to success.  Currently coaching with EZRA Coaching, Boon, and through her own practice, Cavallero Coaching, Lori partners with leaders to navigate career transitions, strengthen team dynamics, and achieve leadership excellence. Her extensive background in strategic HR business partnership, combined with her practical, outcomes-oriented coaching approach, enables her to help clients build high-trust teams, improve employee engagement and retention, and translate insight into measurable results. Lori's credibility is grounded in decades of proven impact guiding leaders through organizational change, new leader assimilations, and talent strategy in complex, global environments.
headline: Former HR Leader at Novartis, Thermo Fisher

bio: Lorinda Bartlett is the CEO and Owner of Destiny Global Coaching and brings over 30 years of experience in the health and wellness industry as an athlete, coach, personal trainer, physical therapy clinician, and fitness studio business owner. As an International Coaching Federation Professional Certified Coach (ICF-PCC) with more than 2,500 coaching hours completed, she has built a distinguished career helping individuals and organizations maximize their personal and professional potential. Lorinda currently serves as Director of Programs, Mentor, and Coach at Ideal Coaching Global, where she manages programs for international schools, teaches ICF Core Competencies, and mentors students and coaches worldwide. She also partners as CEO and Manager of the Merritt-Winstead Manor & Foundation, a community retreat center and nonprofit dedicated to fostering education, wellbeing, and mindfulness. Her prior roles include serving as an Emotional Wellness and Stress Management Coach at Lyra Health, where she supported members using evidence-based cognitive behavioral therapy techniques, and operating Balanced Physique Personal Training for over 14 years.  Lorinda holds an Associate's degree in Physical Therapy from Pima Medical Institute and has completed extensive advanced training, including certifications as an Ontological Life Coach, Certified Executive Coach, Certified O.M.E. Coach, and Certified Mentor Coach through Ideal Coaching Global and Presence in Action. She specializes in Ontological and Ecological Executive Coaching with a focus on Cognitive Behavioral Coaching and is also a certified Inspire Breathwork facilitator. Her coaching philosophy centers on co-creating new awareness to unlock limitless possibilities, helping clients achieve balance of mind, body, and spirit while living according to their core values. Lorinda partners with leaders and organizations to cultivate transformative leadership skills, refine communication and collaboration, reduce stress and burnout, and align teams with their vision and mission.  With a unique blend of clinical expertise, entrepreneurial experience, and deep coaching credentials, Lorinda brings a holistic, outcomes-oriented approach to her work. Clients report improved leadership skills, confidence, emotional intelligence, and performance, along with greater creativity, productivity, and morale. Grounded in curiosity about what helps people flourish, Lorinda is committed to making a positive global impact—one leader, one team, and one organization at a time.
headline: 30+ Years in Health & Wellness

bio: Dr. Lyn Ashley Gildar is a psychologist, coach, and consultant who brings a unique blend of clinical expertise and entrepreneurial vision to her work. As the founder of Pivet since 2020, she has built a practice centered on empowering behavioral change and improving communication for sustainable, long-term outcomes. Lyn Ashley also serves as a clinical psychologist at Orange Tree Behavioral Health and as a coach with Boon Health, where she partners with clients to navigate personal and professional growth. Her earlier career includes nearly a decade as a professor at Grand Canyon University, where she shaped the next generation of practitioners, as well as roles as a psychological and medical consultant with the Arizona Department of Economic Security and a behavioral health consultant at Mountain Park Health Center.  Lyn Ashley holds a doctorate in clinical psychology from Alliant University and a bachelor's degree in psychology and sociology from the University of Colorado Boulder. Her academic foundation informs a coaching philosophy grounded in integrity, systems thinking, and cross-functional collaboration. She thrives in environments where the goal is to improve systems while working with diverse stakeholders, and she enjoys blending multidisciplinary concepts including strategy, well-being, emotional intelligence, experiential learning, and advocacy. In 2020, she co-authored "Captain Quarantine: A Child's Guide to Understanding COVID-19," which became a number one bestseller in educational psychology on Amazon within 48 hours of publication.  What makes Lyn Ashley a credible and valuable coach is her rare combination of deep psychological training, hands-on clinical experience, and a passion for creative, outcomes-driven solutions. Her work is characterized by an emphasis on behavioral change, communication excellence, and the ability to translate insight into meaningful action across a wide range of contexts and audiences.
headline: Psychologist & Executive Coach

name: Maria Vittoria Molteni
bio: Maria Vittoria Molteni is a certified executive and life coach who brings a global perspective and deep commitment to supporting individuals through meaningful transitions. Since 2020, she has built a thriving coaching practice that includes serving as a coach for Boon Health, one of the top wellbeing platforms in the United States, where she has held roles spanning executive coaching, transition coaching, and wellbeing coaching since 2021. Maria Vittoria also coaches with Solas Mind, The Humanitarian Coaching Network, and Ybab - You Before Any Business, reflecting her dedication to helping diverse clients navigate change and access their full potential. A worldwide citizen who has lived in the United States, Italy, and England, she currently resides in Miami and draws on her rich cross-cultural experience to foster openness and warmth in her coaching relationships.  Maria Vittoria holds a degree in history of art and literature from Università degli Studi di Milano and completed her life coach training at the Co-Active Training Institute in 2020. She is a Certified Professional Co-Active Coach (CPCC) and an International Coaching Federation (ICF) member, credentials that underscore her commitment to professional excellence and ethical practice. Her coaching philosophy centers on supporting people to move "from where they are to where they want to be," creating space for clients to reflect on their challenges and pave the way for an authentic, joyful, and meaningful life. Whether partnering with executives, individuals in transition, or those seeking greater wellbeing, Maria Vittoria is passionate about helping clients fulfill their vision, values, and passions, bringing both warmth and a results-oriented approach to every engagement.
headline: Global Executive & Transition Coach

name: Marie Barbezieux Rousselle
bio: Marie Barbezieux Rousselle is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) who brings 13 years of international experience spanning advertising, digital marketing, consulting, and coaching to her work with global leaders and professionals in transition. Her corporate career includes significant roles at Orange, where she served as Digital Communications Manager and Digital Account Director, managing brand content strategies and digital campaigns with budgets exceeding 700,000 euros for major clients including BMW, MNH, and the Ministry of the Interior. She also held account management positions at Boursorama and BETC EuroRSCG (Havas Group), working with leading consumer brands and collaborating with top-tier agencies such as Publicis, Havas Media, and Dentsu Aegis. Marie's cross-functional expertise encompasses digital strategy, business development, marketing communications, and strategic partnerships across both European and U.S. markets.  Marie holds a Master's degree in Management, Human Resources, and Marketing from Audencia, complemented by graduate study in International Business and Trade at American University and a Bachelor's degree in Business Law from Paris-Pantheon-Assas University. She earned her CPC (Certified Professional Coach) credential from iPEC Coaching and is a Certified Master Practitioner of Energy Leadership. Marie also completed The Science of Well-Being program at Yale University and is a certified Climate Reality Leader. Since 2018, she has served as founder and CEO of Rainbow Life Coaching, where she specializes in career and transition coaching, intercultural coaching, and global leadership development. She also works with NetExpat, coaching international expatriates and C-level executives on cross-cultural integration and career transitions, and founded Little Ecologists, a social enterprise providing environmental education to children in French and English.  Marie's coaching philosophy centers on helping individuals navigate pivotal transitions and create more sustainable, fulfilling careers aligned with their values. Drawing on her expertise in energy leadership, cross-cultural communication, positive intelligence, and habit coaching, she partners with professionals—particularly those in international environments—to unlock their potential, overcome work-related challenges, and design career paths that reflect their unique strengths and aspirations. Fluent in both English and French, Marie brings a values-driven, practical approach to coaching that empowers clients to lead with authenticity, build resilience, and make meaningful contributions in their organizations and communities.
headline: 13+ Years in Advertising & Digital Marketing

bio: Marika Sykora is a strategic business leader with deep expertise in sales operations, finance, and enablement, built over a career spanning marquee technology companies including Cisco Systems, Intel Corporation, and Harmonic. Currently serving as VP of Sales Enablement and Sales Operations at Harmonic, she leads the strategy and execution of global sales processes, technology, and initiatives to increase pipeline and drive sales success. Her earlier tenure at Cisco included roles as Senior Controller for Cisco Capital's FP&A team and Finance Business Manager supporting major sales organizations across the US and Canada. Marika's foundation in finance began at Intel Corporation and continued through senior analyst and controller positions at companies such as Maxim Integrated Products, Excite@Home, BEA Systems, and DemandTec, where she honed her skills in forecasting, revenue recognition, deal structuring, and cross-functional collaboration.  Marika holds a Bachelor of Science in Finance from the University of Oregon's Lundquist College of Business and is an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) credentialed by the International Coaching Federation. Her coaching is informed by a proven ability to build cohesive teams, solve complex business problems, and lead through change. With strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities and a track record of mentoring global teams, Marika partners with leaders to navigate growth, remove barriers to execution, and translate strategic insight into measurable results. Her cross-functional expertise, combined with her commitment to building collaborative relationships and driving positive outcomes, makes her a credible and valuable coach for professionals seeking to elevate their leadership impact and business acumen.
headline: Former Sales Ops at Cisco, Intel

name: Marilyn Jacobs
special_services: Change Management; Conflict Resolution; Creatives; Entrepreneurs; Executive Coaching; Nonprofit Professionals; Work / Life Balance; Working Mothers
specialties: ["Change Management","Conflict Resolution","Creatives","Entrepreneurs","Executive Coaching","Nonprofit Professionals","Work / Life Balance","Working Mothers"]
bio: Marilyn Jacobs brings deep expertise in strategy, process excellence, and organizational transformation, honed over a distinguished career at Johnson & Johnson. As a certified Master Black Belt and Director of Business Excellence at Janssen Supply Group, she led strategic initiatives across procurement, information technology, quality, and finance, coaching teams in Six Sigma, Lean, and Design Excellence methodologies. Her work consistently delivered measurable impact, tracking cost improvement opportunities averaging $6 million annually and guiding leadership teams through large-scale change. Earlier in her tenure at Johnson & Johnson, Marilyn served as Process Excellence Lead for Information Technology, where she developed measurement dashboards, strategic planning frameworks, and workshops that empowered associates and business partners to drive continuous improvement.  Marilyn holds a Master of Science in Jurisprudence with a focus on Health Law from Seton Hall University School of Law and a Bachelor of Arts from Rutgers University. She completed graduate training in Executive and Life Coaching at iPEC Coaching and is credentialed as an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) by the International Coaching Federation. She also holds certifications as a Project Management Professional (PMP) and Kepner-Tregoe Facilitator. As a professional life coach, Marilyn is dedicated to helping individuals navigate transitions and answer the question, "What is next?" She partners with clients facing profound shifts in development and life events, focusing on resilience, clarity, and aligned action toward their personal North Star.  Currently coaching with BetterUp and Boon, Marilyn supports leaders and professionals in unlocking their potential through self-awareness, practical goal-setting, and confidence-building. Her coaching philosophy is grounded in the belief that everything begins with a dream and a vision, and she brings a warm, outcomes-oriented approach to helping clients gain clarity, build resilience, and take meaningful steps toward their goals. With her unique blend of corporate leadership, process rigor, and creative insight—she is also an author and illustrator of children's books—Marilyn offers clients a credible, compassionate partner for leadership development, career transitions, and overall wellbeing.
headline: Former Director at Johnson & Johnson

bio: Marni Gordon is a senior marketing leader and Professional Certified Coach (PCC) with deep expertise spanning media strategy, leadership development, and organizational partnerships. She spent over a decade at Mindshare, rising to Senior Partner and Group Planning Director, where she led media planning and strategy for marquee clients including Unilever, Gillette, and Sprint. At Mindshare, Marni also spearheaded the company-wide "M Academy" professional development program, designing and delivering training for more than 500 employees across North America. She later served as Senior Vice President of Committees & Conferences at the Association of National Advertisers (ANA), curating content and securing top-tier speakers for over 150 brand and media events annually. In her current role as Senior Vice President of Partnerships at the ANA Educational Foundation, Marni leads fundraising initiatives that have surpassed $1 million in donations and secured more than 120 university memberships, strengthening the foundation's mission through innovative programs.  Marni holds a Bachelor of Science in Management with a concentration in Marketing from Binghamton University and is credentialed as a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) through the International Coaching Federation, an NYU Certified Career & Executive Coach, and a GCHQ Certified Group Coach. As founder of Marni Gordon Coaching, she partners with professionals at all levels and across industries to thrive in careers they love and achieve their goals personally and professionally. A BetterUp Lead Coach and recipient of the 2024 BetterUp Zest Award, Marni is passionate about unlocking potential and empowering clients to grow their leadership capabilities. She also created "Marni's Midlife Marketers," a LinkedIn newsletter with over 4,500 subscribers and an accompanying group coaching program. Grounded in a practical, people-first philosophy, Marni brings proven leadership impact, cross-functional expertise, and a commitment to helping clients maximize their potential and navigate career transitions with clarity and confidence.
headline: Former SVP Marketing at LinkedIn, Unilever

name: Mary Brandon
special_services: Financial well being; Leadership / Professional Development; Relationships; Thriving in daily life; Women
specialties: ["Financial well being","Leadership / Professional Development","Relationships","Thriving in daily life","Women"]
bio: Mary Brandon is the founder of Aspect Consulting Inc., a practice she established in 1992 to help individuals and organizations achieve work-life success through coaching, training, and consulting. Over three decades, Mary has built a distinguished career serving government entities at the local, state, and federal levels, designing and delivering employment and confidence-building programs for populations in transition. Her expertise spans mental health recovery programs, vocational rehabilitation services, education and college preparedness initiatives, and human capital retention strategies for human resources and human services organizations. Mary has also served as a consultant coach with Lee Hecht Harrison since 2018, and currently coaches with BetterUp, Ezra Coaching, and Boon Health, bringing her work-life coaching expertise to employees navigating burnout, career transitions, and leadership challenges. Earlier in her career, she consulted with Atlas Research to train and support Community Employment Coordinators serving homeless veterans nationwide for the U.S. Department of Veterans Affairs, and she developed award-winning vocational programming at Development Centers that achieved an 87% placement rate and 98% retention over five years in hard-to-place populations.  Mary holds a Bachelor of Science in Psychology with a Philosophy minor from Eastern Michigan University, a Master's in Hypnotherapy from Breyers State University, and earned her Associate Certified Coach (ACC) credential from the International Coaching Federation through the International Coaching Group's Coaching out of the Box program. She is also a Certified Disability Management Specialist and holds Hogan Assessments Certification. Her specialized training includes Neuro Linguistic Programming, motivational interviewing, and the Positive Intelligence PQ course, all of which inform her coaching methodology. Mary is the author of "Finding Power, Passion and Joy Being at Work" and creator of "Making Change," a stages-of-change coaching tool and curriculum grounded in motivational interviewing that helps clients navigate work-life transitions.  Mary's coaching philosophy centers on the belief that clients already possess the answers they need—her role is to ask the right questions and provide an objective space for self-discovery. Specializing in change and transition, communication and problem-solving, employment and career coaching, and personal and professional development, Mary partners with individuals to dissolve blocks, bridge gaps, and move beyond perceived limitations. Her decades of program development, her deep commitment to alleviating poverty of spirit and thinking, and her practical, outcomes-focused approach make her a credible and compassionate guide for anyone seeking renewed purpose, clearer direction, and greater satisfaction in work and life.
headline: 30+ Years in Workforce Development

name: Maryann Rodriguez
bio: Maryann Rodriguez is a seasoned leadership operations professional and accredited coach with a career spanning executive support, investor relations, and strategic enablement at high-growth technology companies and private equity firms. Currently serving as an Executive Assistant at Atlassian, she manages operations for Investor Relations and Treasury, driving end-to-end execution of quarterly earnings, investor conferences, and executive roadshows across global markets. Her background includes senior roles at MuleSoft, where she supported organizational leaders across Sales, Customer Success, and Solutions Engineering, and at Lively, Inc., where she served as Operations & Employee Experience Manager. Earlier in her career, Maryann provided executive support to founding partners at Industrial Growth Partners, contributing to successful fundraisers totaling $1.4 billion, and supported the CEO of Shipt during a $40 million Series B round. Her experience also includes roles at Liquid Realty Partners and Outlook Ventures, where she honed her skills in private equity operations, investor relations, and strategic research.  Maryann holds a Bachelor's degree in International Relations and Affairs from the University of San Diego and is an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) through the International Coaching Federation. She also earned a Neuropsychotherapy Certification from MIND WORKS CONSULTING AND PSYCHOLOGICAL SERVICES. Since 2023, she has served as an Accredited Life Coach at Boon, delivering personalized one-on-one coaching sessions that guide clients through professional and personal challenges, fostering self-discovery, resilience, and accountability. Her coaching philosophy centers on strategic enablement, cross-functional collaboration, and people-first execution, helping clients clarify priorities, overcome obstacles, and achieve measurable, lasting growth.  With a unique blend of operational excellence, strategic foresight, and empathetic coaching, Maryann brings structure to complexity and momentum to leadership goals. Her proven ability to bridge vision and execution, combined with deep expertise in supporting senior leaders in fast-paced environments, makes her a credible and valuable partner for professionals seeking to elevate their leadership impact, navigate transitions, and unlock their full potential.
headline: C-Suite Operations Leader

name: Masha Levchenko
bio: Masha Levchenko brings a unique blend of corporate marketing expertise and holistic coaching to her work with clients seeking greater clarity and alignment. She spent nearly a decade at John Hancock, progressing from Community Manager to Senior Digital Marketing Manager, where she led content strategy for JohnHancock.com and forged high-profile partnerships with brands like CNN and theSkimm. Masha also contributed to digital strategy and campaign development at Goldman Sachs within the Marcus division, honing her skills in content creation and strategic communications at two of the most respected names in financial services.  A certified professional coach through iPEC Coaching and an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) with the International Coaching Federation, Masha combines rigorous coaching training with her background in business administration from Suffolk University, where she focused on global business and marketing. As a Reiki Master and founder of Moun, a holistic wellness brand, she integrates spiritual practice with life coaching to help individuals live with greater intention and alignment. Currently coaching with Boon, Masha partners with clients to build resilience, overcome challenges, and bridge the gap between personal fulfillment and professional success.  Masha's credibility as a coach is rooted in her ability to translate years of strategic thinking and performance-driven marketing into practical, human-centered guidance. Her approach is grounded in helping clients gain clarity, improve performance, and create meaningful alignment across all areas of life, drawing on both her corporate leadership experience and her deep commitment to holistic well-being.
headline: Former Digital Marketing at Goldman Sachs, John Hancock

special_services: Accountability; Confidence; Financial well being; Leadership / Professional Development; Marketing Professionals; Mindfulness and Meditation; Procrastination; Relationships; Stress Management; Thriving in daily life; Work / Life Balance
specialties: ["Accountability","Confidence","Financial well being","Leadership / Professional Development","Marketing Professionals","Mindfulness and Meditation","Procrastination","Relationships","Stress Management","Thriving in daily life"]
bio: Matt McLaughlin, PCC, is the founder and CEO of Elustra Coaching, where he serves as an Inner Peace Leadership Coach guiding overwhelmed business professionals in conquering stress and anxiety to become more effective leaders. Drawing on his own experience overcoming debilitating anxiety and panic attacks during his transition into corporate leadership, Matt has developed a transformational approach that has earned the trust of global brands including Amazon, Costco, Google, Harley-Davidson, and Intel. Before launching his coaching practice in 2019, Matt built a diverse career spanning marketing leadership and organizational development. He served as Marketing Director at ORGANIC INDIA USA for nearly a decade, leading cross-functional teams across diverse global cultures, and previously held the role of Director of Leadership Development and Inner MBA Coach at Sounds True, where he facilitated group and individual coaching sessions for a nine-month leadership immersion program. Earlier in his career, Matt established and led marketing teams at ReedGroup, a Guardian Company, where he also implemented a company-wide mindfulness meditation program, and served as Creative Director at NETdelivery.  Matt holds a Bachelor of Fine Arts in Photography and Graphic Design from the University of Connecticut and completed his coaching training through Newfield Network's Coaching for Personal and Professional Mastery program. He is an accredited Enneagram Practitioner through Integrative Enneagram Solutions and holds a Trauma Healing Practitioner Level One credential. Currently serving on the Advisory Board for Newfield Network USA, Matt is also a contributing author to the book "Leading with Self-Awareness: Starting from the Inside Out," published in 2024. His 12-week Inner Peace Leadership Program combines leadership coaching with tools including detailed Enneagram personality profiling, guided meditations, and customized strategies addressing the root causes of anxiety, negative thought patterns, and stress. Grounded in vulnerability, self-awareness, and emotional intelligence, Matt helps leaders embrace authenticity, build trust and psychological safety with their teams, and lead with renewed confidence, passion, and purpose.
headline: Coached Leaders at Amazon, Google, Costco

name: Meghan Key
special_services: Career; Relationships; Resilience; Trauma
specialties: ["Career","Relationships","Resilience","Trauma"]
bio: Meghan Key is an ICF Certified Professional Coach (PCC) and trauma-informed practitioner with more than 15 years of experience spanning healthcare leadership, behavioral health, academic counseling, and professional coaching. Her career includes diverse roles such as Principal Owner of Meghan Key Coaching, Personal and Professional Development Coach at Boon, Community Mental Health Clinician at Neveah, Inc., and Professional Coach for the University of Pittsburgh Biomedical Masters Program. Earlier in her career, Meghan served as Owner and Administrator of ALLE-KISKI CAREGIVERS, LLC, where she launched and scaled a non-medical homecare startup, and as Corporate Compliance and Development Officer at Garda Rx, LLC, overseeing human resources, compliance, and strategic partnerships. She has also worked as a PTSD Therapist and Behavioral Specialist Consultant, delivering trauma-focused Cognitive Behavioral Therapy and coordinating comprehensive behavioral health services for diverse populations.  Meghan holds a Master of Public Health in Behavioral and Community Health Sciences from the University of Pittsburgh, a Bachelor of Science in Biology and Anthropology from Dickinson College, and completed a Practicum with Seminar in Counseling Psychology at Carlow University. She earned her Professional Coach Certification from Duquesne University and holds both Associate Certified Coach (ACC) and Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credentials from the International Coaching Federation. Her coaching philosophy centers on integrating self-awareness with actionable strategies, and she is dedicated to helping individuals unlock their full potential through life transitions, career development, and personal growth.  Meghan partners with professionals across diverse industries to co-create strategic roadmaps that turn vision into action and action into impact. Her clients value her balance of empathy and results-driven methods, grounded in evidence-based practices and a compassionate coaching presence. With a background that bridges mental well-being and professional development, Meghan brings a unique depth of expertise in resilience, leadership effectiveness, and navigating change, making her a credible and valuable partner for individuals seeking meaningful transformation.
headline: 15+ Years in Healthcare & Coaching

bio: Michael Krumpak is a leadership development strategist and executive coach with a distinguished career spanning marquee organizations including Deloitte, Samsung Electronics America, American Airlines, Gartner, BAE Systems, and AOL. As Chief Executive Officer of L4 Learning Solutions, he has built a reputation for designing high-impact leadership pipelines that deliver measurable results—including a global leadership program at Samsung that generated $2.7 million in ROI and a pioneering high-potential experience at BAE Systems that returned $2.0 million in value. His work has spanned Fortune 500 enterprises, hypergrowth companies like Chewy, and mission-critical government agencies including the U.S. House of Representatives, where he served as Director of Learning. Michael's expertise lies in executive coaching, succession planning, leadership assessment, and transformation advisory, and he has partnered with brands such as Nike, Citi, Unilever, Boston Consulting Group, and The Trevor Project to accelerate leadership readiness and organizational performance.  Michael holds a Master of Science in Industrial and Organizational Psychology from the University of Baltimore Merrick School of Business and earned his Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credential from the International Coaching Federation through continuing education at the University of Miami. He is the award-winning author of Why Smart Leaders Do Stupid Things: Lessons Learned from Lousy Leaders and the creator of the Legendary Leader Flight Plan and proprietary RADAR 360 and RADAR Assessment tools. Recognized as Best Americas Coach in both 2022 and 2023, Michael has also been honored as a Leadership Author Finalist by the National Speakers Association and received the SBA SCORE Gold Facilitator Award for his dedication to business education.  Michael's coaching philosophy centers on helping ambitious leaders transform from "smart" to "legendary" by building ready-now leadership pipelines, strengthening executive presence, and navigating high-stakes transitions with clarity and confidence. Whether guiding C-suite executives through restructures and integrations, designing scalable leadership development programs, or delivering keynotes and workshops, he brings a practical, outcomes-oriented approach grounded in decades of cross-functional expertise. His work empowers leaders to think strategically, communicate with precision, and drive sustained growth—making him a trusted advisor to CEOs, CHROs, and boards seeking to build competitive advantage through legendary leadership.
headline: Former L&D Leader at Samsung, Deloitte, American Airlines

bio: Michele Demetriou brings a deep commitment to service and community leadership to her coaching practice. With a history of board service across the greater Chicago and Cleveland areas, Michele has contributed her strategic insight and collaborative approach to organizations dedicated to strengthening communities. She has also served as Chair for the 125th Anniversary of the YMCA of Western North Carolina, leading a milestone celebration that honored the organization's legacy and impact.  Michele holds a Certified Life Coach credential from The Life Coach School, equipping her with a structured, evidence-based framework to support clients in clarifying goals, overcoming obstacles, and creating sustainable change. Her coaching is grounded in empathy, accountability, and a belief in each client's capacity for growth. Whether partnering with individuals navigating transitions or seeking greater alignment in their personal and professional lives, Michele offers a warm, practical approach that helps clients move from intention to action with confidence and clarity.

bio: Michelle Anhang is a Certified Professional Coach (PCC, CPCC) who specializes in supporting individuals and organizations through the lens of neurodiversity and mental health. With a diverse professional background that includes a decade as Financial Controller and Manager of Loan Administration at Hillmount Capital Inc., where she built financial control systems and led teams through exponential growth, Michelle brings real-world operational expertise to her coaching practice. She has also served as Principal Coach at Highrise, Inc., Leadership and Career Success Coach at SV Academy, and currently works as a Training Facilitator and Speaker with Flashpoint Training Inc., a leader in corporate training and development programs. Since founding Michelle Anhang Coaching in 2017, she has partnered with professionals navigating stress, burnout, and the complexities of leadership in both traditional and self-employed settings.  Michelle holds a Bachelor's Degree in Psychology from York University and earned her CPCC credential from CTI - The Coaches Training Institute, where she also graduated from the Co-Active Leadership Program. She is a certified Psychological Health and Safety Advisor through the Canadian Mental Health Association and a Mental Health First Aid Instructor with the Mental Health Commission of Canada. Her coaching practice draws from specialized training in Executive Function and ADHD coaching, neuroscience, mindfulness, and mental health, equipping her to address the unique challenges faced by neurodivergent professionals and those managing mental health alongside career demands.  Recognized as a trusted, compassionate, and dynamic coach, speaker, and facilitator, Michelle is passionate about eliminating stigma surrounding mental health and empowering people to create lives that support their wellbeing. She has shared her personal story of healing as a suicide loss survivor on over 100 podcasts, panels, and conferences, and leads workshops on neurodivergence, mindfulness, stress management, and mindset. Grounded in truth and mindfulness, Michelle provides a supportive container where clients can reduce anxiety, build confidence, hone time management skills, and develop an empowered mindset—achieving success without burning out.
headline: Former Financial Controller

bio: Michelle Dyett-Welcome is a Betrayal and Trauma-Informed Coach who has been guiding individuals, couples, and groups toward healing and personal growth since 2018. Working remotely with clients navigating the aftermath of betrayal trauma—including sex addicts, partners, and couples—she creates a safe, compassionate space for profound transformation. Michelle also serves as a Mental Health Coach with Lyra Health, bringing her specialized expertise to a broader audience seeking support and resilience.  Michelle holds a Master of Science in Education (MSEd) in Rehabilitation Counseling from Hunter College, providing a strong foundation in therapeutic practice and client-centered care. She is a multi-hyphenate practitioner with an impressive array of credentials, including training in Internal Family Systems (IFS) at Level 3, certification as a Brainspotting (BSP) Practitioner, accreditation as an Integrative iEQ9 Enneagram Coach (Levels 1 and 2), and certification as a HeartMath Practitioner. Her coaching philosophy centers on helping individuals heal with a deep sense of safety, integrating evidence-based modalities to address complex trauma and foster lasting personal growth.  Michelle's unique blend of trauma-informed expertise, somatic and parts-work methodologies, and personality-based insight makes her a credible and compassionate guide for clients seeking to move beyond betrayal, rebuild trust, and reclaim their lives. Her commitment to ongoing training and her integrative approach ensure that each client receives tailored, holistic support grounded in both clinical rigor and heartfelt presence.
headline: Betrayal & Trauma-Informed Coach

bio: Michelle Ehrlich is a seasoned HR executive and leadership coach with a distinguished career spanning senior roles at prominent global organizations. She served as Senior Vice President and Acting Head of People at BuzzFeed, where she led the entire People organization and optimized strategies to align employee experience with business goals. Prior to that, Michelle was Senior Vice President of People for the Americas at British Airways, overseeing HR strategy across the US, Canada, Latin America, and the Caribbean while leading union contract negotiations and organizational integration. Her executive leadership also includes serving as Director of Global Labor and Employee Relations at the Associated Press, where she directed a team of 15 and led strategic HR initiatives worldwide, and as Vice President of Human Resources at Viacom, managing HR functions across MTV Networks. Most recently, she held the role of Chief Administration and Strategy Officer at Freedman Consulting, where she designed and implemented a hybrid workplace model and provided strategic direction on diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging across all talent processes. Michelle also served as interim Head of HR Business Partners at Atlassian, leading a global team of 30 and playing a key role on the COVID-19 response team.  Michelle holds a Master of Social Work from Aurora University, a JD from the University of California, College of the Law, San Francisco, and a BA in Communications Studies with a Business Concentration from UCLA. She earned her Certified Professional Coach (CPC) credential from iPEC Coaching and is an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) with the International Coaching Federation. Currently, Michelle works as a Medical Social Worker at Satellite Healthcare Oakland, supporting dialysis patients, and maintains an active coaching practice through her firm EhrlichHR Coaching & Consulting, as well as with Boon Health and GrowthSpace. Known for empathetic listening, crisis intervention, and creative problem solving, Michelle partners with individuals and teams to achieve extraordinary results. Her coaching is grounded in a patient-centered, outcomes-oriented philosophy that draws on her deep expertise in organizational transformation, change management, talent development, and leadership effectiveness, making her a trusted advisor for leaders navigating complex challenges and driving sustainable growth.
headline: Former SVP of People, Americas at British Airways

name: Michelle Kraemer

specialties: ["Accountability","Anxiety / Depression","Change Management","Digital Well-Being","Leadership / Professional Development","Mindfulness and Meditation","Procrastination","Stress Management","Thriving in daily life","Work / Life Balance"]
bio: Michelle Kraemer is an operating executive with 26 years of experience navigating industry-defining moments at companies including Google, Stripe, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, and The New York Times. At Google, she held multiple senior leadership roles over seven years, including Head of Product Operations for Google Cloud IaaS, where she functioned as COO-partner to the GM with P&L responsibility for a multi-billion-dollar Cloud Storage business. She also served as Global Strategy Lead for Google Cloud, building and scaling a marketing analytics solution from initial investment case to scaled offering and driving the first-ever joint OKR between Google Ads and Cloud to 147% achievement. Earlier in her career, Michelle led sales teams at Buddy Media (acquired by Salesforce) as Senior Director of Sales, breaking new business with Fortune 500 clients including Walmart, GE, and Kellogg, and served in sales leadership roles at The New York Times, guiding major advertisers through the digital transformation of media. Most recently, she led Product GTM for Stripe's Incubation portfolio, driving revenue and product-market fit for strategic emerging products.  Michelle holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and a B.A. in English from Dartmouth College. She received her coach training from the Co-Active Training Institute (CPCC) and is credentialed by the International Coaching Federation as an Associate Certified Coach (ACC). Now the Founder and Principal of Michelle Kraemer Coaching and Creator and Co-Host of the BOLDER & WISER Podcast, Michelle partners with high-achieving individuals and organizations to break through legacy mindset, technology, and organizational barriers for transformative results. Drawing on her experience leading through major technology disruptions—from the rise of the Internet and mobile to cloud computing—and her personal mindfulness training, she helps clients find grounding and purposeful action amidst change. Michelle's coaching is grounded in a practical, outcomes-oriented philosophy, empowering teams and individuals at all levels to grow bolder and achieve breakthrough results.
notable_credentials: ICF ACC, Harvard MBA, Dartmouth MBA
headline: Former Product Leader at Google, Stripe, Salesforce
