bio: Mohana More brings a rich tapestry of global experience to her coaching practice, beginning her career as a flight attendant with Cathay Pacific Airways, where she collaborated with colleagues from ten different nationalities across Asia. Her professional journey has spanned entrepreneurship, education, and workforce development across multiple continents. As Director of Training and Development at Orbit Institutes Pvt. Ltd in India, she headed the soft skills and communication training vertical, designing industry-specific courses for corporate, educational, and NGO sectors. She has also served as a consultant in communication skills at Pune Institute of Business Management, where she developed and delivered programs for MBA and PGDM students across BPO, retail, capital markets, and finance sectors. Currently, Mohana serves as an instructor at American Academy of English and works as an expert coach with GrowthSpace, a personal and professional growth coach with Boon Health, and a therapeutic coach with FTC LLC.  Mohana holds a Bachelor's degree in Commerce and Economics from Sydenham College of Commerce and Economics and is an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) with the International Coaching Federation. As a certified Core Energy Coach with a specialization in Transition Coaching, she brings a unique blend of cross-cultural communication expertise and coaching methodology to her practice. Her extensive background working with minority and underrepresented groups in India, combined with her certification in Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion in the workplace, informs her commitment to creating equity and inclusiveness for individuals and organizations. Mohana's coaching sessions focus on imparting clarity, understanding potential, and facilitating clients to become the version of themselves they desire through learning, trusting their abilities, and viewing life through an empowered lens. Her global citizenship and deep empathy for diverse cultures make her particularly effective in helping clients navigate transitions, overcome inner blocks, realign with their values, and create meaningful, lasting change.
headline: Flight Attendant to Global L&D Director

bio: Moja Harmon is a Certified Professional Coach who founded Moja Harmon Coaching LLC in 2021, where she specializes in leadership and life coaching for individuals seeking greater fulfillment in their careers and lives. Since 2022, Moja has also served as a Personal & Professional Growth Coach with Boon Health, providing one-on-one coaching that supports the organization's mission to make mental well-being more attainable in the workplace. Through her practice, she partners with clients to navigate transitions, clarify purpose, and unlock new levels of personal and professional satisfaction.  Moja completed her training in leadership and life coaching at iPEC Coaching, earning her Certified Professional Coach credential in February 2022. She also holds the COR.E Dynamics Transitions Dynamics Specialist designation, equipping her with specialized tools to guide clients through pivotal moments of change. Grounded in a client-centered philosophy, Moja helps people who want more from their work and life translate aspiration into action, build resilience, and create meaningful progress toward their goals. Her commitment to holistic growth and workplace well-being makes her a trusted partner for anyone ready to invest in themselves and their future.
headline: Leadership & Life Coach

name: Nancy Holtze
bio: Nancy Holtze is a Master Certified Coach (ICF MCC) with over 25 years of experience coaching C-suite and senior leaders across industries and continents, including at Google, Meta, Microsoft, Salesforce, PayPal, Ecolab, Medtronic, 3M, Ernst & Young, Boise Cascade, and Delta. Her leadership coaching expertise is particularly deep in tech, EdTech, FinTech, and healthcare. Nancy's career has evolved from one-on-one executive coaching to strategic builder of coaching systems and communities, most recently serving as Director of Coaching Services at Care Deeply Consulting, where she built and led a diverse global coaching bench of over 60 professionals. She previously served as Associate Principal and Executive Leadership Coach at Korn Ferry, coaching Google executives worldwide and consistently maintaining a satisfaction score of 5 out of 5. Earlier in her career, Nancy held senior career consulting roles at SoFi, Qualcomm, and RiseSmart, where she coached over 1,500 members and executives through career transitions, business development, and leadership growth.  Nancy holds a Master's degree in Counseling and a Bachelor of Science in Education, both from the University of Wisconsin-Madison. Her ICF Master Certified Coach credential represents the highest level of coaching certification, reflecting her deep commitment to the profession and her extensive mentorship of coaches pursuing their own ICF credentialing journeys. Known for her insatiable curiosity, warm yet direct style, and ability to ask bold questions that drive insight and action, Nancy partners with leaders to navigate inflection points, strengthen relational and influencing skills, and cultivate emotional intelligence. She has designed and delivered over 200 workshops on topics including Executive Presence, Leading with Heart, Team Effectiveness, Career Strategy, Succession Planning, and Communication.  Nancy's coaching philosophy is grounded in deep curiosity, courage, kindness, and connection. She believes that through these values, leaders can transform how they show up for themselves, each other, and the world. Whether coaching a founder through scale, mentoring a coach through certification, or advising a company on building a coaching culture, Nancy brings strategic insight, empathy, and a deep belief in human potential. Her ability to design onboarding programs, recruit and develop high-performing coaches, and serve as a trusted advisor makes her a credible and valuable partner for leaders and organizations committed to sustainable growth and authentic leadership.
headline: Former Executive Coach at Korn Ferry for Google, Meta, Microsoft

name: Nancy Wolff Gossett
special_services: Anxiety / Depression; Burnout; Change Management; Conflict Resolution; Educators; Entertainment Professionals; Entrepreneurs; Executive Coaching; Government; Healthcare Professionals; HR Professionals; Jewish People; Marketing Professionals; Nonprofit Professionals; Performance Management; Stress Management; Succession Planning; Technology Professionals; Working Mothers
bio: Nancy Wolff Gossett brings a unique blend of operational leadership and coaching expertise to her work with leaders navigating career transitions and organizational change. For 25 years, she served as Executive Director of Kolodny Law Group, where she managed the firm's operations and built a deep understanding of leadership under pressure, team dynamics, and the complexities of sustaining high-performing organizations. After an unexpected pivot when the firm closed, Nancy channeled her decades of management experience into a new calling as a certified professional coach, transforming her own unplanned transition into a powerful foundation for guiding others through change.  Nancy holds a degree in English Language and Literature with a focus in General and Dance from the University at Buffalo and completed her coaching training at iPEC Coaching. She is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credentialed by the International Coaching Federation and holds the COR.E Dynamics Transitions Dynamics Specialist (CTDS) certification from iPEC. Currently, she serves as a Certified Professional Coach with LeggUP Inc., BetterUp, Boon Health, and Vesta: A New Vision for Divorce, as well as maintaining a personal and professional coaching practice. Her coaching philosophy centers on helping clients "conquer the pivot"—whether they are CEOs, first-time managers, or individuals facing unexpected career shifts—by leveraging proven techniques to unlock potential, strengthen leadership presence, and navigate transitions with confidence.  Grounded in real-world operational experience and a compassionate understanding of change, Nancy partners with leaders to improve retention, job satisfaction, and team success. Her approach is practical, empathetic, and results-oriented, drawing on her own journey from law firm management to coaching to help clients clarify their path forward, build resilience, and lead with authenticity through life's curveballs.
headline: 25+ Years Executive Director

name: Nathan Young
special_services: Storytelling
specialties: ["Storytelling"]
bio: Nathan Young is the Principal and Founder of StoryCulture Consulting, where he helps mission-driven organizations and leaders use narrative to strengthen leadership, communication, and team performance. With over twelve years of experience in storytelling and leadership development, Nathan has partnered with prominent organizations including the Brookings Institution, TEDxSanDiego, Save the Children, WorldVision International, the Alzheimer's Association, the YMCA, UC San Diego, and Indiana University. He currently serves as a Resilience Coach at Boon Health, providing leadership and resilience coaching to VPs, Directors, and Managers across tech, logistics, healthcare, and marketing industries, with a specialty in coaching technical professionals and sales teams to improve focus, communication, and motivation. Previously, Nathan founded Greater Good Storytelling, where he delivered over one hundred interactive trainings for nonprofits, scientists, entrepreneurs, and academic institutions on storytelling for fundraising, science communication, and organizational culture.  Nathan holds a BA in History from UC San Diego. His coaching philosophy centers on the transformative power of storytelling to shape identity and create influence. By blending storytelling with leadership, communication, and team-building strategies, he empowers individuals to discover their most compelling stories and use them to build trust, foster engagement, and inspire action. His workshops and coaching provide practical tools for leading with confidence, communicating with impact, and fostering deeper connections through the stories that matter most.  What makes Nathan a credible and valuable coach is his unique ability to translate narrative strategy into measurable leadership outcomes. From his early work founding The New Narrative, where he coached and mentored over fifty speakers to share personal stories with confidence and clarity, to his current consulting practice designing and delivering workshops on communication, persuasion, presentation skills, managing change, and team development, Nathan brings a proven track record of helping leaders at all levels—from CEOs to coordinators—clarify their vision, connect authentically, and lead the narrative that drives change.
headline: Storytelling & Leadership Coach

name: Nicole Kim
bio: Nicole Kim is a finance and operations leader with a distinguished career spanning private equity, investment banking, and high-growth ventures. She began her career as a Mergers & Acquisitions Analyst at Lazard in healthcare, then moved to Cartica Capital as an Analyst before joining The Carlyle Group as a Private Equity Associate in the Aerospace, Defense and Government Services Group. Nicole later advanced to Vice President at J.F. Lehman & Company, a private equity firm focused on aerospace, defense, and environmental services. She holds an MBA from Stanford University Graduate School of Business and a Bachelor of Science in Operations Research & Engineering from Cornell University. Currently, Nicole serves as VP Finance & Chief of Staff at Pro Padel League, building the top professional padel league with the world's best players.  Nicole is a certified executive coach, holding both the Certified Professional Coach (CPC) credential from iPEC Coaching and the Associate Certified Coach (ACC) designation from the International Coaching Federation. Through her coaching practice, Nicole Kim Bailey Coaching, she has partnered with leaders navigating career transitions, scaling responsibilities, and strategic inflection points. Her coaching draws on her extensive experience in finance, strategy, and operations across investment firms and operating roles, enabling her to bring a practical, results-oriented perspective to leadership development. Nicole's unique blend of analytical rigor, cross-functional expertise, and hands-on operating experience makes her a credible and valuable partner for executives seeking to expand their impact, clarify priorities, and lead with confidence.
headline: Former Private Equity at Carlyle, Lazard

bio: Nina Rubin is an executive coach with more than a decade of experience and nearly 10,000 hours of coaching practice, working with high achievers across diverse fields including touring artists, software developers, attorneys, startup founders, and executives. Before launching her independent coaching practice in 2014, Nina built a foundation in clinical psychology and employee assistance, including roles at UnitedHealth Group where she responded to over 4,500 crisis calls, coached members through complex challenges, and honed her ability to build rapport quickly and guide clients through high-stakes moments. Her background also includes early career experience in marketing and leadership training, giving her a well-rounded perspective on both organizational dynamics and individual development.  Nina holds a Master of Arts in Clinical Psychology from Antioch University-Los Angeles and a Bachelor of Arts in Political Science and Government from the University of Pennsylvania. She is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credentialed by the International Coaching Federation and earned her Professional Certified Co-Active Coach (CPCC) designation from the Co-Active Training Institute. Her coaching philosophy centers on helping clients untangle anxiety from achievement, rebuild confidence without sacrificing excellence, and set boundaries while staying ambitious. Through a warm, candid, and reflective style, Nina creates space for leaders and professionals to reconnect with joy, creativity, and purpose.  What makes Nina a credible and valuable coach is her deep commitment to helping high achievers find comfort in themselves and align success with peace of mind. She works with clients who excel in demanding fields yet quietly struggle with self-doubt, perfectionism, and pressure, guiding them to feel more fully free in their own skin. Whether coaching on professional development, leadership transitions, or personal growth, Nina's approach is both process-oriented and results-driven, focused on carving out honest, supportive space where ambition and well-being coexist.
headline: UPenn, 10,000+ Coaching Hours

bio: Olga Volgin is a Principal Software Engineering Manager at Microsoft, where she has spent nearly two decades building best-in-class user experiences for Azure. Since joining Microsoft in 2005, Olga has progressed through increasingly senior engineering and leadership roles, ultimately leading a team of ten software developers to deliver high-impact compute experiences for Virtual Machines, Virtual Machine Scale Sets, Dedicated Hosts, and Capacity Reservations in the Azure Portal—experiences used by millions and ranking at the top of Net Promoter Score contributors across more than 250 teams. Her technical leadership spans end-to-end ownership of critical Azure infrastructure UX, cross-team collaboration with over 30 partner organizations, and a consistent track record of high-throughput, high-quality feature delivery. Olga's strengths include managing complexity, driving for results, setting clarity amid competing demands, and coaching and growing team members.  Olga holds a Bachelor of Science and a Master of Science in Computer Science and Engineering from The Ohio State University. She is a certified Productivity Coach through The SeattleCoach Training & Development Company and a Microsoft MCAPS Professional Coach. As a productivity coach, Olga partners with busy professionals looking to achieve more and stress less, bringing the same positive energy, structure, and efficiency that define her engineering leadership to her coaching practice. Her approach is grounded in practical strategies for managing complexity, clarifying priorities, and sustaining high performance without burnout—insights honed through years of leading high-stakes projects and empowering technical teams to excel in fast-paced, demanding environments.
headline: Principal Software Engineering Manager at Microsoft

bio: Oumar Traore is the Director of Talent and Learning & Development at HireVue, where he leads the design and implementation of talent strategies, performance metrics, and high-potential leadership development programming. Over more than a decade with HireVue, Oumar has progressed from HR Specialist to Manager, Global People, then Senior Manager, Global People and Development, and into his current director role. Throughout his tenure, he has built and scaled people practices that span performance management frameworks, onboarding programs, succession planning, diversity and inclusion initiatives, and leadership development. His work centers on fostering a culture of coaching and mentoring to drive high performance and support career growth at all levels.  Oumar holds a Master of Arts in Instructional Design and Educational Technology from the University of Utah and a Master of Public Administration with a focus on NGO Management and Finance from Brigham Young University. He is an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) credentialed by the International Coaching Federation and is certified in Extended DISC powered by FinxS. His coaching philosophy is rooted in building networks, holding people accountable, and executing with excellence—captured in his motto: Hire, Equip, Engage, and Unleash Talent.  With deep expertise in talent management, learning and development, and organizational effectiveness, Oumar brings a practical, people-first approach to coaching. He partners with leaders to clarify talent strategies, strengthen team performance, and create cultures where individuals and organizations thrive. His blend of instructional design acumen, HR leadership experience, and coaching credentials makes him a credible and valuable guide for professionals navigating growth, transition, and leadership development.
headline: Director of Talent & L&D

name: Pam McBride
bio: Pam McBride brings a unique blend of legal partnership experience and deep coaching expertise to her work with executives, leadership teams, and organizations. She spent over 16 years as a partner at Heller Ehrman, a top-tier AmLaw A-List law firm, where she advised C-suite leaders, general counsels, and senior executives on complex real estate investment, finance, and strategic matters. During her tenure, Pam led firm-wide initiatives in hiring, retention, and development, directly mentoring more than 150 attorneys—particularly women—on career strategy, improving advancement and retention by 62% over comparison groups. Since transitioning to coaching and consulting, she has served as a Premier Fellow Coach at BetterUp, achieving the highest performance level in their core business coaching vertical, and has partnered with organizations including Springboard International, Boon Health, and Flatiron School, where she earned a 9.91 out of 10 NPS score.  Pam holds a JD from the University of Chicago Law School and a degree in International Relations from Tufts University. She has completed post-graduate team coaching certification from the College of Executive Coaching and holds advanced credentials including PCC (Professional Certified Coach) and ACTC (Advanced Certified Team Coach) from the International Coach Federation. As one of only 902 ICF-certified systemic team coaches globally out of 60,000 credentialed coaches, Pam brings rare expertise in team dynamics, stakeholder alignment, and co-creative culture building. She is also certified in Everything DiSC and The Five Behaviors by Wiley Workplace Learning.  Pam's coaching philosophy centers on unlocking human creativity and ingenuity to drive impact at the individual, team, and organizational levels. She partners with C-level executives and leaders with significant strategic responsibility as a transformative thought partner, challenger, and catalyst, helping them think bigger, navigate inflection points, and operationalize mission-driven strategies. Whether guiding founders scaling their enterprises, facilitating strategic planning and change leadership, or coaching individuals through career transitions and life satisfaction, Pam combines her legal acumen, systems thinking, and commitment to values-aligned leadership to help clients achieve their goals with clarity, confidence, and gusto.
headline: 16 Years As Law Firm Partner

name: Patrick Rhein
special_services: HR Professionals
specialties: ["HR Professionals"]
bio: Patrick Rhein is the owner of Peak Potential International, a role he has held since 2000, delivering high-impact training, executive coaching, and keynote speaking engagements to organizations worldwide. With over two decades of global experience spanning both the private and public sectors, Patrick has built a distinguished career as a facilitator, trainer, and bilingual (English-French) speaker specializing in management and leadership development, emotional intelligence, sales and business development, stress management, and team effectiveness. His international footprint includes living in eight countries across four continents, equipping him with a deep understanding of multicultural dynamics and the complexities of today's global business environment. Patrick has also served as a Success Coach and Facilitator with Peak Performance Systems since 2005, working with leaders, executives, and corporate teams to drive measurable performance improvements. Earlier in his career, he held roles including National Marketing Director at Juice Plus, where he delivered training and coaching across Europe and Asia, and executive coaching positions with organizations such as Prophete Coaching and The Talent Management Team.  Patrick holds a Certified Co-Active Coach credential from the Coaches Training Institute (CTI), completed between 2001 and 2003, and is certified in Organization and Relationship Systems Coaching (ORSC) from the Center for Right Relationship. He is a certified Emotional Intelligence Instructor, having earned credentials from both Apie and Société d'intelligence émotionnelle, and has completed specialized training in PTSD resolution through Brainsweep System Inc and Prolympian International. His educational foundation includes business administration studies at Ecole moderne de Neuchâtel, and he is a certified Lifebook Leader, reflecting his commitment to personal growth and empowerment. Additional certifications include 360 Assessment training from Leadership Circle and career counseling credentials from Costi/Ocasi.  Patrick's coaching philosophy centers on emotional and positive intelligence, helping clients navigate career-life transitions, build high-trust teams, and lead through change with clarity and purpose. His thoughtful, results-oriented interventions are known for fast turnarounds and fresh perspectives that solve problems effectively. Drawing on his rich background in career counseling, recruitment, personality assessment, and stress management, Patrick partners with senior leaders and teams to unlock their potential, enhance communication, and achieve sustained personal and organizational performance. His blend of global experience, deep expertise, and genuine passion for human development makes him a credible and impactful coach for executives and organizations seeking transformation and growth.
headline: 20+ Years in Training & Speaking

name: Patrina Smalls
bio: Patrina Smalls is an ICF-certified leadership development and life coach with a rich background spanning training, talent development, and coaching across healthcare, financial services, and education sectors. Currently serving as an Onsite Training Associate at athenahealth and a Leadership Coach at Boon Health, Patrina brings extensive experience from marquee organizations including Wells Fargo, Bank of America (Countrywide Home Loans), and BB&T (now Truist). Her career includes senior roles such as Director of Training at ChildCareGroup, where she developed professional development programs across 20 locations that resulted in a 75% increase in enrollment, and as a Learning and Development Consultant serving clients like T-Mobile and XO Communications. With a proven track record designing and facilitating training programs that drive measurable results—including an 85% sales increase and over $300,000 in revenue growth—Patrina has consistently empowered teams and leaders to achieve peak performance.  Patrina holds a Master of Science in Positive Psychology Coaching from Life University, an MBA in Marketing from Strayer University, and a Bachelor of Arts in English and Communications from Hunter College. She is an ICF Associate Certified Coach (ACC) and has served as a Guest Facilitator and Graduate Coach at Life University, where she teaches the ICF coaching model and develops positive psychology-based coaching plans for master's students. Her coaching philosophy centers on empowering leaders to inspire change and deliver results, with a focus on work-life balance, leadership effectiveness, and personal transformation. As a Training Facilitator for ACI Specialty Benefits, she helps employees integrate well-being into professional success.  What makes Patrina a credible and valuable coach is her unique blend of corporate training expertise, positive psychology foundations, and real-world leadership impact. From designing change management initiatives and talent acquisition strategies to facilitating workshops on leadership development and self-fulfillment, she has guided individuals and organizations through critical transitions. Her commitment to empowerment extends beyond her professional work—she volunteers as a self-fulfillment coach for female survivors of sexual trauma and conducts "Girl Talk" sessions for young girls. Patrina's warm, results-oriented approach and deep cross-functional expertise make her a trusted partner for leaders seeking clarity, growth, and sustainable success.
headline: L&D Director, Childcare & Education

specialties: ["Change Management","Conflict Resolution","Creatives","DE&I / Belonging","Mindfulness and Meditation","Stress Management","Yoga"]
bio: Patti Coan brings a rich background in organizational development, performance improvement, and coaching, with experience spanning healthcare, Fortune 500 environments, and consulting. She served as an Organizational Development Leader at Humana, where she developed a Sales Coaching Culture program, guided transformation and change initiatives, and co-chaired a 10,000-person Mindfulness and Compassion Group that helped 80% of participants improve their attention to the connection between emotions, thoughts, and behaviors. Earlier in her career, Patti coached primary and specialty care physicians and teams at UW Health to increase efficiencies and effectiveness, and worked as an Organizational Development Consultant at Blended Learning Solutions, where she coached leaders and teams using thinking styles and goal-setting models to grow self-awareness, productivity, and career development.  Patti holds a Master of Science in Educational Psychology with a focus on Quality Improvement and a Bachelor of Science in Education with a focus on Performance Improvement, both from the University of Wisconsin-Madison. She earned her International Coaching Federation Associate Certified Coach (ACC) credential through the NeuroLeadership Institute, specializing in brain-based coaching, and completed Raja Yoga Teacher Certification at the Himalayan Institute in Pennsylvania, focused on uniting mind and body through breath. As a Transformation Coach and Yoga Therapist, Patti guides leaders, high performers, and groups through heart-centered, embodied practices that elevate strengths, build new habits, and achieve results. She partners with clients to translate practice into behaviors, helping them ignite their light and live full, authentic lives.  Known as a "continuous improvement" model, Patti approaches coaching with balance, strength, and flexibility, blending her expertise in performance improvement with intuitive, whole-person practices. Through Samapatti Yoga, she offers professional coaching, yoga therapy, breath and mindfulness practices, and wellness workshops and retreats nationally and internationally. Her work goes below the surface, inviting clients to deepen self-awareness, build resilience, and create lasting change grounded in both neuroscience and the ancient wisdom of yoga.
headline: Organizational Development, Humana

bio: Pratishtha Bhalla is an ICF-PCC certified executive coach, workplace mental health consultant, and leadership resilience trainer who brings a unique blend of corporate consulting experience and evidence-informed coaching to high-pressure teams and leaders. She began her career as a Consultant at Accenture, where she spent five years specializing in retail planning, demand forecasting, and supply chain strategy, working with multinational clients across sourcing and procurement operations. After earning her MBA in Supply Chain Management and Financial Management from Delhi School of Management, DTU, and a B.Tech in Electrical, Electronics and Communications Engineering from Kurukshetra University, Pratishtha transitioned from corporate consulting to founding Anxiety Free Leader, where she now serves as CEO and Founder, empowering leaders to overcome chronic anxiety and panic attacks and lead with confidence.  Pratishtha holds an ICF Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credential, is a certified NLP Master Practitioner through ABNLP, a Hogan 360 certified assessor, and an Access Bars Facilitator. Her coaching practice is grounded in a neuroscience-informed, outcomes-focused approach that addresses performance stress, anxiety, burnout prevention, and emotionally intelligent leadership. Currently serving as a Leadership Coach and Mental Wellness Coach with Enablerz, a Personal and Professional Growth Coach with Boon Health, and a Leadership Coach with Meeraq, she partners with HR, learning and development, and business leaders to design workplace mental health programs that reduce burnout, build psychological safety, and strengthen leadership resilience. Her signature offerings include Manager Resilience Workshop Series, Psychological Safety for Leaders, and Anxiety and Burnout Recovery Coaching for Executives, all tailored to deliver measurable change across tech, BFSI, professional services, and high-growth environments.  What sets Pratishtha apart is her ability to translate awareness into action, mapping programs to manager behaviors that protect mental health—emotional support, practical support, stigma reduction, role modeling, risk recognition, and response skills. She has delivered representative results including reduced self-reported burnout and anxiety, improved focus and morale, stronger manager-employee trust, and higher participation in wellbeing initiatives across multi-location rollouts. As a Partner and Mindset Coach for Sports Coaches and Athletes with T-Sports Private Limited and an ACTVET Certified Leadership Coach with Emirates House Center for Consulting and Training, Pratishtha extends her expertise to athletes, sports coaches, and business leaders across India and global markets, helping clients tap into the power of their subconscious mind to achieve peak performance and lasting transformation.
headline: Former Consultant at Accenture

name: Regan La Testa
special_services: Government
specialties: ["Government"]
bio: Regan La Testa is a health and wellness coach who brings nearly twenty years of experience as an attorney at DLA Piper, a global law firm, where she navigated complex bankruptcy, commercial, and corporate matters. After beginning her legal career as a judicial law clerk to the Honorable James F. Schneider at the United States Bankruptcy Court for the District of Maryland, Regan spent two decades advocating for clients, conducting legal research, and managing high-stakes litigation. Her transition from BigLaw to health coaching was born from personal experience—balancing a demanding career while managing her daughter's chronic health issues taught her that sustainable performance requires prioritizing one's own wellbeing.  Regan holds a Doctor of Law from the University of Baltimore School of Law and a Bachelor's degree in History from the University of Virginia. She has since earned credentials in Life and Executive Coaching from iPEC Coaching, Nutrition Coaching from Precision Nutrition and the Nutritional Coaching Institute, and is a Certified Personal Trainer through the International Sports Sciences Association. She also holds specialized certifications in Gut Health and Hormone Health from CorePerform. As the founder of Green Lava Coaching, LLC dba Green Lava Wellness and a coach with Boon Health, Regan focuses on helping high-achieving women over thirty-five who excel professionally but struggle to prioritize their own health.  Regan's coaching philosophy centers on sustainable, personalized strategies rather than quick fixes or restriction. She partners with clients navigating hormonal imbalances, gut health challenges, and stubborn weight concerns, helping them reclaim energy, confidence, and a healthier relationship with their bodies. Drawing on her own journey of losing twenty pounds, building muscle, and restoring vitality, Regan offers a practical, empathetic approach grounded in functional nutrition and macros coaching. Her unique blend of high-performance legal experience and deep wellness expertise makes her a credible guide for women ready to stop running on empty and invest in their long-term health.
headline: Nearly 20 Years As Attorney at Dla Piper

bio: Rob Michelucci is a Master Certified Coach (MCC) in the top 4% of International Coaching Federation coaches worldwide, bringing over 4,000 hours of coaching experience with leaders and teams across more than ten Fortune 100 companies. His corporate leadership background spans major financial institutions including Fannie Mae, where he served as Head of Way of Working Lean Methodology & Academy and coached six senior executives including the Chief Operating Officer, and Capital One, where he led process excellence initiatives across technology and finance. At Famous Supply, Rob served as Director of People and Leadership Development, spearheading leadership strategy for 150 leaders and driving a 17% productivity increase through executive and group coaching. His expertise spans construction, financial services, energy, healthcare, hospitality, technology, and beyond, with a proven track record designing and deploying enterprise-wide development systems and achieving consistently high client satisfaction ratings.  Rob holds a Bachelor of Arts in Integrated Marketing Communications and Psychology from Duquesne University and completed the ICF Level 2 Professional Coach Certification Program at Duquesne's Palumbo Donahue School of Business, where he later served as Auxiliary Faculty co-facilitating the capstone cohort for Pennsylvania's first ICF-accredited university-based coaching program. He holds the prestigious MCC credential from the International Coaching Federation, is an EMCC Global EIA at the Senior Practitioner level, and is Board-Certified as a Life, Executive, and Leadership Coach. Certified in MBTI and Hogan assessments, Rob also serves as an ICF Mentor Coach and has been recognized as ICF Global Coach of the Week. His work has been featured in HuffPost and on NBC, and he has presented at SXSW on applying design thinking to life and career design.  Currently in private practice and coaching across seven platforms including BetterUp, CoachHub, EZRA Coaching, LHH, and Sama, Rob specializes in life vision and enhancement, executive and leadership coaching, career coaching, and coaching around inclusion and spirituality. His approach integrates Lean methodology, design thinking, and deep empathy to help clients clarify priorities, navigate transitions, and create meaningful change. Whether partnering with emerging leaders or seasoned executives, Rob brings a practical, outcomes-oriented philosophy grounded in over two decades of operational excellence, people development, and a commitment to helping individuals design the lives and careers they truly want.
headline: Former Head of Lean at Fannie Mae, Capital One

name: Robert Stanton
special_services: Leader Management; Leadership; Leadership / Professional Development; Manager & New Manager; Performance Management; Relationship Management; Stress Management; Succession Planning
specialties: ["Leader Management","Leadership","Leadership / Professional Development","Manager & New Manager","Performance Management","Relationship Management","Stress Management","Succession Planning"]
bio: Robert Stanton is a seasoned supply chain and procurement executive with deep international experience leading global teams at Bayer and other major manufacturing organizations. Over the course of his career, Robert held senior leadership roles including VP Global Product Supply at Envu (formerly Bayer Environmental Science), where he led supply chain and procurement professionals across four regions spanning Singapore, São Paulo, Cary, and Lyon. Prior to that, he served as Head of Product Supply for Asia Pacific at Bayer, overseeing seed production, chemical formulation, and supply chain activities across the region, and as Vice President of Insecticides Procurement, leading global procurement for active ingredients and key raw materials. His operating experience also includes serving as Site Manager for Ascend Performance Materials, managing nylon polymer production and global compounding operations, and heading supply chain and industrial operations for Bayer CropScience in India. Robert has lived and worked in Singapore, the United States, India, Germany, and the United Kingdom, bringing a truly global perspective to complex supply challenges.  Robert holds an MBA in Business from Aston University, a Postgraduate Diploma in Procurement and Supply Chain from Robert Gordon University, and a BSc in Biochemistry from the University of Reading. He is an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) credentialed by Credly by Pearson. Through his consultancy and executive coaching practice, In The Pocket LLC, Robert partners with supply chain, manufacturing, and procurement leaders—particularly in small to medium-sized businesses—to develop their leadership capabilities and unlock sustainable supply opportunities. His coaching philosophy combines deep domain knowledge with a pragmatic, client-centered approach, ensuring that every engagement delivers tailored and actionable solutions.  Robert's mission is to enable others in manufacturing, supply chain, and procurement to grow as leaders and drive meaningful business impact. His passion for supply chain excellence, coupled with decades of hands-on leadership across diverse industries and geographies, makes him a credible and valuable partner for leaders navigating complexity, building high-performing teams, and leading transformation in their operations.
headline: Former VP Supply Chain at Bayer

name: Robin Weitz
bio: Robin Weitz is a full-time Accountability Coach at Calibrate, a modern medical health company transforming the way the world treats weight. Before joining Calibrate in 2021, Robin served as a Victim Service Specialist at Mothers Against Drunk Driving (MADD), where she provided trauma intervention to victims of intoxicated drivers and increased the number of victims served in Western Pennsylvania by 200%. Her background also includes founding Opening Doors Coaching, where she individually coached clients in employment, career, life, trauma, sales, leadership, and grief, and serving as a Victim Advocate on the Response Team at Pittsburgh Action Against Rape, providing comprehensive advocacy and crisis intervention to survivors of sexual assault.  Robin holds both the Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credential from the International Coaching Federation, earned in 2022, and the Associate Certified Coach (ACC) credential, earned in 2020. She is a passionate and dedicated coach committed to serving others, with experience across multiple coaching fields including trauma, career, sales, and life coaching. Robin's approach is grounded in empowering clients to move forward and thrive, guiding them as they discover their path to achieve their goals while building self-confidence through powerful questions and active support. Her extensive background in trauma intervention and victim advocacy uniquely positions her to create safe, compassionate spaces where clients can gain personal insight and take an active role in becoming who they want to be.
headline: Accountability Coach, Health & Wellness

bio: Rumeena Bhalla is a certified executive coach, physician, and professional filmmaker who brings a unique blend of medical expertise and creative innovation to her coaching practice. She trained as a doctor at the University of Bristol, earning her MBChB, and worked as a Senior House Officer in Emergency Medicine with the NHS from 2003 to 2007. Since founding Sequin Life in 2016, Rumeena has built a diverse coaching portfolio that includes serving as a BetterUp Fellow Coach, Leadership Coach at Torch, and Leadership Coach for the Seattle Children's Hospital Physician Leadership Programme. She is also the Founder of Rumeena Bhalla Coaching for Doctors and Co-Founder of Coaching Doctors, where she inspires physicians to find their voice, passion, and purpose through workshops, retreats, and one-on-one coaching. Her earlier career includes serving as CEO of the South Asian Health Foundation and Founding Director of Explain Medical, where she created award-winning Bollywood-style health education films used internationally to raise awareness of heart disease and diabetes.  Rumeena holds a Bachelor's degree in Anatomical Science and a Master's degree with Distinction in Film and Television Production, both from the University of Bristol. She is credentialed as a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) by the International Coaching Federation, having previously earned her Associate Certified Coach (ACC) designation. Her coaching philosophy is deeply informed by her personal experience of leaving clinical medicine after feeling an overwhelming loss of autonomy—an experience that fuels her belief that thoughtful coaching can help professionals make more intentional decisions about their careers and lives. She works with physician leaders, CEOs, and professionals at all career stages to help them build meaningful, balanced, and creative lives.  With over fifteen years of experience in coaching, behavior change, and health education, Rumeena brings a practical, empathetic approach to leadership development. Her work focuses on helping clients discover their values and strengths, tackle burnout, increase resilience, and create leadership manifestos that reflect their authentic purpose. Drawing on her background in emergency medicine, public health, and the creative arts, Rumeena offers a distinctive perspective that blends clinical insight, storytelling, and evidence-based coaching to support leaders navigating career transitions, building high-trust teams, and leading with intention.
headline: Physician & Executive Coach

name: Samantha Strom
special_services: Burnout; Change Management; Conflict Resolution; DE&I / Belonging; Educators; Executive Coaching; Nonprofit Professionals; Parenting; Performance Management; Storytelling; Succession Planning; Wellness
bio: Samantha Strom brings a decade of coaching experience helping clients navigate career transitions, work-life balance, people management, and conflict resolution across a wide range of industries and organizations. Over the course of her career, she has coached hundreds of clients at companies including Facebook, PwC, L'Oréal, Kaiser Permanente, and Novant Health, as well as students and professionals transitioning into tech roles at General Assembly and Flatiron School. Through her own consulting practice, Pascal Strom Consulting L.L.C. and Quarterlife Crisis, Samantha provided tailored coaching, facilitation, and consulting services, partnering with organizations such as the University of Colorado, Frontier Airlines, and Gettysburg College on leadership development, performance management, and innovation initiatives. She has also served as a Career Advisor and Adjunct Professor at Johnson & Wales University, where she taught organizational behavior and career management to over 500 students and co-founded an annual emerging leaders series. Her coaching has consistently earned high marks, including an average 4.7 out of 5 NPS score and maintaining above a 9.5 Net Promoter Score in her career coaching roles.  Samantha holds a Master of Science in Organization Development from American University and a Bachelor of Arts in Environmental Policy from Middlebury College, where she graduated Summa Cum Laude and was inducted into Phi Beta Kappa. She is currently pursuing a Master's degree in Clinical Mental Health Counseling at William & Mary, deepening her expertise in the emotional and psychological dimensions of personal and professional growth. She has completed The Leadership Circle Profile certification and a Maternal Mental Health Certificate Training for Mental Health and Clinical Professionals through Postpartum Support International. Currently serving as a Clinical Graduate Student Intern at Waypoint Counseling & Maternal Wellness, Samantha supports clients through every stage of their pregnancy journey, drawing from Feminist therapy, Internal Family Systems, attachment theory, and neuroscience.  Samantha's coaching philosophy is grounded in deep emotional work, practical outcomes, and a commitment to helping clients build joyful, balanced lives. Whether guiding young professionals through career pivots, supporting senior leaders in navigating conflict and team dynamics, or partnering with individuals on life transitions, she brings an eclectic, client-centered approach tailored to each person's unique needs. Her cross-functional expertise—spanning coaching, facilitation, consulting, and teaching—combined with her dedication to formalizing her skillset through advanced clinical training, makes her a credible and compassionate partner for clients seeking meaningful change and sustainable growth.
headline: Former Coach at Facebook, PwC

name: Sana Ali
special_services: Anxiety / Depression; Body Image; Change Management; Confidence; Leadership / Professional Development; Mindfulness and Meditation; Relationships; Thriving in daily life
bio: Sana Ali is a Transition Strategist and Executive Performance Coach with eight years of combined experience in consulting and performance coaching, helping executives and leadership teams navigate high-stakes transitions during periods of rapid growth, mergers and acquisitions, market disruption, and organizational restructuring. Over the past decade, she has partnered with leaders across technology, finance, healthcare, marketing, venture capital, and private equity—including executives at Microsoft, Google, and Qualcomm—as well as entrepreneurs and fast-growth companies. Before launching Peaknetic in 2022, Sana built a diverse career spanning business development, retail buying and sourcing for brands such as QVC and Carter's, and editorial roles at Hearst Magazines, including House Beautiful, O, The Oprah Magazine, and ELLE Decor. She currently serves as Director of Business Development at Creative Coach Solutions and as a Business Development Consultant at Kaizen Creative, bringing a strategic, business-minded lens to her coaching practice.  Sana holds an MBA from the J. Mack Robinson School of Business at Georgia State University and a BA from Rutgers University. She is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) through the International Coach Federation, a Certified Professional Coach (CPC) with transition coaching training from iPEC Coaching, and a Master Practitioner of Neuro-Linguistic Programming (NLP) certified by the iNLP Center. She is also DiSC Certified and an Energy Leadership Index Master Practitioner (ELI-MP). Her coaching philosophy is rooted in the belief that organizations don't fail because of strategy—they fail because leaders and teams can't adapt fast enough. She bridges the gap between leadership development and business strategy, equipping leaders with the clarity, confidence, and tools to thrive in transition.  Sana's work is designed for organizations in motion—companies scaling rapidly, adapting to disruption, or facing structural change. Through dynamic one-on-one coaching, interactive webinars, and tailored facilitation sessions, she helps leaders align teams, stabilize performance during disruption, integrate cultures post-merger, sustain accountability during rapid growth, and lead with agility and resilience through technology-driven change. Her approach goes beyond personal growth, grounded in the realities of growth, market pressure, and organizational change, and focused on how performance, retention, and culture directly tie to results.
headline: Coached Executives at Microsoft, Google, Qualcomm

name: Sanaz Kalantari
special_services: Change Management; Communication; Confidence; Conflict Resolution; Emerging Leader; Executive Coaching; Leader Management; Leadership; Leadership / Professional Development; Manager & New Manager; New Work Environment; Performance Management; Stress Management; Success Capacity; Succession Planning; Thriving in daily life; Work / Life Balance
specialties: ["Change Management","Communication","Confidence","Conflict Resolution","Emerging Leader","Executive Coaching","Leader Management","Leadership","Leadership / Professional Development","Manager & New Manager"]
bio: Sanaz Kalantari brings over 25 years of experience in the technology sector, having held leadership roles at some of the world's most influential organizations, including Microsoft, LinkedIn, Salesforce, Citrix, Avaya, Cisco, and Nortel Networks. At Microsoft, she served as Global Lead for Coaching Services within the Modern Customer and Partner Solutions (MCAPS) division, where she helped design and scale a global career coaching program that reached more than 60,000 employees across 50 countries and earned a Guinness World Record for the largest business coaching session. She also led skilling and learning initiatives that empowered customers navigating cloud transformation, and served as Field Enablement Lead, building modern learning cultures to develop high-performing sales, marketing, and services professionals. Earlier in her career, Sanaz held senior customer success and account management roles at LinkedIn and Citrix, where she partnered with enterprise clients at the executive level to drive adoption, retention, and strategic growth, earning recognition as Citrix President's Club Circle of Excellence and Key Accounts Annual MVP in 2012.  Sanaz holds a Bachelor of Engineering in Telecommunications from the University of Technology Sydney and has pursued extensive coaching education, including a Professional Coach Program from iPEC Coaching, a Certificate in Professional Coaching from International Coach Academy, and certifications in Neurolinguistic Programming, Blueprint Coaching and Leadership from the Debbie Ford Institute, and Training and Assessment. She is an ICF-accredited coach and holds certifications as a Certified Life Coach and COR.E Transitions Dynamics Specialist, as well as a Microsoft MCAPS Professional Coach credential. Currently serving as Director of Marketing and Communications for ICF Australasia, Sanaz is deeply committed to upholding professional coaching standards and expanding the visibility of credentialed coaching across the region. As Founder of Mastering Mindset, she partners with professionals and leaders to break through limiting patterns, create clarity, build confidence, and navigate career and life transitions with intention.  Sanaz's coaching philosophy centers on empowering clients to step into their full potential through conscious choice and intentional self-leadership. Drawing on her deep expertise in learning and development, enablement strategy, and human-centered design, she helps clients unlock new possibilities, lead with impact, and design careers and lives aligned with their values. Her work spans executive coaching, career coaching, leadership development, and transition facilitation, blending practical business insight with transformational coaching tools like the Energy Leadership Index assessment and COR.E Dynamics frameworks. With a proven track record of shaping enterprise-scale programs and a passion for human potential, Sanaz offers clients a unique combination of strategic acumen, global perspective, and genuine commitment to their growth and success.
headline: Former Coaching Leader at Microsoft, LinkedIn, Salesforce

name: Sandi Boyd

bio: Sandi Boyd is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) with the International Coach Federation and the Founder and CEO of Revivify Coaching, where she partners with individuals seeking personal and professional transformation. With a career spanning healthcare leadership, organizational development, and coaching, Sandi brings deep expertise in developing leaders at all levels. She spent three decades at Carilion Clinic, where she served as a Leadership Coach and Education Consultant, supporting physicians and nurse leaders in mastering critical leadership skills including emotional intelligence, communication, conflict competency, and servant leadership. Sandi also held the role of Director of Education and Organizational Development at HCA Lewis Gale Medical Center, where she led strategic learning initiatives. Currently, she serves as a Personal and Professional Development Coach with Boon Health, a platform dedicated to enhancing employee resilience, productivity, and engagement through personalized coaching.  Sandi holds a Master of Science in Nursing with a focus on Pediatric Nursing from the University of Virginia and a Bachelor of Science in Nursing from Radford University. Her coaching credentials include a Leadership Coaching Certificate from Georgetown University and Results Coaching and Peak Performance training from the Robbins Research International Coaching Academy, where she also worked as a Results Coach. As an ICF-PCC credentialed coach since 2009, Sandi has dedicated her practice to helping clients increase their leadership capacity, navigate change, and achieve meaningful growth. Her coaching philosophy sits at the intersection of mental wellbeing and professional development, emphasizing resilience, clarity, and sustainable results.  Sandi's unique blend of clinical expertise, organizational leadership, and certified coaching makes her a trusted partner for professionals seeking to elevate their impact. Whether working with emerging leaders or seasoned executives, she creates tailored action plans that translate insight into measurable progress. Her commitment to growth extends beyond her professional work—she authored "From A Mother's Heart: Strategies to Survive the Heartbreaking Loss of a Child," offering compassionate guidance to parents navigating profound grief. Sandi's empathy, strategic insight, and results-oriented approach empower clients to thrive both personally and professionally.

bio: Sara Kagarise is an HR program manager and certified executive coach with over a decade of experience in organizational development, leadership coaching, and strategic talent management. Currently serving as HR Program Manager for Continuous Improvement at the University of Virginia, Sara has built her career at leading healthcare and educational institutions, including extensive tenure at Carilion Clinic, where she progressed from Education Specialist to Senior HR Leadership Coach & Consultant. In her coaching and consulting roles, she has partnered with senior and executive leaders to navigate complex organizational challenges, improve leadership effectiveness, and drive measurable results. As founder of Strategic Talent Results, her boutique consulting firm, Sara has helped small business leaders reduce turnover, develop internal talent, and plan strategically for workforce needs. She also serves as a Personal and Professional Growth Coach with Boon Health, where she supports employees at the intersection of mental well-being and professional development.  Sara holds a Master of Arts in Industrial and Organizational Psychology from Adler University and a Bachelor of Science in Health Care Administration from Old Dominion University. She is credentialed as a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) through the International Coaching Federation and holds certifications as a Project Management Professional (PMP) and Prosci Certified Change Practitioner (CRP). Her approach to coaching is grounded in active inquiry, collaboration, and a commitment to achieving results proven by positive return on investment. Sara specializes in helping leaders find continued success and joy in their careers by clarifying priorities, strengthening team dynamics, and translating insight into action.  With a passion for elevating human capital as an organization's most valued asset, Sara brings a unique blend of healthcare operations expertise, data-driven program management, and evidence-based coaching to every engagement. Her cross-functional project leadership, emphasis on measurement and analytics, and dedication to tailored solutions make her a trusted partner for leaders seeking to grow their impact, navigate transitions, and build high-performing teams.

bio: Sara Noble is a Certified Professional Coach who brings a rich foundation in human resources and talent development to her coaching practice. With nearly a decade as a Human Resources Generalist at Abell Pest Control, where she led recruitment, performance management, coaching and mentoring, and learning and development initiatives across Canada and the U.S., Sara developed a deep understanding of what drives individual and organizational success. Her earlier experience as a Recruitment Specialist at Access Career Solutions further honed her ability to identify strengths, align goals with opportunities, and guide professionals through pivotal transitions. Today, Sara serves as a Personal & Professional Growth Coach at Boon Health, a Career Coach at GrowthSpace, a Positive Intelligence (PQ) Coach, and the founder of The Noble Coach, where she partners with individuals navigating career development, resilience-building, and personal growth.  Sara holds a bachelor's degree in Psychology and Human Resources Management from the University of Waterloo and a Post-Graduate Certificate in Human Resources Management from Sheridan College. She is a graduate of the Co-Active Training Institute's professional certification program and holds the Certified Professional Co-Active Coach (CPCC) and Associate Certified Coach (ACC) credentials. Her coaching philosophy is deeply collaborative, grounded in building strong relationships and creating environments that foster trust and positive results. Sara is passionate about helping clients develop resilience, increase productivity, and achieve meaningful personal and professional goals through exceptional communication, active listening, and problem-solving.  With a proven track record of quickly establishing rapport and guiding individuals through challenges and opportunities, Sara brings both warmth and practical insight to her coaching engagements. Her expertise spans career transitions, mental fitness, and leadership development, making her a credible and valuable partner for professionals seeking to clarify their direction, overcome obstacles, and unlock their full potential.

name: Sarina Tomel
special_services: Crisis Response; HR Professionals; Yoga
bio: Sarina Tomel is a leadership and mindset coach with over 20 years of corporate HR and talent management experience, including two decades as an HR Business Partner at Novartis, a global pharmaceutical leader. At Novartis, she supported hundreds of employees across TechOps, Quality, and facility-wide functions, specializing in employee relations, performance management, leadership development, coaching, change management, and talent retention. Her corporate expertise spans designing and delivering training programs, implementing strategic HR initiatives, and managing the full spectrum of people and culture functions—from succession planning and engagement to restructuring and recruitment.  Sarina holds a Master's degree in Industrial Organizational Psychology from Hofstra University and a Bachelor's degree in Psychology from Long Island University. She is an ICF Accredited Trained Coach, having completed her coaching education through Coach U, Inc. in 2006. She has also deepened her expertise through the Spirit Junkie Masterclass with Gabby Bernstein, focusing on mindfulness, meditation, and empowerment, and is a graduate of the WomanSpeak Program, a women's thought leader speaker agency. Her coaching philosophy centers on teaching clients to "Step up, Speak up, and Stand up" for their careers, relationships, and well-being, integrating mindfulness practices to elevate engagement, accountability, communication, and boundary-setting.  Since founding Sarina Tomel Coaching & Consulting in 2006, she has offered one-on-one and group coaching, strategy sessions, training programs, workshops, and keynote speaking to high school and college students, corporate professionals, management, site leaders, and entrepreneurs. She has successfully facilitated mindfulness and engagement activities for audiences as large as 400 associates and has led meditation workshops for senior site leaders with minimal prior exposure. Drawing on her deep HR background and passion for intentional living, Sarina partners with clients to navigate career transitions, leadership challenges, imposter syndrome, stress, and change—helping them clarify priorities, expand their leadership presence, and achieve meaningful, sustainable growth.
headline: 20+ Years HR at Novartis

bio: Selika Cerofolini is a holistic coach and founder of Children Of the Love Revolution, where she guides individuals through personal evolution and transformation. A Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credentialed by the International Coach Federation, Selika brings a unique blend of executive coaching, mental health coaching, and life coaching to her practice. She currently serves as an Executive Coach with Bravely, a Mental Health Coach with Lyra Health, and a Personal and Professional Growth Coach with Boon, while also holding a position as Teaching Faculty at the Group Coaching Institute. Her coaching career includes significant work as an Associate Coach with Share Global Coaching for a Better World and Welead Coaching, where she has co-facilitated large group coaching sessions for over fifty participants in corporate settings, conducted 360° interviews, and co-designed workshops on diversity and inclusion, learning and development, and conflict resolution. Before transitioning to coaching, Selika held managerial roles in communications and development for prominent art institutions in New York, including serving as Director of Communications at Magazzino Italian Art and Head of Development & Communications at La Fondazione NY, where she managed high-profile cultural events and fostered relationships with major museums and cultural organizations.  Selika holds a Master of Arts in International Politics and Diplomatic Studies and a Bachelor of Arts with Honors in International Communication from Italian universities. Her coaching credentials include a Professional Certification from Leadership that Works - Coaching for Transformation, an Advanced Certification from the Group Coaching Institute, and a Somatic Attachment Therapy Certificate from The Embody Lab. In her practice, Selika works with people navigating change and personal evolution, helping them accept and move through transitions with deeper awareness, compassion, and broader vision. Her approach integrates mindfulness, meditation, and dharma teachings, reflecting her commitment to helping clients manifest the fullness of their purpose in their life choices for the benefit of themselves and others.  Grounded in both psychological insight and spiritual practice, Selika facilitates a shift from fear to love as the foundation of meaningful action. She helps clients develop self-knowledge, overcome blockages, navigate daily challenges, and create meaning from disruptive circumstances. Her holistic guidance empowers individuals to gain awareness of their unique talents and resourcefulness, set valued goals, and orient themselves toward their true north in an increasingly complex and uncertain world. With her cross-cultural perspective, somatic and attachment-informed methods, and experience spanning individual, group, and organizational coaching, Selika offers clients a compassionate and transformative partnership for personal and professional growth.

bio: Sharon Wilson is the Founder of Best Self Coaching & Development, bringing a unique blend of premier business school experience and deep coaching expertise to her work with individuals, teams, and organizations. She spent over 18 years at London Business School, progressing from Assistant to renowned professors including Sumantra Ghoshal to Manager in the Department of Strategy & Entrepreneurship, where she worked closely with MBA and Executive MBA participants. This immersive environment alongside world-class educators and global business leaders gave Sharon invaluable insight into what drives individual and organizational success—expertise she now channels into her coaching practice.  Sharon holds an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) credential from the International Coaching Federation and an OCN Life Coach Accreditation from the UK College of Life Coaching. Her coaching philosophy centers on helping people unlock their full potential by building confidence, emotional intelligence, and resilience. She works across a broad spectrum, from students and graduates navigating academic achievement and early career transitions to managers and leaders developing their presence and adaptability. Whether delivering tailored one-on-one coaching or team workshops, Sharon focuses on creating happy, productive, and high-performing environments where people feel empowered to do their best work.  Sharon's credibility as a coach is grounded in her years of supporting ambitious professionals at a top-tier business school and her commitment to practical, outcomes-oriented development. She specializes in confidence coaching, emotional intelligence development, leadership presence, and workplace culture transformation. Her volunteer work includes coaching and mentoring on employment readiness and confidence building. For individuals seeking to strengthen their leadership range, teams aiming to improve collaboration, or organizations committed to thriving cultures, Sharon brings both warmth and proven expertise to every engagement.

name: Shee Shee Van Inwegen
special_services: Christians; DE&I / Belonging; Executive Coaching; Leader Management; Leadership; Leadership / Professional Development
bio: Shee Shee Van Inwegen is the founder of The Bridge Group, where she brings decades of experience in leadership and team development to help organizations build connections, bridge gaps, and enhance alignment, impact, and resilience. Since 1998, she has been dedicated to developing leaders at every level—from newly hired professionals to C-Suite executives—across diverse industries including healthcare, IT, private equity, entertainment, tech, and supply chain. As an Executive Coach with Boon Health, she inspires and empowers leaders across the globe to live on purpose and lead with compassion. She also serves as Director of Special Programs at Coaching For Everyone, a nonprofit committed to bringing coaching and coach training to BIPOC communities, and as a Technology Producer at Co-Active Training Institute.  Shee Shee holds a Bachelor of Arts in American Government and Politics, English, and Art from Converse University and completed a Team Coaching Program and Certification at Brown University School of Professional Studies. She is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credentialed by the International Coaching Federation and an ICF Certified Executive Coach through Quantum Endeavors, Inc. Her coaching philosophy centers on fearless candor, creative communication, and tackling conflict head-on to cultivate workplaces where everyone feels empowered to take strategic action. Drawing on a multicultural upbringing across four countries and a multi-generational home, she brings unique insight into cross-cultural communication and the value of straight talk.  Shee Shee's approach illuminates blind spots, sparks courageous conversations, and weaves unity across organizations—especially in the realm of hybrid and geographically scattered teams. She partners with clients to elevate emotional intelligence, improve team dynamics, and inspire inclusion, creating collaborative and more enjoyable work environments. Her dedication to transparency, values-driven transformation, and preparing leaders to navigate challenging times together makes her a credible and impactful guide for executives and teams seeking meaningful, lasting change.
headline: Decades of Leadership Development

name: Shelly-Ann Frederic
bio: Shelly-Ann Frederic is a Change and Transformation Lead at Effective Coaching Inc., bringing over 15 years of strategic communications and stakeholder engagement experience across North America and the United Kingdom. She built her career at TC Energy, a Fortune 500 company, where she progressed from Stakeholder Relations Advisor to Senior Public Affairs Advisor and ultimately Communications Team Lead. During her tenure at TC Energy, Shelly-Ann led stakeholder engagement and reputation management for the Keystone XL Pipeline, a major cross-border infrastructure project spanning Montana and South Dakota, focusing on rebuilding trust with communities and mitigating complex political and environmental risks. She also led a team of digital professionals to develop innovative communication platforms that strengthened the company's internal and external narrative following its rebrand. Earlier in her career, Shelly-Ann honed her expertise in change management at Sanjel Energy Services, where she supported internal communications and change initiatives using ADKAR principles, and at AdFarm, where she managed public relations for the agency's largest client and increased portfolio value by 20 percent through strategic campaign delivery.  Shelly-Ann holds a Bachelor of Applied Communications Degree in Public Relations from Mount Royal University and a Conflict Resolution Extension Certificate from the same institution. She is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credentialed by the International Coaching Federation and is certified in the Leadership Circle Profile. Drawing on life experiences spanning South Africa, Canada, and the United Kingdom, Shelly-Ann brings a people-first, globally informed lens to her coaching practice. She partners with leaders and organizations across the electric utilities, energy, government, and agricultural sectors to turn complex change into clear, engaging employee journeys. Her coaching philosophy centers on building authentic relationships, fostering trust, reducing resistance, and driving adoption to ensure transformation is both meaningful and sustainable. With deep expertise in navigating large-scale transformation programs and a commitment to creating clarity, engagement, and impact, Shelly-Ann empowers courageous leaders and teams to lead change with confidence and resilience.
headline: 15+ Years in Strategic Communications

bio: Sherri Hillie is a seasoned HR transformation leader with twenty years of experience guiding complex organizational change across Fortune 500 companies and global enterprises. Currently serving as Senior Director of Change Management at Sodexo, she has led digital transformation initiatives spanning 45 countries and successfully guided over 100,000 employees through major HR system implementations. Her career includes senior roles at Lockheed Martin, where she served as Operational Excellence Lead and Talent Management Partner, and at Northrop Grumman (Orbital ATK), where she led enterprise-wide talent management strategy as Senior Talent Management Consultant. Earlier in her career, Sherri held HR and organizational development positions at the University System of Maryland and Kearney & Company, building a foundation in performance management, leadership development, and systems design that has informed her approach to transformation work.  Sherri holds a Master of Science in Organizational Development from The Johns Hopkins University Carey Business School and earned an Executive Certificate in Leadership Coaching from Georgetown University School of Continuing Studies. She is an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) with the International Coaching Federation and holds certifications in EQi 2.0/EQ 360 and 360 feedback coaching. As Principal Consultant at Change Insight LLC, her coaching practice focuses on helping analytical professionals—systems thinkers, project managers, and individual contributors—navigate the journey from technical excellence to authentic leadership. Her philosophy centers on honoring natural strengths rather than forcing conformity, designing change processes that work with how thoughtful professionals actually process complexity, and helping clients develop the clarity and strategic presence needed to create impact without compromising authenticity.  What makes Sherri uniquely credible as a coach is her lived experience as a high-performing analytical professional who navigated the same challenges her clients face. She understands firsthand why brilliant individual contributors struggle to gain recognition, how organizational systems actually work, and what it takes to lead authentically in environments that often reward quick responses over thoughtful reflection. Her dual expertise in large-scale HR transformation and individual leadership development allows her to bridge the gap between organizational dynamics and personal growth, helping clients translate their expertise into influence while staying true to their values. Currently serving as Chairperson of the Board at Future Link, a nonprofit supporting first-generation college students, Sherri brings both corporate rigor and mission-driven purpose to her work with leaders navigating change.
headline: Former HR Transformation at Lockheed, Sodexo

name: Shruti Rustagi
bio: Shruti Rustagi brings two decades of corporate experience across three regions—South East Asia, Middle East North Africa, and North America—with Fortune 100 companies including Amazon, KPMG, and IBM. At Amazon, she has held senior finance and strategy roles spanning multiple high-impact initiatives: she developed and executed the investment framework for $9 billion in marketing spend, turned around the Canada Consumables business to profitability as CFO of a $4 billion operation, established the finance function for Amazon's MENA marketplace business from the ground up, and currently architects deal strategy for Amazon Business while serving on the EPIC Leadership Team. Earlier in her career, Shruti held General Manager roles at the Aditya Birla Group, where she designed and launched India's first startup scaling platform by an Indian conglomerate and spearheaded growth strategy for Novelis, the world's largest aluminum rolled products company. Her consulting foundation at KPMG and IBM equipped her with deep expertise in business transformation, performance improvement, and strategic advisory across energy, infrastructure, and financial services. She has been recognized with the Chairman's Individual Award for Distinguished Achiever at Aditya Birla Group, an honor given to only 0.06% of employees.  Shruti holds an MBA in Finance and Marketing from the Indian Institute of Management, Lucknow, and a B.Tech in Computer Science from Indira Gandhi Delhi Technical University for Women. She completed Co-active Coach Training and Certification at The Coaches Training Institute and earned her Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credential from the International Coaching Federation. Her coaching philosophy centers on creating structure in chaos—whether in ambiguous business environments or overwhelmed minds and lives—and helping leaders maximize their life and leadership through mindset shifts. As founder of Compounding Leadership Inc. and a Lead Coach with BetterUp, Shruti has coached over 500 corporate leaders to design lives they love, focusing on work-life harmony, resilience, and healthy high performance.  Shruti's credibility as a coach is grounded in her proven ability to drive exceptional results in ambiguous, high-stakes environments and her commitment to developing leaders at scale. She serves as an emotional intelligence speaker and facilitator for Amazon internal teams and AWS customers, and has championed diversity and inclusion initiatives including launching the Women In Finance chapter for Amazon MENA and founding the first Working Moms Circle in the Seattle area. A world traveler who has visited 29 countries, Shruti brings a global perspective, cross-functional expertise spanning finance, strategy, and operations, and a practical, outcomes-oriented approach that empowers millennial and Gen X leaders to elevate their impact and thrive.
headline: Former Finance Leader at Amazon, KPMG, IBM
