bio: Sidrah Mohyuddin is the President and Founder of Renewed Realm, LLC, a coaching practice specializing in life, leadership, health, and wellness coaching. She is also Co-Founder of Novellus Coaching Academy, where she helps professionals master the art and science of coaching with precision and evidence-based expertise. Sidrah's career began as a dentist with a Bachelor's degree in Dental Surgery from Khyber College of Dentistry before she transitioned into coaching. She currently serves as a Leadership Coach for the Dietrich School of Arts and Sciences at the University of Pittsburgh, as Teaching Faculty at Benedictine Coaching of Pittsburgh, and as a Personal and Professional Growth Coach with Boon Health, a platform focused on mental wellbeing and professional development. Since 2020, she has also coached students in the University of Pittsburgh Biomedical Masters Program, providing a safe and trusting space as they navigate academic and personal challenges. Fluent in English, Urdu, and Hindi, Sidrah brings a global, multicultural perspective to her work across the United States and South Asia.  Sidrah holds a Professional Coaching Certification from Duquesne University and a Master Health Coach Certification from Dr. Sears Wellness Institute. She is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) through the International Coaching Federation and a National Board Certified Health and Wellness Coach (NBC-HWC). Her credentials also include Wellness Mapping 360 certification from Real Balance Global Wellness Services and Mental Health Literacy certification from the Institute of Coaching. She serves as Director of Events for the International Coaching Federation's Pittsburgh chapter, where she leads program development and event management. Her coaching philosophy centers on empowering growth through leadership, wellness, and career coaching across cultures, using a client-centered approach grounded in motivational techniques and sustainable behavior change.  With expertise spanning leadership coaching, health and wellness, and behavioral transformation, Sidrah partners with clients to uncover their strengths, pursue their vision, and create lasting fulfillment and joy. Her personalized, outcomes-oriented approach helps individuals—from high school students to professionals and executives—develop the skills, behaviors, and habits that contribute to success in work and life. Enriched by extensive travel, community outreach, and a commitment to meaningful connection, Sidrah is a credible and compassionate guide for clients seeking profound personal, spiritual, and professional growth.

bio: Smitha Shetty is a seasoned human resources leader with extensive experience spanning labor and employment law, employee relations, and HR business partnership. She has held progressive roles at Avery Dennison, a Fortune 500 materials science and manufacturing company, where she served as Human Resources Business Partner and Associate Manager Human Resources, aligning HR strategies with business objectives across commercial and enabling functions. Currently, Smitha serves as Senior Human Resources Manager at Laguna Clothing Pvt Ltd, where she previously advanced through multiple roles over nearly a decade, from Welfare and HR Executive to Manager of IR and HR. Her career also includes early experience at Bombay Rayon Fashions Limited and Karle Group, building a strong foundation in welfare, compliance, and employee relations.  Smitha holds a Master of Social Work in Human Resources Management and Personnel Administration from Alva's College of Education, and she is certified as a Lean Six Sigma Green Belt and Lead Auditor ISO 9001. These credentials underscore her commitment to driving process improvements and maintaining high-quality standards in HR operations. Throughout her tenure, Smitha has cultivated deep expertise in navigating complex employee relations issues, fostering cultures of continuous improvement, and collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams. Her practical, results-oriented approach and dedication to aligning people strategies with organizational growth make her a credible and valuable partner for leaders seeking to strengthen their teams and enhance employee satisfaction.
headline: HR Leader, Labor & Employment Law

bio: Sonja Froehlich brings a unique blend of clinical expertise and coaching practice to her work supporting individuals in personal and professional growth. A registered nurse with experience at Stanford Health Care and other leading medical institutions, Sonja spent years in high-acuity environments including ambulatory surgery, pre-operative admissions, PACU, and surgical ICU settings. Her clinical background, which began in Germany and continued across the United States, provided her with deep insight into human resilience, compassionate communication, and the importance of holistic well-being under pressure.  Today, Sonja serves as a Care Coach at BetterUp and a Personal & Professional Growth Coach at Boon, where she integrates mindfulness, emotional intelligence, and conversational awareness into her coaching approach. She holds an ACC credential and is a National Board Certified Health and Wellness Coach (NBC-HWC). Her training includes Mindfulness-Based Emotional Balance Teacher Training from the UCSD Center for Mindfulness, Holistic Coaching from Wisdom of the Whole, and Conversational Intelligence coursework with Judith Glaser. Fluent in both English and German, Sonja draws on her rich clinical foundation and evidence-based coaching methodologies to help clients cultivate self-awareness, navigate transitions, and sustain meaningful growth in their lives and careers.

bio: Sophie van het Erve brings a unique blend of corporate leadership experience and deep coaching expertise to her work empowering professionals to lead authentically and create meaningful change. She spent nearly eight years at Google, progressing from Senior Account Manager to Principal Account Manager in Large Customer Sales, where she managed trusted relationships with major clients and developed strategic partnerships that added measurable value to advertisers' businesses. Before Google, Sophie honed her business acumen at Oracle, working cross-industry as a Business Development Consultant to identify opportunities where technology solutions could reduce costs and improve performance. Her corporate foundation also includes roles at Robert Bosch and ChemPoint, giving her a well-rounded perspective on business challenges across sectors.  Sophie holds a Master's degree in International Business from Maastricht University and studied at Stellenbosch University, bringing a global mindset to her coaching practice. She is a Certified Professional Coach through iPEC Coaching, a COR.E Dynamics Leadership Dynamics Specialist, and holds a Certificate in Happiness Studies from the Happiness Studies Academy. As Co-Founder and Coach at The 1 Reset since 2021 and currently a Personal and Professional Growth Coach at Boon, Sophie focuses on self-leadership, mindset, and coaching culture. Her programs are designed to help visionary leaders enhance focus, passion, and alignment with purpose, creating thriving environments where joy and fulfillment flourish.  Sophie's coaching philosophy centers on transforming the way leaders approach work, life, and everything in between. A member of the International Coaching Federation and a Core Energy Leadership Master Practitioner, she combines practical business insight with evidence-based coaching methodologies to support professionals determined to ignite real change in their teams, organizations, and personal lives. Her volunteer work as a Crisis Counselor at Crisis Text Line further reflects her commitment to helping people navigate challenging moments with clarity and calm. With fluency in Dutch and English and a track record spanning Fortune 500 companies and entrepreneurial ventures, Sophie offers clients a grounded, results-oriented approach to joyful and impactful leadership.
headline: 8 Years at Google, Principal Account Manager

bio: Srideep Sarkar brings over two and a half decades of global and cross-industry experience spanning senior HR leadership, organizational development, and executive coaching. He served as Vice President and Global Head of Leadership, Talent and Performance Management at Glenmark Pharmaceuticals, where he developed and deployed talent systems across sales and R&D teams globally, designed a global leadership competency framework, and led culture change interventions for thousands of employees. His work earned multiple Chairman's and Director's awards for the business impact of his leadership development initiatives. Srideep has also held strategic HR roles at Cadbury India, Saint Gobain, and Global Trust Bank, and currently serves as Director of Learning & Development and Early Career Programme at Oxford Biomedica, where he designs and deploys business-aligned people development strategies.  Srideep holds an MBA in Human Resources from Symbiosis Institute of Business Management in Pune, India, a Diploma in Training & Development from the Indian Society for Training and Development, and completed an Organisation Development Certification Programme at the Institute of Organisation Development in Miami. He is an ICF-PCC credentialed coach and trained with Maximum Performance Coaching in the UK. As co-founder of 21cGradient, a performance enhancement firm, and an Associate Coach with Mindbeat, Know You More, and Coaching on Call International, as well as a Premier Fellow Coach with BetterUp, Srideep partners with leaders at all levels to enhance performance, navigate uncertainties, and find purpose and fulfillment at work. His coaching philosophy blends a deep understanding of commercial realities with insights around human behavior, grounded in a passion to make a meaningful difference to individuals, teams, and organizations. With proven expertise in leadership, performance, and transformation journeys across diverse global and regional contexts, Srideep helps clients build leadership capability, strengthen teams, and translate insight into measurable impact.
headline: VP-Level HR Leader

name: Stacey Guith
bio: Stacey Guith is an ICF-certified executive and mentor coach with more than 20 years of experience in HR leadership, talent acquisition strategy, and coaching. Her corporate career includes senior roles at marquee organizations such as The Coca-Cola Company, where she served as Senior Talent Acquisition Leader driving HR transformation and talent integration during a major acquisition, and Georgia-Pacific LLC, where she held the position of Global Head of Talent Acquisition, leading CEO-backed initiatives and overseeing talent strategy for a 50,000-employee organization spanning consumer products, packaging, and building materials. Stacey also served as Executive Coach and Director of Recruitment Programs at IHG Hotels & Resorts, providing executive coaching to marketing leadership and guiding change management efforts during a global reorganization. Her deep expertise in executive search, organizational transformation, and leadership development is grounded in hands-on experience navigating complex, high-stakes business environments.  Stacey holds a Bachelor of Science degree from Cornell University and an Advanced Executive Coaching Certification from Emory University's Goizueta Business School, where she trained in brain-based coaching techniques. She is an ICF-certified coach with credentials as an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) and has completed ICF-accredited Professional Coach Certification Training through Coach Academy International, as well as the Positive Intelligence Coaching Program. Currently, Stacey coaches clients across leadership development, career transitions, and wellness through The Complete Coach, BetterUp, and Boon Health, serving everyone from individual contributors and new managers to CEOs at organizations including Google and The Walt Disney Company. As an ICF-certified mentor coach, she also guides aspiring coaches and those pursuing recertification.  Stacey's coaching philosophy centers on empowering clients and teams to reach their full potential through customized, outcomes-oriented support. Drawing on her proven track record as a business leader and her expertise in change management, career success, and leadership effectiveness, she helps clients navigate work and life challenges with clarity and confidence. Her blend of corporate insight, advanced coaching training, and commitment to excellence makes her a trusted partner for leaders seeking to expand their impact and achieve meaningful, sustainable growth.
headline: Former Talent Leader at Coca-Cola, Georgia-Pacific

bio: Stacey Tarkington is a purpose-driven executive with more than 20 years of corporate leadership experience spanning marketing, brand development, and strategic program management across diverse industries including interior design, technology, consumer-packaged goods, and non-profit sectors. She has held senior roles including Vice President of Global Marketing at Versa Designed Surfaces and Executive Creative Director and Senior Program Manager at Momentum Textiles & Wallcovering, where she championed digital transformation initiatives, led post-acquisition brand strategies, and managed a $6 million budget while overseeing the launch of over 200 new products annually. Earlier in her career at TRI-KES, Stacey served as Vice President of Marketing, orchestrating cross-functional initiatives that influenced a $40.5 million sales increase and positioned the company for acquisition. Her work has consistently driven revenue growth, market leadership, and customer-centric cultures, with a proven ability to scale businesses, enhance operational efficiency, and foster high-performing teams.  Stacey holds a Bachelor of Science in Journalism with a focus on Business Communications from The University of Kansas and completed ICF-Accredited Coach Training and Leadership & Professional Development Training at iPEC Coaching. Certified by the International Coaching Federation as a professional coach with an executive leadership focus, she founded Cardinal Point LLC in 2022, where she partners with leaders and organizations to amplify human potential. Her coaching philosophy centers on going deeper than goal-setting to explore the root of challenges, strengthen emotional intelligence, and create sustainable success. She works with clients on topics including leadership presence, communication, organizational effectiveness, resiliency, and work-life balance, utilizing assessments such as the Energy Leadership Index to build awareness and drive measurable results.  Grounded in a people-first approach and a commitment to fostering environments where teams do meaningful work, Stacey brings a unique blend of strategic vision and detailed execution to her coaching practice. Her extensive cross-functional expertise, creative problem-solving skills, and track record of leading through change and transformation make her a credible and valuable partner for individuals and companies seeking to clarify priorities, expand leadership range, and translate insight into impact.

bio: Steve Sobczak is a retired US Army Colonel with nearly three decades of distinguished military service, including senior leadership roles spanning strategic planning, healthcare operations, and global program management. Throughout his Army career, Steve served as Director of Health Care Operations, where he synchronized the Army Health System across five continents and eleven time zones, overseeing more than 150,000 employees, 23 medical centers and hospitals, and a $55 million annual budget serving 3.8 million beneficiaries. His responsibilities encompassed strategic and operational planning, medical readiness management, transformation initiatives, and crisis response coordination for organizations worldwide. Following his military retirement, Steve has continued to serve as a Strategic Planner and Performance Coach with the US Government and as a Leadership and Executive Coach with Stand Beside Them, a nonprofit dedicated to veterans and their families.  Steve holds a Bachelor of Science in Physical Education from The Citadel, a Master of Arts in Organizational and Human Resource Development from Webster University, and completed advanced leadership studies at the US Army Command and General Staff College and the US Naval War College. He also earned a certificate in Spiritual Direction from Sioux Falls Seminary, reflecting his holistic approach to coaching and development. Steve's coaching philosophy centers on helping warriors, athletes, and leaders discover meaningful lives filled with significance and self-belief. He specializes in guiding veterans through career transitions, leadership development, and mental performance coaching, drawing on his extensive experience in strategic planning, organizational transformation, and crisis leadership.  What makes Steve a credible and valuable coach is his rare combination of senior military leadership experience, deep expertise in organizational development, and genuine commitment to helping others find purpose and direction. Whether working with veterans navigating civilian careers, athletes building mental resilience, or leaders seeking greater impact, Steve brings a practical, outcomes-oriented approach grounded in decades of leading through complexity and change. His work reflects a belief that people can live their stories with meaning, joy, and purpose—and he comes alongside them to make that vision a reality.
headline: Retired Us Army Colonel, Healthcare Ops

bio: Stu Barnes is an ICF-accredited and ILM Level 7 qualified Executive Coach who brings 25 years of senior management experience to his coaching practice. Before founding Stu Barnes Coaching Ltd, Stu held a series of influential roles across UK government departments, including the Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office and the Department for International Development. As Head of Finance Capability and Head of Finance Profession, he designed and delivered financial capability programs for hundreds of staff, led strategic change initiatives, and served as Senior Responsible Officer for the Financial Leadership Programme. His career also included senior finance business partner roles advising Director-Generals and executive teams on multi-billion-pound portfolios, as well as positions at UK Trade & Investment and the Department for Business, Innovation and Skills, where he managed substantial budgets and drove value-for-money efficiency programs. A Chartered Institute of Public Finance & Accountancy qualified professional, Stu combines deep operational expertise with a passion for developing people and building organizational capability.  Stu holds a BA Honours in Geography from Royal Holloway, University of London, and earned his ILM Level 7 Certificate for Executive and Senior Level Coaches and Mentors from the British School of Coaching, alongside his Associate Certified Coach credential from the International Coaching Federation. He specializes in partnering with accomplished mid-career professionals—senior managers, executives, and business owners in their 40s and 50s—who are navigating career transitions, asking "what's next?", or seeking to accelerate their leadership impact while balancing ambition with well-being. His coaching philosophy centers on empowering clients to unlock confidence, gain perspective, and take intentional action, helping them shape their next chapter with clarity and purpose.  Grounded in both empathy and edge, Stu supports clients through career crossroads, leadership development, and personal growth. Whether stepping into senior roles, redefining career paths, or finding greater fulfillment and balance, his clients gain actionable strategies, expanded self-awareness, and the confidence to achieve senior promotions, broaden their influence, and define success on their own terms. With a proven track record leading capability development, coaching networks, and strategic transformation across complex organizations, Stu brings practical insight and a results-oriented approach to every engagement.
headline: 25+ Years in Finance Leadership

bio: Dr. Sumita C Ummat is a seasoned professional with over 24 years of experience spanning training, coaching, leadership development, emotional intelligence, and team mentoring. Her career includes significant roles at globally recognized organizations such as Ericsson, where she served as Customer Project Manager and Contract Manager leading project implementation teams, and HCL Technologies, where she held the position of Senior Program Manager overseeing Microsoft Projects, business development, and stakeholder management. Dr. Ummat has also contributed her expertise as an Associate Coach with the Center for Creative Leadership, delivering group and one-on-one coaching alongside assessments including 360-degree feedback, DiSC, and Hogan. Currently, she serves as CEO of Let Us Talk, where she spearheads strategic partnerships and collaborative coaching initiatives, and holds coaching roles with Boon, uExcelerate, and Sounding Board, bringing her deep leadership and facilitation expertise to diverse client organizations.  Dr. Ummat holds a Bachelor of Engineering in Electronics from Punjab Engineering College and has completed advanced coaching education including the Positive Intelligence Coach Grant Program and an EMCC Senior Practitioner credential in Coaching. She is credentialed as an ICF Master Certified Coach (MCC) and an EMCC Senior Practitioner (SP), reflecting her commitment to the highest standards of coaching excellence. Her recent certifications include FIRO and Psychodrama Coach Practitioner, further enriching her toolkit for personal and professional transformation. Dr. Ummat's coaching philosophy centers on empowering individuals and teams to identify their key strengths, fostering self-reflection and intrinsic motivation through creativity and experiential programs. Known for her dynamic communication, presentation, and leadership skills, she specializes in leadership coaching, mindfulness, wellbeing, and psychometric assessments.  With a proven track record of empowering large teams and mentoring leaders across industries, Dr. Ummat brings a unique blend of corporate operating experience and coaching mastery to her practice. Her work spans leadership effectiveness, team collaboration, and organizational transformation, grounded in practical, outcomes-oriented approaches. Whether guiding executives through complex transitions, facilitating group coaching sessions, or designing bespoke leadership development programs, Dr. Ummat partners with clients to unlock potential, enhance resilience, and drive measurable impact in today's dynamic business environment.

bio: Susan Barbee is the Founder and Lead Coach of GrowForward Coaching + Consulting, bringing a rich background as an HR business partner, management consultant, and hiring manager to her coaching practice. Her corporate experience includes serving as an HR Business Partner at Gagen MacDonald, a management consulting firm specializing in employee engagement, leadership, and culture change, where she created HR structures to enhance the employee lifecycle and expanded professional development opportunities. Susan has also partnered with diverse organizations—from nonprofits like After School Matters to manufacturing environments like R.S. Owens—delivering HR consulting, change management, performance management design, and leadership advising. Through her consulting firm Pathways Consulting & Coaching and contract engagements with Singularis Management Consulting and others, she developed proprietary career development programs and guided leaders through organizational transformation, focus group facilitation, and training delivery.  Susan holds a Bachelor of Arts in Psychology from Northern Illinois University, a Certificate in Organizational Development from DePaul University, and a Certificate in Human Resources from Oakton College. She is a Certified Professional Coach through iPEC Coaching and holds the Certified Career Services Provider credential from the National Career Development Association. Her coaching philosophy centers on helping professionals forge a more authentic and meaningful work-life experience by cultivating a holistic mindset that honors what matters most. Working from the inside out, Susan partners with clients to visualize their goals, identify what stands in their way, and take small steps toward bigger change—building the clarity and confidence needed for greater work-life satisfaction.  Currently, Susan also serves as a Personal and Professional Growth Coach with Boon Health and a Senior Transitions Coach with BRAVANTI, supporting leaders navigating career transitions and professionals seeking to increase resilience, productivity, and engagement. Her blended expertise in leadership development coaching, career and career change coaching, and wellness and mindset coaching—combined with her deep HR foundation—enables her to meet clients where they are and co-design right-fit plans that deliver meaningful outcomes. Recognized as a 2021 Official Honoree on the Global List of Influential Leaders and Entrepreneurs by Brainz Global Magazine, Susan is dedicated to unleashing potential and fueling growth for individuals and organizations alike.

bio: Susie Nilevsky is a career and leadership coach with over 10 years of experience in human resources and career development, having built her expertise across leading organizations in the construction and engineering sectors. She spent nearly a decade at EllisDon, progressing from Talent Acquisition Specialist to People and Culture Manager for Civil Operations, where she provided strategic HR guidance to senior leadership, led total compensation programs, and acted as a change agent in deploying initiatives that drove employee satisfaction and commitment. Susie also served as Human Resources Manager at Plan Group Inc. and Human Capital Manager at AG&E, where she managed the HR function across multiple offices, implemented compensation and talent review programs, and advised executive leaders on all human capital needs. Her career foundation includes recruitment and talent sourcing roles at Randstad, where she built pipelines of qualified professionals for consulting engineering clients.  Susie holds a degree in Social Science from McMaster University and completed post-degree studies at Sheridan College. She trained as a coach through iPEC Coaching, bringing a structured, evidence-based approach to her practice. With a passion for empowering individuals to reach their full potential, Susie partners with clients to identify their strengths, develop leadership capabilities, and advance in their careers. Her coaching philosophy centers on building lasting relationships, creating customized plans, and providing ongoing support tailored to each client's unique goals.  Susie's credibility as a coach is grounded in her proven track record of success in talent development, organizational design, and team effectiveness. Her deep experience advising leaders through sensitive employee relations issues, managing change, and facilitating performance management equips her to guide clients through complex career transitions and leadership challenges. Committed to making a positive impact, Susie helps professionals achieve meaningful career and life goals with clarity, confidence, and sustained momentum.

bio: Tammy Morris brings nearly two decades of leadership experience from Dow, where she advanced through progressively senior roles in environmental health, safety, and analytical operations. As an Environmental, Health and Safety Technologist Leader, she managed safety professionals, designed comprehensive industrial hygiene programs that reduced employee exposures by approximately 90%, and provided coaching and subject matter expertise that improved operational efficiency by 80%. Throughout her tenure at Dow, Tammy led cross-functional teams, developed training programs for over 700 employees, and championed process improvements that increased productivity, compliance, and hazard awareness across research, development, and manufacturing environments.  Tammy holds a Bachelor of Science in Biology with a minor in Chemistry from Texas State University and has earned her Certified Professional Coach (CPC) credential and Energy Leadership Index Master Practitioner (ELI-MP) designation from iPEC Coaching. Her coaching philosophy is rooted in the transformative power of conscious awareness and a renewed mindset—an approach born from her own life-changing experience with coaching. She is passionate about helping individuals overcome barriers that prevent them from walking in their purpose, enabling them to create positive impact both personally and professionally.  Currently serving as a Personal & Professional Growth Coach with Boon and as a Life & Leadership Coach through her practice, Powerful Transformations LLC, Tammy partners with clients worldwide to evoke meaningful change. Her unique combination of technical expertise, proven leadership in mentoring and developing over 1,000 people, and deep commitment to empowering others makes her a credible and impactful guide for those seeking resilience, clarity, and sustainable growth.

bio: Tammy Ouverson brings extensive senior leadership experience from the financial services industry, having held vice president and head-level roles at Fortune 500 firms including Voya Financial and ING, as well as OneAmerica Financial Partners and PCS Retirement. Over nearly two decades, she led business development, sales, and relationship management functions across corporate markets and field distribution, building a deep understanding of what drives performance and growth in complex organizations. Her career spans both established enterprises and startups, giving her a unique perspective on leadership across diverse business contexts.  As founder of Chatham Coaching and Managing Principal at NovusWorks, Tammy focuses on the "being" side of leadership—helping leaders deepen their identity, see the bigger picture, and elevate their impact. She is certified as a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) through the International Coaching Federation and holds the Certified Professional Co-Active Coach (CPCC) credential from the Co-Active Training Institute. Tammy also holds certifications in Everything DiSC and the Leadership Circle Profile, along with FINRA Series 7, 24, and 63 registrations. She serves on the advisory board and is past president of WIPN, advancing female leaders in the retirement services industry.  Tammy challenges the conventional view of leadership as a checklist or title, instead framing it as an identity, a mindset, and the handprint leaders leave on their work and the people around them. As a thought partner and coach, she accelerates leadership maturity and helps clients translate insight into measurable impact. Her practical, outcomes-oriented approach is grounded in real-world operating experience and a commitment to helping leaders navigate inflection points with clarity and confidence.

bio: Tanya Jaklis is the CEO and Founder of Tanya Jaklis Coaching, a boutique coaching practice that designs and delivers customized coaching experiences for individuals and organizations. With over 17 years of experience in international development and management consulting, Tanya spent nearly a decade at PwC as an Evaluations and Organizational Learning Manager, followed by senior consulting and management roles at Guidehouse and Grant Thornton LLP. Her career has been defined by engaging, impactful projects that drive meaningful change across diverse sectors and global contexts.  Tanya holds a Master of Arts in International Commerce and Policy and a Bachelor of Arts in Government and International Politics, both from George Mason University. She is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credentialed by the International Coaching Federation and earned her Certified Professional Coach designation from iPEC Coaching. Additionally, Tanya is an Energy Leadership Index Master Practitioner and a Certified Workplace Mindfulness Facilitator, having completed a Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction Certificate with Mindful Leader. Her coaching philosophy centers on helping leaders and organizations navigate change with calm, clarity, and confidence—pursuing goals without sacrificing well-being or experiencing burnout.  Tanya is passionate about creating sustainable environments where professionals can thrive with increased confidence, strengthened well-being, and heightened energy. She specializes in leadership and transitions coaching, offering one-to-one coaching, Energy Leadership Index assessments, and facilitated workshops on leadership and mindfulness. Her mission is to support 1,000 professionals in achieving their goals while fostering a contagious joy that ripples to families, communities, and workplaces. With her warm, approachable style and proven track record across consulting and coaching, Tanya brings both strategic insight and heartfelt support to every client engagement.

name: Taryn Hewett

bio: Taryn Hewett is Vice President of Human Resources Operations at AlphaSense, where she leads strategic HR initiatives that convert people strategy into growth acceleration and high-value employee engagement. Her career spans more than a decade in human resources, including senior roles at Greenway Health, where she served as Director of Total Rewards and Benefits & HRIS Manager, overseeing company-wide benefit and wellness programs, HRIS, compensation, compliance, and the employee experience. During her tenure at Greenway, Taryn spearheaded transformative initiatives including the creation of a new recognition model, the design and rollout of open PTO and paid leave programs, and the implementation of a new compensation structure. Earlier in her career, she held HR leadership positions at Target, where she drove team engagement, improved training metrics, and guided building leadership through coaching and employee relations. Taryn also founded Happy Thoughts Coaching, LLC, bringing her HR expertise and coaching practice together to support professionals in their growth.  Taryn holds a Bachelor of Arts in Communication from the University of Colorado Colorado Springs and earned her Certified Employee Benefits Specialist (CEBS) certification from The Wharton School. She is a Certified Professional Coach (CPC) through iPEC Coaching and holds an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) credential from the International Coaching Federation. With a passion for a dynamic work-life approach that breaks the typical "balance" mold, Taryn energizes employees and encourages them to thrive both personally and professionally. Her coaching philosophy is grounded in practical HR insight, strategic benefits expertise, and a commitment to fostering environments where individuals can flourish. Taryn's unique blend of operational HR leadership, professional coaching credentials, and hands-on experience designing programs that elevate employee engagement makes her a credible and valuable partner for leaders seeking to unlock potential, navigate transitions, and build thriving teams.

bio: Teresa Andreani is a Personal and Professional Growth Coach with deep expertise in leadership, life, and career coaching, and a specialized focus on supporting high-value employees in recovery from alcoholism and addiction. Since 2013, she has led Work In Progress Consulting Group, partnering with companies to create supportive workplace environments for employees in recovery through one-to-one coaching, facilitated dialogue, presentations, and coordinating sober support at corporate events. Teresa also serves as faculty for the Gestalt Institute of Cleveland's internationally recognized Coach Training Program and as an instructor in the Department of Psychology at Cleveland State University, where she teaches courses ranging from Social Psychology to Multicultural Psychology. Her earlier career includes owning and partnering in small businesses, providing marketing and business consulting services, and leading a nonprofit education foundation and alumni office for a large suburban school district.  Teresa holds a Master of Arts in Psychology with a specialization in Diversity Management from Cleveland State University and a Bachelor of Science in Business Management with a focus on Finance from Case Western Reserve University. She is an ICF Professional Certified Coach (PCC), a Board Certified Coach through the Center for Credentialing and Education, and a Gestalt Professional Certified Coach (GPCC) through the Gestalt Institute of Cleveland. Her master's thesis explored factors informing the decision of alcoholics in recovery to self-disclose in the workplace, reflecting her commitment to reducing stigma and fostering inclusive environments.  Motivated by her personal experience as a woman in long-term recovery, Teresa brings authenticity, compassion, and evidence-based insight to her coaching practice. She partners with employees and leaders navigating personal and professional growth, helping them build resilience, increase productivity, and thrive at the intersection of mental wellbeing and professional development. Through her work with Boon and her consulting practice, Teresa delivers professional development and wellness training to organizations nationwide, combining academic rigor, lived experience, and a Gestalt-informed coaching philosophy to create meaningful, lasting impact.
headline: Recovery & Workplace Coach

bio: Thamreen Khan is a Licensed Clinical Social Worker and Professional Development Coach who brings a unique blend of clinical expertise, nonprofit leadership, and policy insight to her coaching practice. With experience spanning mental health services, organizational development, and international relations, Thamreen has served in roles ranging from Director of Client Services at Zaman International to Director of Operations and Program Development at Open Door MK in the United Kingdom, where she secured £350K in government funding for homelessness initiatives. Her clinical background includes providing evidence-based psychotherapy at Alliance Behavioral Health Specialists and serving as a Crisis Clinician at Hegira Health, Inc., where she delivered solution-focused interventions to clients with severe mental illness and co-occurring disorders. She has also contributed to the Department of Veterans Affairs as a Social Worker and Respite Care Coordinator, managing interdisciplinary care teams in a 200-bed acute care facility.  Thamreen holds a Master of Public Affairs from the University of Michigan's Gerald R. Ford School of Public Policy, with a focus on international relations, and a Master of Social Work from Loyola University Chicago, specializing in Leadership and Development in Nonprofit Management and Health/Mental Health Services. She also earned a Certificate in Philanthropy and Nonprofit Management from Loyola and a Bachelor of Social Work from Cleveland State University. As a Professional Development Coach with Boon Health since 2020, Thamreen partners with clients using mindfulness techniques and goal setting to foster career growth, leadership effectiveness, and personal resilience through a holistic, well-being-centered approach.  Grounded in empathy, evidence-based practice, and a commitment to justice and accountability, Thamreen brings exceptional interpersonal skills and cross-cultural fluency to her coaching. Her track record in capacity building, program implementation, crisis intervention, and strategic organizational planning equips her to guide clients through transitions, build self-awareness, and translate insight into meaningful action. Whether supporting leaders navigating change or individuals seeking clarity and growth, Thamreen offers a warm, collaborative partnership rooted in proven clinical and organizational expertise.
headline: Former Healthcare Director

name: Tim Borgeson
bio: Tim Borgeson brings a distinctive blend of Big 4 audit experience and deep supply chain operations expertise to his coaching practice. He began his career as an external auditor at Deloitte and Ernst & Young, where he developed a rigorous analytical foundation and cross-functional business acumen. Tim then transitioned into supply chain planning and operations, holding roles at Glenair as Operations Supervisor and Materials Planner, followed by supply planning positions at dosist, Pratt & Whitney, and Meta. Currently, he serves as a Senior Supply Chain Planning Analyst at Johnson & Johnson, where he continues to apply his expertise in planning, inventory management, and operational excellence within a Fortune 500 healthcare environment.  Tim holds a Certified Professional Co-Active Coach (CPCC) credential from the Co-Active Training Institute and is Certified in Production and Inventory Management (CPIM) through APICS, combining professional coaching training with specialized supply chain knowledge. His coaching draws on years of navigating complex organizations, leading teams, and solving high-stakes operational challenges across diverse industries—from aerospace and technology to healthcare and consumer goods. Grounded in both analytical rigor and a people-centered approach, Tim partners with clients to clarify goals, strengthen leadership capabilities, and drive sustainable performance in dynamic business environments.
headline: Former Supply Chain at Deloitte, EY, Johnson & Johnson

name: Tom Waknitz
bio: Tom Waknitz brings a distinctive blend of senior technology leadership and deep human-centered practice to his coaching work. Over more than two decades, he held executive roles at GE Capital, Novell, and the State of Minnesota, where he directed an $85 million IT service portfolio and led enterprise-wide application development and transformation initiatives. As President of Revelation Network Management and Managing Director at Open Systems Technologies, Tom drove significant revenue growth, scaled teams, and delivered complex cloud and IT solutions for healthcare systems and enterprise clients. His strategic leadership at All Covered included oversight of a $55 million regional office and national enterprise practice, consistently building cohesive, high-performing teams and fostering cultures of continuous improvement and innovation.  Tom holds a Master of Divinity in Professional Chaplaincy from Liberty University and a Bachelor of Arts in Organizational Management and Leadership from Concordia University–St. Paul. He completed certified coaching training through Ideal Coaching Global, earning an International Coaching Federation credential in Ontological Coaching, and is a certified End-of-Life Doula through INELDA. Currently serving as a Chaplain with Lifespark and as Founder of One Million Tiny Lights, Tom also coaches individuals and organizations as a contractor with Boon, integrating mental well-being with professional development.  Grounded in a philosophy of "Transforming Together," Tom partners with clients to co-create what is possible by honoring the individual while lifting up the collective. Drawing on his executive experience in strategic operations, people development, and systems thinking—alongside his training in spiritual care and ontological coaching—he helps leaders navigate complexity, build trust, and translate insight into meaningful action. His unique combination of business acumen, coaching expertise, and compassionate presence makes him a credible and valuable guide for those seeking to lead with authenticity, resilience, and impact.
headline: 20+ Years Executive Leader at GE Capital

name: Tracy Lefebvre
special_services: Addiction / Substance Abuse; Anxiety / Depression; Burnout; Cancer Patients; Change Management; Conflict Resolution; Educators; Entrepreneurs; Executive Coaching; LGBTQIA+; Mindfulness and Meditation; Neurodivergence; Nutrition; Performance Management; Stress Management; Succession Planning; Technology Professionals; Trauma; Wellness; Working Mothers
specialties: ["Addiction / Substance Abuse","Anxiety / Depression","Burnout","Cancer Patients","Change Management","Conflict Resolution","Educators","Entrepreneurs","Executive Coaching","LGBTQIA+"]
bio: Tracy Lefebvre, Ph.D., PCC, is the founder and lead coach of Ready for Reboot, a strengths-based coaching practice she established in 2017. With over 1,500 hours of evidence-based coaching delivered, Tracy specializes in guiding C-suite leaders, new managers, women, and neurodiverse professionals through career transitions, leadership growth, and the complexities of real-world workplace challenges. Her coaching extends across multiple platforms, including Boon Health, where she delivers proactive, holistic coaching to enhance employee well-being, resilience, and engagement, and ImpactParents, where she coaches families with complex kids by blending lived and professional experience. Earlier in her career, Tracy owned and operated Misty Morning Children's Center and founded That Brain, Body, Mind Place, a Marietta-based hub uniting coaches, therapists, and wellness practitioners in an inclusive, strength-based environment.  Tracy holds a Ph.D. in Human Development with a focus on Evidence-Based Coaching from Fielding Graduate University, a Master's degree in Positive Psychology from Life University, and a Bachelor of Business Administration in Marketing from the University of Connecticut. She is a Professional Certified Coach (PCC) credentialed by the International Coaching Federation and a certified SanitySchool Parent Educator through ImpactParents. Her coaching philosophy is rooted in applied phenomenology, bridging evidence and empathy to transform ambiguity, challenge, and complexity into growth and resilience. Tracy describes her superpower as spotting patterns in ambiguous data, translating complexity into practical wisdom, and championing uniquely-wired minds—including neurodiverse and ADHD thinkers.  With more than 20 years dedicated to the question of how to create environments where both people and organizations flourish, Tracy brings warmth, candor, and research-informed insight to every engagement. She has led culture change and transformation projects across sectors, turning "messy" human stories into actionable, sustainable results. Whether guiding leaders through foggy transitions, cracking open team dynamics, or supporting inclusive and bravely curious workplaces, Tracy helps clients make sense of the "mud" and grow beautiful lotuses from it—delivering measurable outcomes and whole-hearted success grounded in both scholarship and humanity.
headline: 20+ Years in L&D & Coaching

name: Tricia Gehl
special_services: Anxiety / Depression; Athletes; Buddhism; Burnout; Change Management; Christians; Conflict Resolution; Creatives; DE&I / Belonging; Educators; Entertainment Professionals; Entrepreneurs; Executive Coaching; Finance Professionals; Government; Group Therapy; Healthcare Professionals; Hindu People; HR Professionals; International Business Relations; Introverts; Jewish People; LGBTQIA+; Marketing Professionals; Muslims; Nonprofit Professionals; Storytelling; Stress Management; Succession Planning; Technology Professionals; Wellness
specialties: ["Anxiety / Depression","Athletes","Buddhism","Burnout","Change Management","Christians","Conflict Resolution","Creatives","DE&I / Belonging","Educators"]
bio: Tricia Gehl is an impact-oriented career, leadership, and executive coach with extensive client experience spanning over 60 countries across six continents, all major global industries, and dozens of the world's top companies. Before launching her coaching practice, Power Groove Coaching, in 2018, Tricia spent more than a decade in Learning & Development at PwC, one of the Big 4 professional services firms. At PwC, she led large-scale onboarding initiatives, designed and facilitated classroom and virtual learning programs, created content for high-touch leadership development, and coached both high and low performing staff. Her work encompassed project management, stakeholder consultation, design thinking, and the development of coaching-focused learning programs that shaped talent across the organization.  Tricia holds a Certified Professional Coach (CPC) credential from iPEC Coaching, where she specialized in ELI-MP and coaching methodologies, and studied Creative Writing at Columbia College Chicago. She is certified as a COR.E Dynamics Leadership Dynamics Specialist (CLDS) and Performance Dynamics Specialist (CPDS) through iPEC Coaching, and her coaching philosophy centers on helping clients increase resilience, productivity, and engagement at the intersection of mental wellbeing and professional development. Currently, Tricia serves as a coach with multiple platforms including Ama La Vida, MYNDUP, Inspire Nurse Leaders, and Boon Health, and contributes as a content writer and learning designer for iPEC Coaching.  With a foundation in both corporate learning and diverse coaching contexts, Tricia brings a practical, globally informed perspective to her work. Her cross-industry expertise, combined with her background in curriculum design and facilitation, enables her to partner with leaders navigating career transitions, building leadership capacity, and driving meaningful impact in their organizations and communities.
headline: Former L&D Leader at PwC

name: Tristan Thornburgh
special_services: Accountability; Anxiety / Depression; Burnout; Confidence; Conflict Resolution; Educators; Extroverts; Finance Professionals; HR Professionals; Marketing Professionals; Performance Management; Procrastination; Stress Management; Technology Professionals; Wellness
bio: Tristan Thornburgh is a career and leadership coach with more than a decade of experience across marketing, go-to-market strategy, and leadership development in technology and financial services. He has held senior roles at Charles Schwab, where he directed digital marketing campaigns that increased ROI by 20 percent over five years and built a social media sales training program that generated $3.1 million in revenue, and at Indeed, where he led global marketing and enablement programs for strategic agency partnerships and oversaw a Work Wellbeing Initiative that drove approximately $5 million in annual revenue. His career also includes foundational work at Bleacher Report, where he helped grow the social media department from zero to three million daily unique users, and recent work at Torch, where he built the account-based marketing and field enablement function supporting enterprise sellers.  Tristan holds a Bachelor of Arts in Journalism and Communications from the University of Oregon and completed the ACSTH Pathway in Career Coaching through The Academies Inc. He is an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) credentialed by the International Coaching Federation. Since 2021, he has coached more than 75 leaders across technology, finance, healthcare, and professional services, focusing on communication, leadership behavior, and decision-making inside complex organizations. His coaching work incorporates ICF-aligned methods, 360 assessments, and CliftonStrengths, and he has been recognized as a Top 15 Career Coach in Portland in both 2023 and 2024.  Tristan's unique combination of hands-on marketing leadership and formal coaching training allows him to help clients navigate career transitions, strengthen team dynamics, and lead through high-stakes decisions with clarity and confidence. His approach is grounded in understanding behavior change and what motivates leaders to act, shaped by years of translating complex products and evolving markets into compelling narratives that drive results. Whether working with emerging leaders or seasoned executives, Tristan brings practical insight, strategic thinking, and a commitment to helping clients expand their leadership range and achieve measurable impact.
headline: 10+ Years Marketing at Charles Schwab

bio: Valerie Jones is the owner of Valerie Jones Coaching and founder of The Selfish Woman Movement, where she has specialized in personal transformation for over 20 years. She is also the author of The Selfish Year, published by Wiley, and host of The Selfish Woman podcast. Valerie has served as a Core Coach at BetterUp and as a coach with Boon Health, bringing her expertise in deep transformation work to high-achieving professionals navigating identity, purpose, and fulfillment. Her career also includes entrepreneurial ventures as the owner of Haven Designs, an interior design business, and as a weekly columnist for The Daily Courier, where she wrote on fashion and style.  Valerie holds a Certified Professional Co-Active Coach (CPCC) credential from the Coaches Training Institute and an Associate Certified Coach (ACC) designation from the ICF UAE Chapter. She also studied Writing and Publishing at Okanagan College and earned a diploma in Business Administration and Management from Camosun College. Her coaching philosophy centers on radical reconstruction rather than surface-level fixes, guiding accomplished women—and elite high-performers of all genders—through divorce, career transition, burnout recovery, and the quiet crisis of realizing the life they built no longer aligns with who they are.  Valerie's work is grounded in helping clients dismantle performance-driven identities and rebuild on their own terms, moving from achievement to sovereignty. She partners with powerhouse women asking "Is this all there is?" and "What do I actually want?"—and with high-performers ready to stop over-functioning and create alignment across mind, body, and soul. Her credibility rests in decades of transformation architecture, a published body of work, and a commitment to helping clients become not just impressive, but free.
headline: 20+ Years in Personal Transformation

name: Wendy Carter
special_services: Executive Coaching
bio: Wendy Carter is an ICF Professional Certified Coach (PCC) and founder of Emerge Development Solutions, where she empowers leaders, teams, and organizations through transformative coaching and strategic leadership development. Her career spans marquee organizations including The Walt Disney Company, where she served as Senior Manager of Enterprise Leadership Development, and AdventHealth, where she held progressive roles in leadership and talent development. Wendy has also worked with Fortune 100 senior leaders as an Executive Coach at LHH, serves as Faculty at the Center for Creative Leadership, and facilitates group learning and peer coaching for women executives at Chief. Earlier in her career, she built foundational expertise in human resources and talent acquisition at Deloitte, Citigroup, and AIG, giving her a deep understanding of organizational dynamics and leadership challenges across industries.  Wendy holds a Master of Human Resource Management from Keller Graduate School of Management of DeVry University and a Bachelor of Arts in Corporate Communication from City University of New York at Baruch College. She earned her Certified Professional Coach credential from iPEC Coaching and is certified in a wide range of leadership assessments, including DiSC, MBTI, Predictive Index, Benchmark 360, and EQ-i 2.0. Her coaching approach, grounded in authenticity, empathy, and collaboration, is rooted in what she calls The Alchemy Framework—a trauma-informed methodology that transforms leadership challenges into breakthroughs driving profit, productivity, and performance. Wendy partners with individuals and teams to improve communication, build stronger teams, develop more effective leadership styles, and achieve measurable results while fostering self-awareness, resilience, and compassion.  What makes Wendy a credible and valuable coach is her unique blend of corporate leadership experience, deep human resources expertise, and commitment to holistic, personalized development. She has been recognized with multiple awards for her dedication to diversity and going above and beyond in her work, and she brings a practical, outcomes-oriented philosophy to every engagement. Whether working with senior executives navigating complex transitions or emerging leaders seeking to unlock their full potential, Wendy creates a safe and supportive environment where clients can explore their aspirations and emerge equipped, inspired, and ready to lead with confidence.
headline: Former Leadership Development at Disney, Deloitte

name: William Shriner
special_services: Change Management; Confidence; Leadership / Professional Development; Mindfulness and Meditation; Relationships; Thriving in daily life
bio: William Shriner is an organizational development expert and leadership coach with deep experience spanning healthcare, automotive, energy, and public sector organizations. As President of WGS Consulting since 2011, he partners with individuals, teams, and organizations to improve performance through a blended academic-practitioner approach rooted in positive psychology. William has served as an Organizational Development Consultant at Henry Ford Health, where he leads culture change, assessment, talent management, and coaching initiatives across the health system, and previously held senior OD roles at DENSO as North American Organizational Development Consultant and Senior Leadership Business Partner, St. John Health (part of Ascension Health), and DTE Energy's Fermi Nuclear Plant. Earlier in his career, he managed organizational development and training services as a lead consultant for Oakland County's Human Resource Department and consulted with clients across healthcare, automotive, and banking industries. His expertise in leadership assessment, high-potential development, and talent management has shaped initiatives for leaders at all levels across multiple sectors.  William holds a Ph.D. and M.S. in Industrial/Organizational Psychology from Wayne State University and a B.S. in Business Administration and Psychology from Winona State University. He is credentialed as a Professional Certified Coach (PCC), reflecting his commitment to coaching excellence. Since 2002, he has served as adjunct faculty at Wayne State University, Walden University, and Capella University, teaching master's and doctoral students in human resource management, organizational design and development, leadership, and industrial/organizational psychology, and serving as a dissertation chair and committee member. William currently provides leadership coaching through Thrive Partners, Boon Health, and Instructional Connections, supporting leaders and students across industries and geographies.  Grounded in rigorous academic training and decades of hands-on organizational practice, William brings a unique combination of scientific insight and real-world impact to his coaching. His work helps leaders navigate complexity, build effective teams, and drive sustainable performance improvements, making him a trusted partner for individuals and organizations committed to growth and transformation.
headline: OD & Leadership Coach

name: Yoshi Hashimoto
special_services: ADHD; Anxiety / Depression; Burnout; Change Management; DE&I / Belonging; Executive Coaching; Finance Professionals; HR Professionals; International Business Relations; Marketing Professionals; Nonprofit Professionals; Performance Management; Storytelling; Stress Management; Technology Professionals
specialties: ["ADHD","Anxiety / Depression","Burnout","Change Management","DE&I / Belonging","Executive Coaching","Finance Professionals","HR Professionals","International Business Relations","Marketing Professionals"]
bio: Yoshi Hashimoto brings over 20 years of cross-cultural corporate experience leading global, diverse teams through change across the US, Europe, and Asia. His career spans marquee roles at Goldman Sachs, where he worked in Investment Banking within the Telecom, Media, and Technology sector and was promoted to Vice President as one of the youngest at the time, leading M&A, private equity investment, and financial advisory engagements. Yoshi later held senior leadership positions at Elsevier, including Vice President of Marketing, where he led a team of over 30 individuals globally through an Agile marketing reorganization, improving the Employee Net Promoter Score from -75 to +33 while delivering on commercial objectives. His corporate roles also encompassed Sales Operations, Corporate Strategy, and Revenue Enablement, managing commercial execution and transformation projects. Throughout his career, Yoshi has directly coached and supported over 200 individuals from around the world in their leadership development.  Yoshi holds an MBA from the Wharton School, a BA in Economics from Keio University, and completed the Executive Creative Leadership Program at THNK School of Leadership. He earned his coach certification (CPCC) from the Co-Active Training Institute and an Associate Coach Credential (ACC) from the International Coaching Federation in 2021. Yoshi is also certified in Hogan Assessments and the WorkPlace Big Five Profile, an individual and team assessment tool created by Ray Dalio and Adam Grant. In 2021, he founded TeamUp Leadership, an executive and leadership development and organizational health consulting firm, which he now leads full time alongside coaching roles with the Center for Creative Leadership, The Russell Partnership, and other organizations.  Yoshi partners with organizations and leaders to build high-performing, highly engaged teams and talent that consistently deliver exceptional results in evolving business environments. His coaching philosophy is grounded in practical, outcomes-oriented support, helping clients navigate leadership transitions, strengthen team dynamics, and drive sustainable performance. With deep expertise in cross-cultural leadership, organizational transformation, and talent development, Yoshi brings a unique blend of strategic insight and hands-on operational experience to every engagement.
headline: Former VP at Goldman Sachs
